The positives of the film are the camera work and special effects, which are pretty good. Also Darrel Hammond of SNL did a terrific imitation of Johnny Depp in Pirate's. The negatives (I'll try to make it brief) are the writing, which is terrible, the acting, where everyone tries their hardest to be funny, and it ends where nobody is, and everything else. I have no idea why somebody would think it would be funny to parody Chronicles of Narnia. Other unfunny parodies in this are Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Harry Potter, Nacho Libre and Snakes on a Plane. All of those spoofs were awful too. This was one of the most god-awful pieces of .... I've ever seen, and I highly recommend you never see this, for it may cause you to never laugh again.My rating: BOMB/****. 71 mins. PG-13 for language and sexual humor.

Have you ever been in a movie wondering how long before it would be over, but it just kept going and going?I hate to say it, but this movie was just -plain horrible-. The idea of Epic Movie sounded funny (and could have been successful) but they failed horribly in its scripting and production.** The PRIMARY fault of this movie was they tried WAY too hard. Every chance they had to make some type of knock off they did, regardless of how funny it actually was. Also, there was entirely too much slapstick - like the producers though every person getting hit in some weird way would automatically make the movie more funny. **I feel very comfortable saying that I got my money's worth from finding out that Reno 911 was getting its own movie. The previews were by far the best part of this horrid flick.My final thoughts: If you really want to see this movie, just wait till it comes out in the discount theater (if you have them.) Or else just rent it on DVD. No reason wasting 5, 8, 10 dollars for a ticket.Hope this helps :)

The first time I watched this movie, I was in tears of laughter. But as I viewed it again and again, I started to realise that the jokes weren't funny. The acting is terrible, which, does give a slight good effect to the comedy of the film. The slapstick and obviously fake injuries are also quite funny. The storyline is weak and doesn't make sense in some parts.I would only recommend this film to late teens and early adults. Other people may not find this movie appealing, and even some younger people don't find this funny. Some of the scenes are pointless and not funny. You either like this comedy or you don't.The film seemed to drag on and I wanted to get out. I will conclude by saying if you like slapstick comedy, you'll like this film.

reviews.review_title: This Film Actually Put Me In Pain
reviews.content: The spoof movie was started in the hilarious AIRPLANE!, the trend continued with THE NAKED GUN and TOP SECRET, those were funny movies, it has since turned itself into a horrible, money controlled scheme to take peoples hard earned cash.EPIC MOVIE (about as epic as a kindergarten play), is and I'm going to emphasize it as hard as I possibly could a horrible, horrible, HORRRIBLE movie. I actually got a headache watching this piece of crap. It makes PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE look like POLTERGEIST, JAWS, PSYCHO and THE SHINING'S greatness combined.None of that hasn't bee said before. But let me tell you this film is about as funny as a funeral. No worse, as funny as going to prison. The film tries to rely on it's "jokes", which are no better then fart and poop jokes. My 5-year old cousin could've wrote a better script.so, in another words, only watch this if someone else's life in is danger.

very lame, not a single original piece of humour most people would be better off buying all the individual movies that it horrendously attempts to parody.there was no imagination in the writing of this movie at all very much stolen scenes and obvious jokes however unfunny they were.the poor special effects and props during this movie would be acceptable if they were used intelligently, rather any money for effects and props was probably spent on dancers and choreography and trying to put together several scenes of rap and hip hop which i am sure any fan of rap and hip hop (i'm no such fan though) would be ashamed to hear

reviews.review_title: Spoof films are becoming very unfunny
reviews.content: Epic Movie is so painful to watch, swallowing a cyanide capsule might be a better alternative. There are four orphans, each of them from the movie The Chronicles of Narnia. This movie begins by showing the audience the background of each character. Lucy is from the Da Vinci Code, Edward is from Nacho Libre, Susan is from Snakes on a Plane, and Peter is from the X-Men Series. First off, none of these films are "epic", they barely take themselves seriously. Then, the four orphans end up recovering a gold ticket for an epic adventure from the Willy Factory (Charlie and the Chocolate Factory). What follows is a series of unfunny exploits that tries to spoof Pirates of the Caribbean, Harry Potter, Talladega Nights, Casino Royale, Mission: Impossible 3, Superman Returns, Star Wars, The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift, Shrek, Click, Borat, V for Vendetta, Scarface, Harold and Kumar Go To White Castle, American Pie and Beerfest. However, if you think it ends there, you're wrong. They also parody Punk'd, MTV Cribs, 50 Cent, and take unfair cheap shots at other celebrities and shows. The film goes from one reference to another, never creating any valid storyline or joke. The characters they do parody end up doing dance routines (Jack Sparrow and Willy Wonka). Friedberg and Seltzer, the duo behind this awful film, need a How To Book on how to Satirize Films-The Right Way.

There are some great moments in cinematic history. One of them is in this film- in the unrated version- where the Audra Lynn steps out of the closet (copy of the one from Narnia: Lion, Witch, and Wardrobe) like a demigoddess from an ancient Greek legend. Its a surreal - almost Jungian - moment- and one of the most unforgettable scenes in film history.If you have a problem with beautiful female nudity- then this particular moment will be totally lost on you.The rest of the film- is home video quality though. A few strained laughs here and there, probably best watched drunk.

This movie was so hilarious....way better than Scary Movie 4!! The dumb character, Lucy, was so funny!! she was so stupid!!! this movie, with everyone hating it, don't listen to them, and if you hated Date Movie, don't worry this movie is so much better and funnier, the Charlie and the chocolate factory scene was so funny! anyways give this a watch, you will either die of laughter or die of boredom, but in the end if you actually give it a chance, you will probably end up dieing of laughter, believe it or not, after leaving the theater, my stomach actually hurt from laughing so hard!!! anyways give it a watch and get ready to laugh!!

reviews.review_title: According to IMDb, the worst movie I've ever seen...
reviews.content: I recall pushing through the theater exit and thinking, "that was the worst movie I've ever seen." I was a little bit confused about what had just happened, and that none of my friends seemed to share my sentiments, but I was too deep in shock to think much of it. The memory of that day quickly faded, and I was able to resume normal life thereafter......Seven years later and I'm hit with a moment of deja vu. I had just seen a preview for one of the Scary Movies (2 I think?), and my mind started scanning through all the crappy films I'd ever endured. For the life of me, I could not think of this title, but I was so positive in my disgust that I began searching for it -- starting with IMDb's list of the worst 100 movies of all time. I began at the #1 spot, passed a Paris Hilton flick along the way, and finally landed on #53, Epic Movie. THAT WAS IT.Epic Movie! I knew the title was just as abysmal as the content! The funny thing is, I haven't seen any of the movies ranked lower than this. It's officially the worst movie I've ever seen. Since I'm obliged to say why it's so bad: The jokes are distasteful for any age group, the parodies are weak, the cast literally could not be worse together, and the plot is so aggravatingly predictable and boring (from what I can remember -- I refuse to watch it again).Congratulations to my brain's waste management system. It erased this title clean out of my head. Two thumbs down. Would not recommend.

reviews.review_title: High vote for character imitations!!! And it's too much
reviews.content: I have seen this movie recently, and i must say it's pretty stupid. I saw Date Movie a few months ago, and i was disappointed. So, this time I knew this film would be catastrophic too.But the one thing that makes this movie watch worthy is character imitation. Sam L. Jackson, Mel Gibson, and especially Johny Depp as captain Jack Swallows. That guy that played him (captain) should get some award for the impression. And also Vince Vieluf made me laugh as Woulwerine. Oh yea, imitation of Silas is memorable.So, characters themselves are funny but the jokes are for retards. Seriously. If you like to see this film, do it but only once. But first, grab some beer or whiskey or whatever... And also movie is very short, so it will not make big damage to your brain.Good luck and take care!!!

If you are expecting a gut busting comedy,then you should stick with another movie.It isn't bad,but it has some dumb moments that I wish weren't in there in the first place.It has some funny moments,but most of the acting is so crappy that I can guess why so many people hate this movie.But I didn't hate it.Instead,I enjoyed it for what it was.But I suggest that you watch the unrated version.It's longer,nastier,and a bit more funny than the PG-13 version.There is a somewhat decent cast,which consists of Kal Penn,Jennifer Coolidge,and Tony Cox.Overall,'Epic Movie' isn't terrible,but it doesn't quite get it right.

reviews.review_title: I liked this movie thought it was funny
reviews.content: Comedy's r meant to be silly it's what makes them funny this is just a funny spoof movie

reviews.review_title: You should know what this is!
reviews.content: Let's star off by telling you what this movie isn't, it's not a big budget classic comedy film that'll be on the top ten list of anyone. It's not a block buster that'll stand the test of time. It's not The Naked Gun or Hot Shots either. So what is it? It's funny, it's what you expect in a knock off of the big budget block busters that it makes fun of. I've read numerous reviews from people who spent their entire review trashing this film. This was evidence to me that they clearly had no clue what they were going to see. Any time a film is not made available for critics before being released you should know it's not the greatest movie ever made. My suggestion is you watch this film understanding what it's not and just lighten up a tad.
He hits rock bottom with this rendition of poor satire films. Shame he recruited kal penn for this, an otherwise fine actor

reviews.review_title: Should have been good... but it's so awful it's plain embarrassing
reviews.content: Where do I start with this film? (Slight Spoilers).First off, there were three moments in this film when I smirked gently, and reluctantly. The first being when 3 Hogwarts teachers were killed, the second when the four main characters woke up abandoned, and doing a typical heroic charge were all slaughtered with in seconds. The third was the Superman parody. I did say 'smirked gently'.I've got to say that I'm amazed that at the time of writing, there are 602 "10 star" ratings. Nobody in their right mind would award this a 10. I found it an insult to my backside that I sat through this drivel  but mercifully the filmmakers didn't have enough material to make a normal length movie. This is very shot at 68 minutes, and frankly, that is something of a blessing.Okay, I'll try and justify why I'm so against this movie in a series of points. Hopefully some people will listen and save themselves the price of a cinema ticket. I'll cap this at ten points to keep this post short(ish).1. Every joke falls flat. Every single one. 2. The quality of writing is appalling. People urinating or being sick just isn't funny. Especially not when it's done as badly as this. 3. You genuinely despise the writers by the end of the film  to the extent where you are loathe to even smile. Jokes about large breasted woman are especially unfunny when you realise that they use them because they didn't have any material to fill the gaps. 4. Oh look. Gay jokes. A gay beaver and part dear/part human joke should be funny  but it just isn't. 5. The acting is depressingly bad. I genuinely felt embarrassed watching these people make fools of themselves like this. Comedic acting is an art form which is hard to get right, but here there is no comic timing, line delivery or posture. It's just a bunch of people dithering from disjointed scene to disjointed scene. 6. The music is diabolical and irritating. I don't get hip-hop anyway, but putting in several hip-hop tracks to fill in time like this is plain insulting. 7. All the "funniest" parts of this movie are in the trailer. 8. Even the choice of movies that is parodies is unimaginative. 9. This movie tries to offend everybody, but it's done so badly that it is like an irritating drunk prat mouthing off in a chat room. 10. The public deserve more intellectual respect than this film offers. Seriously, this movie treats you like a moronic simpleton. We can handle clever jokes - maybe these guys just couldn't write them.I've got to put this to the people voting this a ten. Why? What possible justification is there for this sexist, unfunny, badly written cash-cow crap to get a ten?So... Just don't subject yourself to this. These b@stards have already made a fortune, and they don't deserve to make a penny more. I hope that those involved in the high-level decisions have ruined their careers, I really do. I hope they sack the two writers responsible, and force the remaining 4 "Scary Movie" to sit down and write something that is genuinely funny for a change.If you feel that you want to argue with me about this, you either have not seen the film, or more probably are scoring lower IQ results than the bedding you sleep on. (so your post will most likely be ignored.)Come on people, let's tell them we're not going to take this!

reviews.review_title: Rule #1: You Do Not Talk About Epic Movie
reviews.content: I don't even know where to start. This was most likely the dumbest movie I have ever seen. The only reason why I didn't give it a 1, was because I felt bad for Jayma Mays and Kal Penn.From incredibly retarded characters, bad attempts at humor and awkward parodies, to a plot that makes you want blow your own brains out so you wouldn't have to watch it. This movie made my eyes and ears bleed. Who the hell thought of this.To those of you who say 'You need a sense of humor to find this funny', I say you actually have to be either extremely retarded or a five-year-old who would laugh at anything. This movie is anything but epic. 'Biggest waste of $20.000.000' would have been a more accurate title.Now to look at some positive aspects. I think the end credits were pretty good. That feeling I got when the movie ended, it was like I had just survived the apocalypse. You really should avoid this movie. Don't even rent it. Just forget this ever existed.

reviews.review_title: worst movie I have ever seen (seriosuly)
reviews.content: Epic movie was so bad that if I was paid $1000 or less I wouldn't see it again. This movie's comedy was not even funny. They tried to pull of the "it's so bad it's funny" feeling, but trust me...they did not even accomplish that which is not very hard to do. And as I sat there in the cinema watching this mind numbing piece of $hit I felt like I was having a near death experience. I was praying to God that the movie would finish and was on the verge of leaving the cinema. The movie was made in an extremely unprofessional manner and there is countless amounts of noticeable mistakes. Movies like "Date Movie" and "Scary Movie 4" which I both hate are pieces of gold compared to Epic Movie.If I had to rate this movie out of 10 I would give it a 0.000000003/10

reviews.review_title: Not so bad as they say
reviews.content: I saw this yesterday and while it didn't leave me in hysterics, it was suitably funny. I'll agree that some of the scenes were drawn out too long and the hip-hop montages could have been cut out for the most part. But aside of the albino monk's stupid comments, some of it was quite funny. A lot of folks who don't like it are upset that their favorite movies got the job in here, and while it could have been better, it was heads above Date Movie, which didn't make me laugh at all. It's above average, but not great comedy by any stretch of the imagination. If you're looking for a good goof on the most recent "blockbusters," this is your flick.But see it during the day and don't pay full price. I didn't. *grin*

reviews.review_title: Christians need not (necessarily) avoid this film.
reviews.content: Epic Movie has only been screening here for a few days and I had planned on seeing it eventually. What caused me to go see it sooner was a thread in the IMDb discussion forums which pretty much accused the film of being an attack on Christianity.Well that settled it. I HAD to go see it because I work for a Christian ministry that is forever fielding calls from worried parents, afraid of the effects the media might have on their children.Admittedly Epic Movie primarily spoofs The Lion The Witch And The Wardrobe, a story that has a strong Christian parallel; but I don't see it an attack on our faith, simply because very few non-Christians are aware of that parallel. If anyone takes exception to the Also character (and he WAS pretty objectionable) I don't think the writers intended it as a blatant attempt to offend us.Taken on its own merits, don't go see the film if you want some intellectual stimulation. It is in the same genre as the Scary Movie series so if you liked them then you will probably like this. If you didn't then go see something else. I personally enjoyed the opportunity to sit in a cold cinema for an hour or two, out of the harsh Australian 41 degree heat.
...is that I can't rate this movie any lower than a 1. Spoiler alert: this movie is trash and everything from Friedberg and Seltzer is wet, steamy garbage.

Epic movie is a spoof of many different movies. Just a few of the movies that it spoofs are The Da Vinci Code, Snakes on a Plane, Nacho Libre, X- Men: The Last Stand, and Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, But it mostly spoof The Chronicles of Narnia. Epic Movie come from the two of the six writers of Scary Movie who also wrote Date Movie.Epic Movie is about four kids who wind up up in the land of Gnarnia (Spelled with a "G" for legal reasons). The are needed to defeat the White B&?$# of Narnia.Epic Movie is very funny and filled with laughs. If you liked Date Movie and The Scary Movie series then you will like Epic Movie without a doubt!!!!

I saw this movie tonight as a settlement, I was dying to see Smokin' Aces which opened tonight. Unfortunately Aces wasn't playing anywhere locally and I said oh well I'll go see this. Worst decision ever. The entire movie was stupid slapstick 4 year old comedy. Not even one intelligent joke throughout the film. This was the first film I've ever walked out of and the hour I gave it was the biggest waste of my life to date. I honestly had a better time when I broke my wrist. I could think of 100's of horrible things that would be more enjoyable than this film. Otherwise there's not much else to say about it, awful movie I absolutely hated it.

Lighten up people! I don't think this film is as bad as everyone is making it out to be. Maybe it's because the movies it was spoofing were not too good. It definitely wasn't as bad as Date Movie. I found it to be funny. The characters were likable. Also the acting was good. The plot was very simple, but then so was Narnia, the main movie it was spoofing. It also spoofs Willy Wonka & Pirates of the Caribbean to a lesser extent. I wouldn't rank it with some of the great comedies, but if you have a sense of humor you'll laugh. Give it a chance, and don't take it seriously & you'll enjoy it. If you're expecting an academy award winner, keep looking.

Seeing that this movie was written by the 2 writers that produced that utter vile piece of crap Date Movie I knew this would not be worth seeing, coupled in with the fact that even the trailer wasn't funny.But fortunately I got to see this for free, and used up time that was not my own to waste to see it. I did not laugh once during this movie, nor was it in the least bit entertaining, and there was no discernible plot to speak of. The jokes were lame, the attempt at spoofs was almost non existent, and it was like they were referencing movies for the sake of referencing movies with no rhyme or reason to it.When a movie is made it is expected to entertain, this movie is tantamount to scamming the viewers who paid money into the pockets of those behind this trash and thus ripped a lot of people off.

WoW This Movie Is Sad It Made No Sense. I Did Not Laugh One Time In This Movie And People Are Saying Its Funny? The Storyline Was Dumb What Was The Point To This Movie. The Main Reason Why I Don't This Movie Is Because I Love Comeny And Date Movie And Scary Movie 1,2,3,4 Were Funny And The 2 Writers From Those Movies Made This One So I Was Thinking It Would Be Funny And Omg Its Not. I Think No One Should See This Movie Only If You Want To Throw Away Your Movie Then Go Ahead And Buy This Movie. I Hope Scary Movie 5 Is Not Made My These People That Made This Movie If So I'm Not Throwin My Money Away Again. And That's Why I Disliked Epic Movie.P.S Don't Make No More Epic Movies Pleez.

Sorry but why would you do this? Why would you make a film mocking some of the most popular, loved, critically acclaimed and money- making films in this p1ss- soaked cesspit of time- wasting cr ap- the fact that it even dares to call itself a movie is astounding.I honestly don't know what they were thinking, perhaps they were high at the time because this is neither funny nor worthwhile, just forget it and pretend it never existed- it's the first movie I've ever seen where half the people left before the end.(p.s. why does Kal Penn, who was great in 24 season 6, Harold and Kumar, and Van Wilder sign himself up for such rubbish as this and Van Wilder 2?)

Yeah ok, it's not the best spoof movie and some parts are rather lame, but it has some good moments too. So if you like these kind of movies, why not?
The real problem is that 90 percent of it is based on a really lame picture, 'Narnia'! Rather than excite you like a Marvel pictures spoof or an action movie take off, you feel immediate rejection at the 'Narnia' settings and characters
Can you imagine a 'Scary Movie' based on the 'Narnia' movies?
If you start off with such a boring sense-dulling film series as your reference point, then it's an uphill battle to get anything worthwhile out of it

"Epic Movie" (*1/2 out of ****), a lewd, lame-brained, lackluster lampoon of Hollywood movie epics with look-alike actors impersonating celebrity stars, lacks anything approaching either epic proportions or hilarity. The two guysJason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer--that wrote and directed last year's "Date Movie," an amusing enough parody of romantic 'chick flick' comedies, don't fare as well in their attempt to send up big budget adventure sagas. Comparatively, "Epic Movie" isn't a fourth as funny as "Date Movie." Okay, you'll smile a lot when you watch "Epic Movie," recognize the movies that Friedberg and Seltzer are ridiculing, but you won't laugh out loud or laugh so long or hard that you miss the next three sight gags or verbal puns. Unfortunately, most of the humor is half-baked adolescent antics. Moreover, when the jokes fall flatas they often do, Friedberg and Seltzer fall back in desperation on lowest common denominator clowning, such as having their characters spell their names in the snow with their own urine. Other instances include spitting, drooling, breaking wind, projectile vomiting, and slurping up raw sewage. Friedberg and Seltzer skewer a number of Tinsel town blockbusters, principally "Nacho Libre," "The Chronicles of Narnia," "Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle," "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory," "Scarface," "Click," "Snakes on a Plane," the "X-Men" trilogy, the "Harry Potter" franchise, the "Pirates of the Caribbean" flicks, "Superman Returns," and "The Da Vinci Code." "Epic Movie" follows the exploits of four twenty-something orphans drawn together in a common goal to save themselves from a wicked plot concocted by a madcap Willy Wonka (Crispin Glover) who wants to cannibalize their body parts for his tasty new chocolate bars. More by misadventure than design, our quartet of protagonistsLucy (Jayma Mays of "Red Eye"), Edward (Kal Penn of "Van Wilder 2"), Susan (Faune A. Chambers of "White Chicks") and Peter (Adam Campbell of the TV's "Commando Nanny") obtain tickets to tour Willy's magical kingdom of chocolate. When our heroes and heroines realize the pot into which their body parts are about to be stirred, they try to escape Willy's premises by ducking into an apparently ordinary wardrobe (a free-standing, old fashion closet) and wind up in the land of Gnariathe G is silent for legal purposeswhere they stumble upon land of enchanted animals. Some of these creatures are part beast and part human, and they are locked in a battle for survival against a dastardly dame (Jennifer Coolidge of "American Pie") appropriately named the White Bitch. Kal recognizes her immediately in one of the film's few clever moments: "It's Stifler's mother!" She captures Kal, and he divulges the whereabouts of his cohorts after a pirate captain (Darrell Hammond of TV's "Saturday Night Live") tricks him into a confession. Happily, our protagonists elude the notorious White Bitch and link up with the half-human/half-beast rebels led by Also (Fred Willard of "Date Movie") who is the half-man/half-lion that leads the insurgents."Epic Movie" does an adequate enough job of imitating its source material, but a good parody must do more than imitate. The best parodies mock the clichés and conventions of its source material by revealing the absurdity that lies beneath those formulaic elements. Most of the time, however, "Epic Movie" only imitates. Furthermore, "Epic Movie" rarely exposes the absurdity of the movies that it derides and more often than not what should be absurd ends up being asinine. The opening scene that pokes fun at "The Da Vinci Code" is as witless as the nitwit character that it introduces. A later scene where a Samuel L. Jackson look-alike actor spouts blasphemous language constantly, like a compact disc stuck in repeat mode, is just as cretinous. The goal of a good parody is to stand something serious on its head to show how goofy it can be from another perspective. Neither "The Da Vinci Code" nor the "Snakes on a Plane" scenes reveal the lunacy behind the plots. "Epic Movie," however, wastes a first-rate cast. Christian Glover of "River's Edge" is ideally cast as the sinister Willy in the Johnny Depp role from "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory." Similarly, Darrell Hammond's impersonation of Johnny Depp's Captain Jack Sparrow from "Pirates of the Caribbean" is dead letter perfect. In "Epic Movie," he is called Jack Swallows rather than Jack Sparrows. Ha, ha, right? Jayma Mays does a better job of spoofing Anna Faris from the "Scary Movie" franchise than Anna Faris does playing herself. Meanwhile, Jennifer Coolidge is appropriately villainous as the White Bitch and Fred Willard excels as the brave lion Also, both of whom hail from the "Narnia" film.One of the best scenes shows Harry Potter as a 50-year old and his girlfriend Hermione Granger as a pregnant, chain-smoker who lets her full to bursting belly bulge from beneath her blouse. This scene works nominally better than most because the actors in the "Harry Potter" movies have grown older than the actual age of their characters. Another good joke involves the talking beaver from the sleep aid TV commercial who helps our heroes and heroine in this efforts to defeat the sorceress.

reviews.review_title: Makes you want to watch a Leslie Nielsen spoof instead.
reviews.content: OK I admit, this movie was bad. I'm not the kind of person who easily jumps on the wagon when basically everybody says a particular movie is beyond bad. I mean, I actually liked "Soul Plane" for what it was and I think its OK to laugh at a silly Leslie Nielsen every now or then. But "Epic Movie" is just plain and simple a bad movie, with no redeeming qualities.So, what is the problem with "Epic Movie"? Well, what isn't? First of all it just seemed to me that the writers at advance made a list of all 2006 movies they wanted to spoof. Then they thought to themselves how to connect all those different spoof sequences and make one whole move out of it. The end result is unfortunately what the poor viewers got presented. There is not obvious connection between everything which makes this a terrible disjointed spoof to watch, with something that is supposedly supposed to be a story but feels more like a labyrinth, that goes from left to right and flips over, with behind each corner a total different movie it spoofs, as you go through this mess they call a movie.On top of that, this movie just really isn't funny. Seriously this is the best they could come up with? I mean, it's not like 2006 didn't had any good spoof-able movies. There were so many opportunities for them but instead they came up with incredible lame and unfunny sequences, characters and dialog. It makes you wonder, didn't the actors realized that what they did just wasn't funny? Why didn't they just quite and walked off the set, that would had saved them a lot of embarrassment.The movie still has some good production values and is good and professional looking, which is basically the only reason why I just can't rate it any lower.2/10http://bobafett1138.blogspot.com/

reviews.review_title: The Funniest and Rudest Comedy Since American Pie and How Did The BBFC 12A Become A 15 On Video
reviews.content: The Best Funniest and Rudest Comedy Film I Watched Since American Pie This Is Better Than American Pie I Couldn't Stop Laughing At This Film and Also How The BBFC 12A Become A 15 On Video It's Ridiculous The Film Getting A 15 On Video and A 12A The Film Should Have Been A 15 All Together I Love The Snakes On A Plane Parody That Was The Best Perhaps The BBFC Need To Consider Giving A Film Like This A 15 All Together

This movie isn't dreadful, but it isn't that great. It's always a bad sign, in my view, when the funniest scenes involve mistreating midgets.Jayma Mays may have a career playing Anna Faris once Anna Faris is fed up with playing Anna Faris.Some of the jokes are OK, most are not that good. It was a mistake to concentrate so heavily on The Lion, The Witch And The Wardrobe, particularly as Adam Chambers is so unequal to the task of playing the Peter character. The portrayal of the Tumnus character was just awful.I'm not as negative about this film as many seem to be, but it's really difficult to work up much sincere enthusiasm.

I'm all for (good) spoofs like the Leslie Nielson movies (Spy Hard, etc) or Hot Shotz, which focus around a main movie, then add little scenes referencing other movies, throughout. THIS, is not even a movie. It is a string of scenes pasted together, constantly going from one movie to the next, and TRYING to make it funny. It's not even trying to tell a story, it's just spoof for spoof's sake. I'm only fifteen minutes into it, and I think they've already tried to spoof seven or eight different movies. They try WAY TOO HARD, rather than make the spoofing more subtle, like it was meant to be. It's like they are trying to ram it down your throat and say "look, it's a spoof movie so that means its automatically funny. Don't worry about a plot or even a cohesive flow to the scenes!!" I am sooo forgiving when it comes to movies, but this is the most horrible piece of drivel I've honestly seen in a long time, if ever. Please don't watch this movie.

I wouldn't bother criticising this movie if I didn't usually like movies of this genre. I laughed in Scary Movie (well, in parts). I howled in all of the Austin Powers films. Blazing Saddles is one of my all-time favourite movies. But Epic Movie was bad on an epic scale. I laughed once in the entire film (perhaps due to a sugar high from the vat of coke) and although my friend and I raised the average age of movie-goers in the cinema by about 15 years, none of the kids were laughing either. With so much material to choose from, the decision to focus on The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe for 90% of the film was misguided and oh, how it dragged. If we hadn't paid London prices for our seats, we would certainly have walked out, and frankly both regret we didn't. I want to sue for 83 minutes of my life back. Please, for my sake if not your own, do not watch this film!!!

This movie is awful. It did make me laugh about a 3's worth, but there was so much bad that i had to drop it to a 2. Cringeworthy, random, obnoxious, gross, lame, slapstick garbage. It was jaw-droppingly bad numerous times (about 2 viewings, 3/27/2021)

It's not very often one has the opportunity to rate a movie as low as this one. But this movie seems to have something special that few movies can boast: very low quality. The original concept of the lampooning of real epic movies is a good concept, and the potential satire in this type of project is, or should be, a gold mine. Historically, these types of movies have been reasonably successful, and most of them rate at least a 5 on a scale of 1 to 10. But the uniqueness of this effort allows it a rating that only few producers can have nightmares about.Some of the adolescent, and pre-adolescent audiences may find this story, and all of it's gags, to be funny. But not enough to make it successful. For most adults, however, this film probably misses the mark by a mile. With all of the gags being hinged together so loosely, and with no credibility or sensibility attached to pull them off, one can only hope the movie ends as soon as possible. In comparison, the first few installments of Scary Movie were funny, proving that the concept and format has a chance. But unless you have about an 8 year old mentality, and then are willing to let anything pass for entertainment, you may think twice about paying to see it. This gross, and raunchy type of humor is for children who get their parent's okay to watch it.Unfortunately, the theatrical trailer is better than the overall production. There should be a warning for those kinds of things.

reviews.review_title: Second Verse, Not like the first.
reviews.content: The last time I saw a parody film that I thought was surprisingly okay was Date Movie. I gave that an 8 out of 10. People probably thought I was something of insane, but I actually enjoyed it. I thought it was funnier than Scary Movie 4, for sure. Jason Friedburg and Aaron Seltzer must have realized that their movies make a nice mint, because they made a sequel titled Epic Movie. I guess what I thought was funny for Date Movie, they just duplicated with different movies, and the result, probably to their dismay, was just not good. Here's the story: 4 orphans (Kal Penn, Adam Campbell, Jayma Mays & Faune A. Chambers) who have no real connection to each other, since they lived in different parts of the world and coincidently, live in different movies (Kal's in Nacho Libre, Adam is the Superhero parody, Jayma is the Da Vinci Code, and Faune is Snakes On A Plane), have all met based on the finding of a chocolate bar, which leads to Willy's Factory. Willy is maniacal, and wishes to use the orphans for his candy. They escape into the large wardrobe into Gnarnia, where the four discover they are the only ones who can save this mystical world.The movie has great ideas, but does not execute them well. Some "jokes" (If you could call them jokes) have slight humor only in that they are recognized in Pop culture today, such as the Snakes on a Plane reference where Samuel L. Jackson (Only an actor, not really him) states that due to the internet, the only thing he's most recognized for is his famous quote which he repeats to annoying affect. By the 3rd shouting of this quote, it started to become obnoxious that the writers have indeed, made their point. Why continue? Also, do not be deceived by the title. It says Epic, and many would define "Epic" in the sense of film as something that is legendary, such as a lot of the classic films like "Ben-Hur" or "Gone with the Wind", or "The Sound of Music", where the budget was no where near as important as the story telling, and people preferred the Quality of the movie instead of how much money went into it. What the creators define Epic is any movie out now that is overblown to large proportions based on Controversy, content, recognized quotes, or anything else that would not define a film connoisseur's taste for what Epic would be.Some of the humor, and by "some", I'm really trying to find points that are funny, can actually provide a laugh, but expect a "Ha- Ha" moment. Not a laugh that you would get from watching Airplane! or a classic comedy Jerry Zucker film. The film parody section, like the Zombie section or the Family Travel film section in Hollywood has been played to death. This stuff is beginning to come off as a get rich quick for stringing a bunch of movies together with no real plot connecting them into a 80 - 90 minute film. There are much funnier parody films out there. Chances are you have probably seen them already. Go pull them out of your tape case or re-rent it and have a bowl of popcorn and sit home and watch a movie. Trust me, you'll have more fun listening and probably quoting Leslie Nielsen's movies than sitting through this "Movie", if it can be called that.I rate this a 3/10.

reviews.review_title: not as good as Scary Movie and not *quite* as terrible as Date Movie
reviews.content: In spite of many horrible comments, I thought I should check out Epic Movie because when it comes right down to it, all these sorts of low-brow, multi-film spoofs get terrible comments. So I want to try and put this movie in the context of its siblings.Epic Movie is not as bad as Date Movie. Date Movie was painful, it was agony to watch and I gave up on it pretty quickly; maybe 20, 25 minutes. Epic Movie is more along the lines of dull with occasional amusing bits (notably a silly running gag of one character repeating another's lines). This is not to say it doesn't have painful moments (particularly anything based on MTV/Hip Hop/street culture. I watched about 35 minutes and then began to fast forward looking for amusing bits without much luck. So I probably wound up actually seeing about half the movie.Scary Movies 1 through 3 were all much, much better than Epic Movie. I don't have a strong recollection of Scary Movie 4. I don't think it was as good as the first 3, but would say it was still several steps up from Epic Movie.There's no real reason to see this movie, but at least it's not Date Movie. As to why Epic Movie is in IMDb's bottom 100 and Date Movie is not, I have no clue.

This movie is so confusing and sucks the life out of anyone watching it. A lot of the jokes do not land at all, instead they crash furiously into the ground and catch on fire. Straight up looks like someone made a movie out of a skit show, but instead of focusing on one skit they focus on all of them at the same time, even overlapping and making zero sense at many points throughout. They have an actor from Nacho Libre in the movie, but he ISN'T in the Nacho Libre parody. WHY??? HOW??? WHAT??? If you plan on watching this with friends, get ready to send out apology cards with a complimentary fruit basket because no one is going to like it or you afterwards. Avoid if possible but be prepared to be disgusted and utterly confused by the majorly unfunny jokes that have meet the movie screen.
What's the point to try to create a comedy if you're the worst producer ever? Disappointing...

It wouldn't surprise me if this is the WORST movie I ever seen in my whole life. This is a parody film that spoofs other movies like X-men, Da vinci code, Pirates of the Caribbean etc. Many people I know said it was bad and I thought "Well, it can't be that bad".. so I watched it, which I regret.. This is the worst piece of junk I've ever seen, everything in it is terrible, like the lame jokes (I think I had only 2-3 chuckles of the whole movie) that was just exaggerated and childish, the plot, the mixing of the films.. it was just long-drawn. I can't understand how I could stand the whole movie. Save your money and time on this one, and don't watch it. This is just trash that was made to earn money.

I can't possibly understand how anyone could even think of laughing at the film. Except for possibly teenagers, and right away that told me I wouldn't like the movie.I also don't know why anyone would try to make another knockoff of a genre after Date Movie was even attempted. The stupidest jokes are inside Epic Movie. The writers have maxed out everything from the gay faun and beaver to kicking people out of a window and even to that guy from the DaVinci Code spoof who spoke Latin but didn't really "speak" Latin. That was attempted in Scary Movie 4 (with Cindy and the Japanese boy). The writers have to think of fresher ideas.Another thing that bothered me was the amount of recycled actors that had previously appeared in Date Movie. Could we get someone new? The shortness of the movie was also a problem. It's a little more than an hour long, and most of the scenes are filler material. The filler material also got me really upset. The film maker has to justify putting in a bunch of half clothed women just to make the audience pay attention. That shows the mark of an amateur film maker, who thinks he can get a movie to be watched by filling the movie with nudity.In conclusion, don't waste your money on this. It's garbage.

Epic movie is one of the worst movies I have seen this year. Wow this movie was completely unfunny and a big joke. The plot is pretty much made up and random spoofs just happen as the characters go on. I'll admit that I found this better than disaster movie but slightly. Unlike disaster movie, this film had some quite more entertaining and funny scenes, but too much stupid garbage to be really considered any good. Though I liked the beaver spoof, the click remote, the faun character, there's was a few others but honestly overall this movie was just painful to watch and was a mess. And the movie wasn't even funny. The so called "jokes" were non-factors, and just missed.I hope the players involved in this undertaking rethink their priorities and turn their lives around to benefit themselves and uplift the human condition. Otherwise they should take up a new vocation. This movie is beyond awful.As a rewatch 10/03/22' and nearly 14 years after the initial watch, opinions for the most part remain the same. Although watched the unrated version this time around and there were slight noticeable differences (more cursing, longer extended scenes). It was funnier as a whole though very briefly. Even though the film is a mess and tries too hard in being funny, it is not meant to be taken serious.One of the better spoofs was the Samuel L. Jackson Snakes on a Plane reference. Also another positive are the celebrity actor look-a-likes (The Jack Black, Mel Gibson) were portrayed quite well. Rating changed from 1 to 2 (due to the unrated version).

reviews.review_title: Not terribly funny,I'm afraid.An Englishman writes........
reviews.content: Pip Pip!What a jolly swizz,eh,what?Paid out a few smackers to watch this bally nonsense with no one a chap's ever heard of in it with the low sort of jokes even that cad Flashman wouldn't tell whilst he was roasting a new oik.Every so often the cast stops to perform some dashed odd sort of jerky dance that they clearly think is deucedly funny don't y' know,but I don't think Herr Strauss had in mind when he wrote "The Blue Danube",can't imagine the queen or young Albert going in for that sort of thing - thank The Lord. Always thought the bally Yanks were an odd bunch,y' see but me niece tells me that Lincoln feller is freein' the slaves,what?what?so I guess some of 'em are almost as good as Englishmen,but blessed if I could see any evidence of that in "Epic Movie". That d----ed Jonathan Swift has a lot to answer for if you ask me.

My class organized a big movie event for when this was in theaters. I went because some rich kid was paying for it, and, hey, free popcorn. The theater was awesome. Largest, cleanest seats I've ever seen. This cannot be said for the movie itself, though. Stupid, offensive jokes. Oh, and don't see any of these movies if you're LGB. Plenty of gay jokes in these movies. I cannot believe that all the kids, seventh graders, all laughed at every joke. It was horrible. Even worse, now they think 'epic' means 'a funny movie'. The movie made fun of every movie better than it. This is how the movie goes: This movie wasn't originally hilarious and bad! Let's stick stupid sluts and fart noises in! Now here's a guy in a dress! There's a fat guy! Throughout the entire movie.

This movie was really really funny. A great movies for teenagers to go with their friends for a good laugh.I like the fact that they did Scary Movies, Date Movie, and now Epic Movie. They should do something like Dramatic Movie or something...that'd be so funny.I loved the stupid girl, she was the funniest ever...gotta love her. I looooove how the White Witch is Jennifer Coolidge...she's such a funny actress. And its good to see a well known actor/actress in this movie.It was a great laugh for me and my friends,and I really enjoyed it. Good Job. xxx

reviews.review_title: About as anti-funny as a 'comedy' movie has ever come
reviews.content: With virtually everyone in agreement that this is a truly dreadful film, I think the real question is whether 'Epic Movie' surpasses 'Disaster Movie' as the most unfunny comedy movie of all time.Both were a struggle to sit through without wanting to punch the TV and both failed to make me laugh once. Neither of them deserves the 1 star I'm unfortunately forced to give them, but at least I've reserved my one stars for films I'd rather gouge my eyes out than watch again (and 'Epic Movie' comfortably falls into that category).Spoof movies like this are never going to be a hit with everyone, but you at least expect something more than a bunch of unimaginative, stale, unfunny gags, and that's all this movie has to offer. 'Airplane' is an example of how to make a successful spoof film that actually makes people laugh rather than roll their eyes.

This movie started out kind of funny but then it got really dull and boring. I know these movies aren't supposed to have great scenes with great acting and directing, but you are not supposed to be bored. I for one was bored. This movie is definitely worse than any 4 of the scary movie, movies by far. It has some funny parts, but they are few and far between. The acting was actually fairly decent, but that can only take you so far. Plus, any 3 year old could have made up the ideas themselves.Iwould not suggest anybody to see this, because the ideas are like a home made movie you could see in something like you tube. Do not waste your time.

reviews.review_title: This is the greatest superhero parody ever!!
reviews.content: The funniest scene is when Jack Sparrow runs over (hilariously) the 4 main character and Borat says "Just kidding!!" and slaps his a**!! The unrated version contains full-frontal nudity, and uncensored (and funny) language!!

reviews.review_title: I hope the world has mercy on them.....
reviews.content: This piece of junk cannot be compared to any movie possibly imaginable.This has got to be one of the top 3 worst "movies" (if it's possible to call it that) of all-time for eternity until the human race vanishes.There is no plot,there is no decent acting and these parodies were just painful to watch.It just looked like of bunch of drunk losers that were so bored they went to the video store, rented all these movies and asked themselves how they could make it so stupid people will think it's funny. How in the world did this get to a studio ? Some guy who had a friend in Hollywood went up to him and asked him if he could make a piece of junk that will look good in the trailers. "Sure that's a great idea Joe! Let's get a huge budget,take a bunch of pretty successful films,take some actors that will pretend they're drunk and let them soil their future careers,make a lot of vulgar and stupid jokes for the piece of trash with no plot that Britney Spears can enjoy, mix it all together and we get a huge grossing crap that people will go see to waste 8 bucks on to leave after 20 minutes! It's perfect!" I walked out after a half hour of torture and I couldn't sleep at the thought that I actually sat in that movie theater.I was so ashamed I didn't leave the house for 3 days. I advise people to stay as far possible from this,for your own health. This is the perfect way to kill yourself if you are thinking about suicide.If you enjoy this ,you should seriously consider therapy.I give it a 0, and I could even give it a negative number rating. Trust me , rolling down a cliff and until you get a serious headache is more fun than this.

If you're looking for a teaching aid to demonstrate how *not* to do almost any kind of humor in a movie, then this is perfect. This movie is virtually laugh-free.I saw this movie when I was a young teen and I thought it was fairly entertaining—but now I realize the errors of my ways.In fact, this movie is a piece of tripe. The gags are not just unfunny, they are incompetent. The writers/directors expect us to find it funny that they throw reference after reference in our faces, in place of original humor. It's acceptable to use references to other movies as humor, but they obviously don't understand that to do that you mustyou mustwell, let's just say only a certain, gifted few can write comedy well.The best thing I can say about this movie is that it's well made.

reviews.review_title: Wow did this movie suck. Far worse than I expected.
reviews.content: I know that spoof movies are always so-so. I know this one got bad ratings. But I sort of like spoof movies so I rented it anyway. When I say this movie sucked it is an insult to the word suck.There is very little to like about this movie. I guess the sets and costumes are pretty good so the visual aspect of the spoof works. But the writing is SO bad there is no saving it. It just isn't funny.This movie was Battlefield Earth bad. This movie was Ishtar bad. This movie was WORSE than Catwoman or Krull. Seriously, don't give it the benefit of the doubt and "give it a shot". You will regret it.It's in the IMDb bottom 100 for a reason.

reviews.review_title: Can be funny but not so great. Only worth about 3 bucks.
reviews.content: I give it a 5 out of 10. Even though some of the actors seem to have talent, I guess the storyline and the script and everything just wasn't good. It really doesn't deserve its title "Epic Movie" because well, it WAS NOT epic.. It was.. somewhat decent. On the other hand, it did give me some laughs, so I can't say it was an entirely bad movie. It actually has humor in it, but it can also get a bit disturbing.. I suppose this movie was meant to be utterly stupid.. so you just have to be the kind of person that is able to laugh at this kind of stupid stuff, and make a fool of other movies (even if you do love the movies it makes fun of.) In conclusion, this movie kind of sucked, but it can cause a few laughs. To be honest, I WOULD watch this movie again, but only for a few bucks. This is one of those movies that I'd see again if I can either pay 3 bucks for the DVD or watch for free on something legal like Charter on Demand. If you can laugh at immaturity and forget that nothing makes sense, maybe you can live through this.

Four orphans are given a different chance in life when they accidentally find lucky golden tickets. This is not actually a movie, it's a parody, or, better said, a series of parodies, put together in on single film. It tries desperately to make fun of every single known brand hoping to make everyone laugh but it doesn't get even close. It doesn't have any essence, any complexity, any idea of a story, just sequences joined together with "glue", hoping that something might come out of the final product. It has so many goofs and faults that it makes you wonder if it was really finished. Not to mention the actual characters which are as stupid as a rock can be. It had one single upside, the music (good music unrelated to anything from this movie). Overall, you cannot even consider it a movie. Even so, it's bad...it's REALLY bad. For your own good, just don't watch it!

This movie to me was such a waste of talent and money from people paying to watch films. I had to make myself stay to the end. While everyone around me was laughing their heads off, I was mostly annoyed. Of course, most of the people watching the same time as myself were Jr. High age or down. Napoleon Dynamite was better than this one and I hated that movie. I would recommend to anyone wanting to watch this, to wait and rent it because it is not worth the admission price at a theater. Overrated according to the comments I have heard about this movie. Younger people seem to like it but as I said they are Jr High age or younger.

reviews.review_title: How was no one able to stop this from existing?
reviews.content: I am an aspiring filmmaker and when I see all the endless scores of promising indies being lost in the festival pile it's tragic because I can relate to their pain, and their anxiety at not knowing if they're going to make it. "Hollywood is incredibly competitive, there are a million talented people out there trying to do it." So they say. And so I've grown a healthy jadedness about Hollywood, but do occasionally enjoy a good mainstream satire, even if it promises to be Sophomoric. But this film was so atrocious that it invites several questions, all along the lines of "How the f--- did this film make it so far?" If they had taken any writer from any decent TV show and said "you have a week to make a parody of every trendy film from the last year" they would have all come back with something better than this. How the hell did David Carradine, Fred Willard and Jennifer Coolidge attach their name to something so atrocious? Are Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer living in a complete f---ing vacuum? They don't have other writers that they can ask for advice? Friends? Family? Janitors? Is everyone they know completely mundane, ignorant and juvenile? At first I thought, "whatever, I was stoned, laughed a couple of times, only ten bucks." But then I thought about the moral irresponsibility of leaving so many filmmakers out in the cold and welcoming this garbage into Hollywood and it made me furious. Constant kicking of things around, breast jokes, fart jokes, vomit jokes, deus ex machina's, poor production choices, dishonest satirizing that doesn't even seem to understand what elements of the films quoted are worthy and appropriate for satire. I really, really hope that Seltzer and Friedberg throw in the towel, or have their feelings HURT out of over bad reviews and really change their perspective and philosophy on film-making.
I'll keep this short and sweet: under no circumstances must you watch this film.1/10: Doesn't even deserve a proper review

This movie is REALLY bad! I use to like spoof movies (Scary Movie's series is great!) but this one is pure trash! The "joke scenes" (if we even can call them that!) are just so ridiculous, stupid and childish that are totally unfunny! The entire film has no sense at all. It's just a bunch of spoofing scenes from different movies without any coherence or fun! OK that I didn't watch a great part of the original movies that this one is spoofing (usually the spoofing movies are funnier when we have watched the original movies before), but even so it has no fun at all.Another thing that annoyed me was the cheap imitation of the Ana Farris character type. The dumb girl's character that Ana Farris use to do in the Scary Movie's series is cheaply imitated in this movie, but in a way that it's truly disgusting! Ana is great doing the "dumb girl", but Jayma Mays (the girl who played that character in this movie) was just terrible! I suppose it's not her fault because she even seems to be a good actress. The problem is really with the production of the movie which is pure trash!

As much as it pains me to rate this low, for nostalgia reasons, it is pretty bad.I mean it has some slapstick fun moments, but since it's just based on popular movies at the time, it really doesn't hold up nowadays, since most people won't even know the references (and even I've forgotten them).I'm sure this was pretty funny at the time, and I love parody movies, but out of all of them, this one is among the weaker ones, simply because its pop culture jokes aren't that fun, or as fun as they could've been.

A K.I.S.S. (Keep it Simple Stupid) Review....Epic movie was trying to be a big hit comedy spoof when the trailers came out for it. It's bandwagon like trailer brings people into seeing it and then eventually going, "Why did I ever waste 10 Dollars on a film this awful?!" The trailers were obviously supposed to bring a 'funny movie', but unfortunately the trailers were* the funny parts. Enough said.Now about the movie: When I came in and saw the movie the first thought that went into my mind was.... "Oooooookay, was this supposed to be funny in this part?" Now mind you barely some parts were stupidly funny (As in teasing the movies they used) Most of the actors were poorly picked for the parts we god awful as well, except the man who played Captain Jack Sparrow, or rather in the movie, Captain Jack Swallows, did actually sound close to Johnny Depp. Personally I feel Carmen Elektra would do any part to make money for anything when she played Mystique since she might be close to bankruptcy, you never know.Overall put, the movie....not funny. The movie tried to be "too funny" to be funny at one time. If you ever plan to see this, take my advice...don't go! Poor cheesy quality jokes, Very sick humor, A plot line that could of been good if only they would have had different writers for the movie. If you enjoy senseless jokes and talking, or just simply spoofing movies senselessly watch it. If not, then steer clear of it then just pretend you have never heard of the "EPIC" Movie...

reviews.review_title: A Movie of truly epic proportions.
reviews.content: What is it with the bad reviews this film is getting? It is full of epic chuckles, and witty, thoughtful writing. If you were expecting Battleship Potemkin, you were looking in the wrong place.The actors are all in top shape, and all do great parodies, especially Borat and Rosie O'Donell. I think Horatio Sanz was also remarkable, as if he's ever NOT remarkable. It should be nominated for a Palme d'Or of LAUGHTER! I had the chance to watch this hilarious movie on the plane back from Orlando, and Tammy couldn't stop laughing, i was afraid the air marshal will ask us to stop laughing, you know especially after 9/11 and all. Even Tammy's friend Larisha loved it and she didn't even like Barber Shop 2! This is the funniest piece of cinema of all year after Mr. Woodcockit reminded me of early Chaplin.
You know what, I was expecting more and those days of scary movie type films just won't go down that well with a snowflake generation. It's silly & crap but it's what we watched it for right?

Parody: Noun. "An imitation of the style of a particular writer, artist, or genre with deliberate exaggeration for comic effect."Airplane was a parody of the Airport movies. Blazing Saddles was a parody of Western movies. Hot Shots was a parody of Top Gun. And so on. What did these movies have that "Epic Movie" didn't? Well first of all they were movies with an attention to the plot, a vision of how to properly portray the parody and actual jokes. These jokes ranged from clever visual gags, to clever wordplay, to just ridiculous situations. Epic Movie had none of those. Instead what we got was gross out humor, jokes that are stretched way too long and pop culture references. Lots of pop culture references. You know, things that a year later are no longer relevant or are, in and of themselves, not funny?Here's an example, they're "spoofing" the "Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe" or the first Narnia movie. And then just throw in pop culture references. In the first five minutes we get bits from "Snakes on a plane", "Nacho Libre", "The DaVinci Code" and something else I can't quite remember because it's so forgetable. Are you laughing yet because this is the formula for the rest of the movie. Something happens, pop culture reference. Something else happens, pop culture reference. Something follows and is followed by a pop culture reference. These aren't "jokes".An actual example of the movie is the Satyr, I can't be bothered to check his name, is showing one of the main characters around his place. And it suddenly turns into an episode of MTV Cribs. Where's the joke? The only purpose is for people to look at that scene and say, "I know where that's from!". And this goes on for 90 minutes and ends with Borat. It's 2019. Who remembers Borat? This instantly dates the entire movie whereas movies like the ones mentioned before are still funny to this day.There is no reason to see one of these movies by Seltzer and Friedburg. You're only encouraging them to make more.

I would vote zero if I could, but unfortunately, I can't, therefore it's getting the next possible vote (1). It's full of crude humor, has a horrible plot line and the pointless appearance of scantily-clad women in random scenes. Obviously, they re-used the same cast from Date Movie, and simply recycled much of the previous movies. It was hardly an 'epic', and simply just butchered some of my all-time favorite films like Pirates of the Caribbean and Harry Potter. There was also excessive punching and kicking of random characters. I believe this gets extremely old and boring after being repeated a few times.I've watched it thinking that it would be okay considering some funny scenes in the previous 'Scary Movie' trilogy, however, I was proved wrong. I did not finish the entire movie, as I refused to endure any more of this nonsense. I think my intelligence rate was lowered by a significant percentage after seeing this. However, as a teenager aged fourteen I can safely tell you, whether you are my age, younger or older, please refrain from seeing this movie if you don't want to see your favorite epic films made fun of in a tasteless and rude manner.

reviews.review_title: This is an example of a "movie" where the title serves as a lie.
reviews.content: "Epic Movie" (2007), this is another rookie mistake that people make in the world nowadays; calling something "epic" before it actually occurs. Probably the area suffering the most is the industry of film and television. That's really starting to get on my nerves, where someone says: "this is going to be epic", or "I'm looking forward to an event of epic proportions", and so on. If you have the nerve to call something "epic" before it happens, then you had better be accurate with your predictions! What happens if the event, or movie, is a total bust? Well then, you'll sound and look pretty stupid, wouldn't you? Any way, I've made my point, now let's get to the review (rant) of this "film". It's probably no surprise that this is one of the top 10 worst movies I have ever seen. Lazily pointless story, horrible acting, cheap special effects, boring sets/locations, and finally a cliched predictable dull soundtrack to tie this diarrhea stain together. The story, or lack thereof, is just a cliched plethora of subplots with a cliched boring narrative and cliched snore fest that goes absolutely nowhere. Now don't get me wrong, I love parodies when they're done right. But this "movie" does it wrong in every sense of the word, and then some! Plot? What plot? What did I just watch? It's like I hit "play", watched the "film", nothing happened, it ended, who cares? Kind of like the train wreck known as "Diner" (1982)! This "movie" has some of the worst direction that I have ever seen. Keep in mind, this "movie" has two directors. Yet, they still somehow managed to screw it up! Speaking of the film crew, what in the world were they on while making this "movie"? Whatever they were smoking/drinking, they must have overdosed. What brain operated by a flickering bulb, with broken gears would be stupid enough to green-light this garbage?! A parody movie like this had potential to be funny, but they forgot one thing: the humor. The real tagline of this "film" should be: "a comedy movie, but without the humor". As far as the acting goes, it is so dreadful, that it almost should be illegal! Most of the so-called performances are so bad, that it leads you to question: "what were you thinking?!" Or another question, "what kind of direction were the actors and actresses given?" As for the special effects, the majority of them look cheap, cheesy and generic. Therefore, the special effects have not aged well. The sets/locations look dull and boring, and most of the interior scenes were obviously filmed in a studio. When it's obvious you can tell that a movie is filmed in a studio, that's a problem! Isn't it? Finally, the musical score is cliched, predictable and tired. No part of the score is memorable at all. "Epic Movie" (which it isn't), is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. It angers me how bad it is, but it's also boring in some places. Those are the two worst things a movie or show can do to me, bore and anger me. This "film" is so bad, that I'm embarrassed for anyone subjected into making it. Even though they don't deserve any sympathy, they knew what they were signing up for! "Epic Movie" should be required viewing for film students in college, so they can learn the basics on how not to make a movie, to avoid ruining the future of cinema! There is nothing positive I can salvage from this waste of film making. I'm giving this "film" 0 out of 5 stars on my scale. If I could rate it 0 stars I would, but 1 is as low as I can go. Ignore the 1 star rating, my true rating is 0 stars. The only positive thing I can gather from watching this "movie", like most other bad movies I've seen, is that I'll never have to watch it again. Stay away from "Epic Movie", trust me, I'm saving you 93 minutes of your time!

THE absolute worst film I've ever seen. My 6 month old niece could write better jokes than the ones in Epic Movie. The funniest thing about it is the fact it's so bad! I considered walking out half way though, but felt I should stick it out as it may help me appreciate good cinema a little bit more.In some ways I would actually say go and see it. You'll come out stunned that anyone could produce such a terrible thing and be amazed at how little acting talent the cast has. It says it all that the best actor in the whole thing was the spoof of Jack Sparrow.The fact they didn't even manage to spoof much and ended up producing a really bad remake of Narnia sums the whole thing up. Utter rubbish. It should have gone straight to DVD and been left to rot.

reviews.review_title: When hair styling is the high point of your day
reviews.content: The only thing that I ask, where did they find a girl who looks exactly like Anna Faris, leading lady of the "Scary Movie" franchise? Other than that, this is the kind of movie I tell myself I should hate, but then I can't help laughing when Lucy kicks the talking beaver, or a guy in a Jack the Ripper outfit break-dances on the green fields of Narnia, wearing a Michael Jackson mask. As usual, most of the jokes are pretty vulgar which would be okay if they were funny, which they aren't nine out of ten times. What the hell, I'll take the laughter and the tears. Also, thumbs up to Candy Walken for Jayma Mays' shining red Charlie's Angels hair. Candy's the lonesome stylist who made Basinger, Lane, Moore, Theron, Diaz look so fine. Case closed.

I will admit I didn't see this until a couple of days ago, and I was really hesitant of seeing it, after reading a lot of negative reviews on the film, and after seeing the excrement that is Disaster Movie. And let me tell you, after seeing this travesty for myself, I can't agree more with the negativity. While not quite as monstrous as Disaster Movie, Epic Movie(more like Epic Dud) is a truly terrible movie. There are absolutely no redeeming qualities here. The humour just isn't funny. It is crude, vulgar, over-familiar and even contrived, and the constant flashing of breasts was way overdone. The acting was really amateur, Jennifer Coolidge and Carmen Electra get my vote as the worst actresses in the movie, and believe me that is not saying much. The Willy Wonka spoof was just as tired as the movie itself. And as a parody of films like Pirates of the Caribbean and chronicles of Narnia, it falls well short in terms of sophistication. The writing is unbelievably bad, the characters are annoying and the plot just isn't there. The music was awful, and the pirate rap was torturously bad. I will say right now, that I don't like any of the recent Friedberg-Seltzer movies, merely because not only do I feel that there is a complete lack of comedic talent in their films, but also their films come across as a complete waste of time. And just like Disaster Movie, I seriously was considering turning the film off 20 minutes in, that's how painful I found it. All in all, probably not quite the worst movie ever, but along with movies like Home Alone 4, NeverEnding Story 3 and Freddy Got Fingered, it is close. A complete disaster of epic proportions, and one to avoid, even if you're thinking of renting. I'm not trying to sound harsh, I am just trying to explain as much as I can what I feel about the movie. 1/10 Bethany Cox.

reviews.review_title: Who makes this crap and why?
reviews.content: What a terrible movie absolutely Not Funny in fact very vulgar and disgusting

Really it is. I mean that! Welcome to another "Matthew Rants". Due to the success of the SCARY MOVIE franchise, the film-makers decided to come up with other ones like DATE MOVIE and this one. It looks like that the writers got their ideas from Mad Magazine, The Far Side, or they must be watching too much cartoons. The film blatantly rips-off all those well-known and insignificant movies (such as CLICK). This is what I call drivel with a capital D. The writers put all these references and spoofs in the plot at random. Here's the worst part, all those sick and twisted jokes, especially ones related to bestiality such as the true parents of Mr. Thumnis, the fact that the beaver and Mr. Thumnis are gay, and Also the Liman's true parents. Yuck! My mother was right, this film IS epic trash. This film is a far-cry from what the other films are spoofing, it is the title that seems to deceive the audience. I'd rather watch 300. Now THERE'S an epic movie. Rated PG-13 for comic violence, comic gore, language, and sexual references such as bestiality.

If ones not stoned that film is just crap. But everyone who goes to see it is stoned and hopefully lucky enough to bring a date and get a piece, Stoner flix are disconnected as is the efects of MJ. They are all absurd as the visions one can hav eafterr consuming the devils lettuce. I give this film a dual rating of 7 & 4. 7 for stoner. 4 for Maturbata.I suggest a sativa/ indica hybed with a 60-40 sativa to indica blend. Strains like Wedding Cake, Girl Scout Cookie even as far as Gorilla Glue.

reviews.review_title: The results are in, Epic Movie is a failed attempt at a spoof.
reviews.content: I have counted how many laughs their are in Epic Movie and how many jokes made me sick to the stomach and these are the results;Unfunny Jokes: 237Funny Jokes: 8Using these statistics, this movie should be rated 0.3%In Epic Movie, we decided to see what the personal opinion would be of two teenage boys of the film "Epic Movie". After hearing good and bad reviews of this film, we decided to watch for ourselves. Well, to be honest, the film was a mess, the jokes make no sense and are repeated at random, the only shock on the use of a midget was the midget actually agreeing to be in the movie. The 4 main characters were awfully shallow and weak minded and seemed unable to think of a joke worthy of even reflecting off in thinking of bad movies. Instead of trying to parody things, they just got the same joke from the film and copied it (This being seen mostly by the Borat ripoff character, the only word changed was Gnarnia (They didn't name this because of legal conditions, just because they couldn't think of anything to parody except the magical silent g that does not parody but just adds another letter to the word so cleverly thought up by whats his face). Some of the stuff in there was not a parody, just a scene to show stripper pirates, fawns and mutants. The nudity was pointless and stupid, their not being a use of the two women who show all in this shame fest of a movie, and many a people with horns who bear their ugly face in the movie, proving they struggled to hire real people to the roles of the people in the film.TL;DR This movie is repetitive, non-parodicial (I made a new word in disgust), and just rips off the original movie. The film is a disguise to the public and to movie fans and makers everywhere. I rate this film 12% with a 3% laugh hit and miss rating.

I don't have any authority for talk about good films, because I'm only a fan with one or more dreams there, but i think that few people (And that is obvious, any movie can have few or much lovers) going to found nice "Epic Movie", which is (for me) another disastrous work of commercial movies.Im a lover of parodies, because i think is a crazy world that makes us laugh... illogical movies are my favorites sometimes ("Pandemonium", "Airplane!", "Scary Movie" and its sequels and "Date Movie" are my favorites). Its sad that a project that can even be glorious falls in pure nonsense , even offensive, garbage. Few laughs (The reason of some few, very few, few points) and some interest characters that can be used like a interest funny spoof of epic movies relation all that stories to make one interesting and funny one. But... this parody don't made it ("Shriek" is even much, much better!).Is sad how this kind of comedy is wasted in movies like "Epic Movie". Besides ... is pleasant or funny to see people urinating the whole time? ... I don't think so.Im sorry... but don't waste your time.*Sorry for the mistakes ... well, if there any.

If you fall into any of these categories: 1. Retarded 2. Deaf 3. Crosseyed 4. Have a very low sense of humor or none at all 5. Have never seen any of the movies they are supposedly spoofing 6. Higher than a kite 7. Have only seen this movie and thinks it's the pinnacle of movie making and that anything else is blasphemy.The final option is that you fall into all of the above, or became that way after seeing the movie (excluding 5 and 7). I say this because side affects like the ones listed above have been known to happen and you should consult your nearest video store and ask for your money back or punch whomever made you watch this even if it was yourself.I don't know how to stress this enough so I'll put it in all caps: EVERY SINGLE "JOKE" IN THE "MOVIE" WAS HORRID IN EVERY SENSE OF THE WORD. EVERY SCENE WAS FORCED BY THE "ACTORS" AND DID NOT MAKE FOR A PLESEANT VIEWING EXPERIENCE. AFTER EVERY SCENE YOU WILL WANT TO GO BACK THROUGH IT IN YOUR HEAD SO YOU CAN MAKE SENSE OF WHAT HAPPENED AND THINK TO YOURSELF "WHAT WERE THEY THINKING, WAS THAT SUPPOSED TO BE FUNNY?". YOU WON'T EVEN WANT TO MAKE FUN OF IT WITH YOUR FRIENDS BECAUSE YOU KNOW THEY WOULD HATE YOU IF YOU MADE THEM WATCH THIS PIECE OF CRAP. THERE IS NO POINT IN GOING OVER A SINGLE SCENE IN THE "MOVIE" BECAUSE NOTHING IS MEMORABLE AND I WOULDN'T WANT YOU TO WASTE YOUR TIME ANYWAY.

I mean, seriously how bad can a spoof be.... In this case awful. I walked in thinking of something that would actually be quite good, but i was so damn wrong. All the way throughout the film it tries to be funny, but it actually is more ludicrous. Jokes and supposed funny remarks are made all the way through the film. It tries to make you laugh as much as possible without knowing itself its just pathetic and not at all funny.Instead it welcomes viewers to a new low, which can't be worse. So don't waste your time or hard earned cash to spend it on a rouse flop of a "crap movie."

Wow is this a bad movie. Like, walk out of the movie and demand your money back bad. Downloadable for free and I STILL wouldn't recommend watching it bad. A collection of the most hackneyed, lame jokes from the worst episodes of Leno bad. Seriously, this is really, really awful. To be honest, the only reason I even scanned thru it after the first minute was to find the scenes with the extremely hot Carmen Electra. Nothing, and I mean nothing, else in this movie is worth even the honor of background noise, let alone your full attention. Normally with movies this bad I would suggest developing a drinking game around it to try and make it fun, but this movie is such a mess that I don't even think alcohol could help. Avoid.

This movie is not artfully done as a parody, but it is still pretty funny. It manages to cobble together a coherent storyline, and hilariously mishmashes characters and settings from the blockbuster movies of 2006. I am actually glad these trite, mediocre, yet inexplicably lucrative movies are made fun of and torn to pieces by "Epic Movie." The movie is definitely weird, filled with careless non sequiturs, shoddy editing, and strange, inappropriate hip-hop songs and references; yet it is because of, rather than in spite of these poorly-done and weird cuts, that "Epic Movie" is so enjoyable. One of the best scenes involves a fight scene with a kung-fu body double that looks absolutely nothing like the main actor. Dismembered limbs magically reappear as though the character was not hurt. Comedy needs to be weird, over-the-top, and nonsensical. "Epic Movie" is all of these, and as a result ends up being a classic of weird comedies.The actors are actually competent and very funny. The beautiful Jayma Mays is excellent as the exaggeratedly stupid, goofy, and childlike Lucy. She clearly understood how to make this character weird, surreal and memorable. Faune Chambers is somewhat of a foil for Lucy's antics. I loved the credibly cowardly character of Peter. Crispin Glover, master of the bizarre is wonderful as a creepy and unnerving Willy Wonka. Darrell Hammond is absolutely spot-on as a parody of Johnny Depp as Jack Sparrow; he has an eye for detail and mimics the character perfectly.This movie is not well crafted in terms of a smooth plot line or story structure, but it's weird enough to work. Give it a shot; it's far from the worst movie in the world.
