(sadly, I know I would have wanted to watch a movie that got a review as bad as this, but remember...I warned you) (me and probably the rest of the reviewers..heh)

reviews.review_title: Another spoof, with some entertaining qualities
reviews.content: Surely nothing unusual here for the movie's theme. Sure it was just the same as any other movie like Scary Movie and date Movie, but seemed a bit lame compared to those. This one looked like it was rushed through production, but at least it didn't cause me or anyone else in the theater to yawn. Funny tidbits and some interesting movie veterans, I think, gives it a good excuse to kill an hour and a half of fun. This does not look like a direct-to-video type, but still Hollywood has not come up with enough material anymore for circulation so they must know most audiences will enjoy a spoof of other movies that were nothing more than box-office hits, and the ideas they were didn't matter. We all enjoy making fun of one movie to another, snd this one was pretty good.

OK, let me qualify my score with a small anecdote regarding this movie. For some reason, a friend of mine and I decided to "rent" this movie in the hotel room while in Vegas (we had to take a breather from the night before). Anyway, as the movie progressed, my friend eventually fell asleep and I vigilantly finished viewing this piece of crap. Afterward, I lamented to my friend how awful this movie really was and even he, having slept through around 2/3 of this movie knew, commenting "Yeah, you didn't wake me up from laughing." Do not see this movie. It is of the same line of films as the "Scary Movie" and other such dreck. At least the "Scary Movie" franchise scores a few laughs now and again. THIS MOVIE IS NOT FUNNY AT ALL! All those involved with this turd gallivanting as a film should hang their heads in shame, move to the Himalayas, join the Buddhist monks and try to atone for their sins!

reviews.review_title: Only a movie to see if you have nothing better to do...
reviews.content: ....and I do mean only see this movie if you have nothing better to do. I was actually excited for this movie sense the trailer look pretty funny. And when it came close to the movie coming out, it got a few good reviews so I had great feelings about this movie.Then I saw it....The movie really wasn't all that good. To start off, the beginning goes by pretty quickly introducing the characters with bland jokes and parodies. The rest of the movie was quite the same. With a combination of bad parodies, M-TV spoofs, and poor slap stick comedy the movie just fell flat.The only way to describe how I felt through this movie is that it was like a Bad "You had to be there kind of story" from an annoying co-worker, they tell you its gonna be funny, but as they tell you the story it just gets worse and worse.Sure the movie made me laugh a few times, but they were too few, and too far apart.Even the rest of the audience *and the theater was packed* laughed hardly except for an annoying fat guy in the back who laughed at everything and probably anything.*Spoilers* The only thing I actually thought was funny was the ending *even though it was kind of moronic* was how it incorporated one of MAIN jokes from the Borat movie *I'll let you guess what joke it is..........NOT*.Aside from that, the movie is really only worth it if you have nothing better to do.

reviews.review_title: In between of Superhero Movie and Date Movie
reviews.content: "Epic Movie" is something you really need to download from the internet instead of paying any money for it. At least it had it's moments, unlike "Date Movie" which was a total disaster. Epic Movie's biggest problem is that it's just...not funny. Instead of making people laugh, it makes people BORED and UNCOMFORTABLED with the idea of watching this garbage.Hopefully they stop making movie-movies. I know the film makers eventually run out of ideas and start desperately copying earlier, classic films to make money out of something, but even that is better than making these unfunny time wasters that have no particular reason for their existence.If you have nothing, absolutely NOTHING else to do, you can watch this, but whatever you do, don't expect anything else than killing boredom and rare entertaining moments that eventually don't make you laugh. 2 out of 10 stars.

reviews.review_title: This is an R rated film. Disgusting and perverse
reviews.content: I am ashamed to admit I saw this movie. "Epic Movie" is advertised as a spoof of many recent highly popular films. But, in reality, it is a spoof primarily on "The Chronicles of Narnia" with only minor references to other movies thrown in here and there. Even so, if that were all that was wrong with it, I wouldn't be here writing. Quite frankly, this movie provokes descriptions such as disgusting, disrespectful, perverted, vile, inappropriate,,,I could probably apply every negative word I could think of here, but you get the point. Here are a few of the many examples I could give for my negative opinion of "Epic Movie": --Lots of sex, sexual innuendo, some very explicit, many very perverse. --Producer obviously has an agenda. Many social norms are ridiculed and many social perversions are made to appear the norm. --LOTS of cursing including use of the "F" word. --LOTS of violence, not just sword fights and gun battles, bit people just out of the blue turning around and using brute force against the person next to them, repeatedly, for no apparent reason. And, this type violence is prevalent through the whole movie. --Many scenes based on watching people urinate.I honestly do not understand why this movie is not rated R and wish it would have been so that I would not have seen it. It is obvious that the motion picture associations movie ratings can not be trusted.

Oh. My. God. I'm absolutely speechless for what to say about this movie, other than it's at the #1 spot on my bottom 100 forever. This is the only other movie that I've ever had to rate a 1, the other being A Nightmare On Elm Street Part 2: Freddy's Revenge. But you couldn't ever compare Epic Movie to that. In fact, I still can't believe I wasted £7 quid on this. If anything, they should of been letting people in the cinema to see this for free. That's all I've got to say really, except for that I heard they're making a Fantasy Movie. I know, I can't believe it either... But I wouldn't be surprised if they followed it with Musical Movie or something really stupid like Disaster Movie.

Epic piece of crap.I really don't know what to say about this movie. I have never been a fan of the whole genre of ridiculous comedy that pokes fun at all the other movies. To me, it is not creative at all. This movie in particular really stank. Nothing was really funny in it at all, and in fact, I wished I hadn't wasted the time to even load it into the player.The only parts I found even remotely humorous were the brief (literally) appearances of "Borat" and a few of the Jack Sparrow gags. However this simply does not make the movie worth watching. Do not waste money. Don't even waste bandwidth downloading it.Save your time and money. Save yourselves.

Epic Movie was literally one giant dry heave. Apparently a tasteful comedy was not what the directors had in mind when they smashed all the past year's blockbusters into one, then again, should we expect anymore from the people who directed "Date Movie?". The film lacked direction as well as acting. Cheesy special effects, mixed with terrible one liners and repetitive jokes, made the movie an eyesore; certainly not worth the 7 dollars and fifty cents I had to pay. Most of the movie did not make any sense either. I'm not even going to begin to describe the plot or characters, for fear that my intelligence may drop once more for trying to remember everything terrible within the film.

This movie is a crime. I would have had more fun spending my eighty minutes eating a big bucket of rusty, scabies-ridden hospital sharps and groining myself with a crowbar. I would rather go tobogganing, nude, in a sled made from stinging nettles, down a slope constructed entirely from shards of broken glass, before crashing into a prison for elephant sex offenders and being forced, at gunpoint, to dress up as a female elephant and doused liberally with lady elephant hormones and then made to tiptoe through a tunnel filled with the randy male elephant rapists, who'd had their penises replaced with flamethrowers. They ought to give out a razor-blade with every ticket.

reviews.review_title: funny depending on ur sense of humor
reviews.content: i don't know why people don't like this movie. it was a normal funny spoof. you just got to have the right sense of humor. my brother only regonizes one part of the movie that was funny to me, but not to him. when you go see these types of movies, everyone in the theatre laughs no matter how corny the jokes are. this is because the only people who want to see these kind of movies understand them. this film was WAY better than date movie, and meet the spartans. im not saying thatit is the best movie in the world...but it was funny and deserves a lot more credit than most people are giving it. go see the movie yourself and decide what side you are on. those who like these movies, and those who don't. i like these movies.

This was by far one of the dumbest movies ever made. When I went and saw it people started to leave 20 minutes in because of how bad it was, and it wasn't all at once more people left. I'm surprised that I wasn't one of them. This movie spoofs: The Chronicles of Narnia, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (with Johnny Depp), Pirates of the Caribbean, The DaVinci Code, and the X-men series, and Snakes on a Plane. This movie has a plot at the very beginning and even gets a few laughs out of people, but ten minutes in the plot starts to fade and become too complicated and the jokes are used so many times that they're not funny anymore. How many times can you laugh at Lucy saying exactly what Susan said, or Peter drawing stick figures by peeing in the snow. I think after seeing this I think that its finally time to stop with the spoof movies. they were funny at first and everyone loved them but there's not a lot of movies that are stupid, scary, or funny enough to scare. So just leave the good movies that come out as they are don't make stupid movies about good movies to try to either make them funny or stupid.

reviews.review_title: Stop this movie, before more brain cells die needlessly!!!
reviews.content: It's hard to know where to start in reviewing a film this completely awful. This movie should disappear from all existence (and maybe take anyone who thought this would be a good idea to make a movie with them. Then something good could come of this.) Shallow, uninspired, obvious, painfully predictable, insulting and of course, entirely unfunny are the nice things I can say about this waste of time.Will the people who made this movie learn from this atrocity? Not likely, anyone de-evolved to the point of making this movie, may be incapable of learning from such a big mistake.How did I get stuck watching this? Someone who insisted we watch the "funny" battle scene at the end of the movie. Never made it to the end, just couldn't stand it anymore.

I just left the theater and came straight home to give this movie a 10! If you are looking to escape life for a couple of hours and be entertained, then this is the movie for you!This is a parody movie. A funny parody movie. It spoofs gigantic blockbuster movies that everyone has seen. Pirates. Narnia. X-Men. Davinci Code. Even MTV spoofs like Cribs & Punked. I am always afraid to see a parody movie for fear that I won't recognize all the movies. Even if you are not a gigantic movie fan, I'm sure you will recognize the movies they are spoofing. That is part of the fun of a movie like Scary Movie 1,2 and 3, and Date Movie. The fun is wondering what movie are they going to spoof next. The real fun is noticing the movie they are spoofing.F-U-N This movie is FUN. Enjoying. Entertaining.Forget life. Forget being a critic. Enjoy the movie.

reviews.review_title: Not very funny, but worth a watch
reviews.content: I hated this movie so much it just had bad acting , bad jokes, and bad spoofs. It was so stupid! When i got out of the movie theater after watching this movie i was so mad that i wasted $8.00 on a movie so stupid. I mean it had a few laughs but they were ones that weren't that funny. It just wasn't a movie would go out and buy or rent for that matter.If you want to see a good spoof movie go see Scary Movie or Airplane! They were both way funnier than this! I'm sorry that people who liked this movie had to read this review, if you haven't seen it yet, go rent it, it is worth 1 watch.So go spend $3.00 and rent it, it's worth one watch.

reviews.review_title: People Who Write, "I Didn't Laugh Once" Are Lying...
reviews.content: Okay. Here's the deal: This DOES NOT suck! Sure, it's not the best comedy ever or even the best spoof but it's waaaay better than Date Movie! I enjoyed this movie. I have a soul. A soul that allows me to laugh at stupid dick and fart jokes. A soul that understands that, "Hey it's SUPPOSED TO BE STUPID!" and the likes. When I went to this movie, some guy and his girlfriend were sitting across from me and all during the flick, the guy would not shut the hell up. Laughing and laughing he was. The movie finished. Im getting up to leave and they pass by. Guess what he says? "THIS MOVIE SUCKED! I Didn't EVEN LAUGH ONE TIME!" All to sound cool to his girl maybe. I dunno. She probably dumped him for A)lying and B)not having a sense of humor. Hence, the title of my review is now validated. People are so demanding and hard on movies now. Guess what? E.T. is loved by millions but the alien is FAKE. Titanic is the best selling picture ever but guess what girls? JACK AND ROSE NEVER EXISTED. NO SEXY DRAWING. NO LIFE SACRIFICE. So if we can believe a little alien helped a boy or that winning a card game is your way to some hot in car sex then why can't we leave EPIC MOVIE alone? Epic Movie gets a 7 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: One of the Worst movies ever
reviews.content: This movie was horrible!!!!!!!!! It was even worse than "Who's Harry Crumb?". I know that it may look like a funny movie in the previews on TV, but believe me people, it's horrible & it's not even funny. Just look @ the ratings that were made by the public, they prove my point. The beginning of the movie even starts out stupid & each person comes from an already stupid movies that Epic movie is making fun of. This show really didn't need to go ahead & make any more fun of those movies because they already did the job of that by themselves. & the movie that they based it on was good & I don't think that they should have made fun of it. Also, the characters in this movie were really stupid & nothing in this movie was even the least bit funny. What a horrible movie it was. Honestly I think it could've been a funny movie if they had had funnier lines, better movies to make fun of, & better characters.

reviews.review_title: Just wasted almost two hours of my life!!!
reviews.content: ABSOLUTELY AWFUL!!! I enjoy funny films, and decided to treat my partner for an early valentines gift...should have stayed at home and watched paint dry! Rent National Lampoons Christmas Vacation instead. Very poor storyline, unless you really like Narnia sorry Gnarnia! I enjoyed Scary Movie, but this type of film has become too predictable, sorry to slate it but laughed twice(maybe). The plot line, whilst attempting to use reference to some 'epic movies' jumped around the place, but only really focused on Naria, although there were some interesting references to other actors and famous people, sometimes just for the reference point - poor Paris! Oh well.....Looking forward to The Hot Fuzz film from Shaun of the Dead duo...Heres hoping for salvation anyway!

If they can make successful spoofs of Hollywood movies in the Scary Movie series and even make a spoof of romantic comedies in Date Movie, why can't they make spoof of fantasy and epic movies? Yes, why not, indeed, even if the product looks sick and hardly funny? Welcome to epic movie, a royal spoof on the films you saw last year, from The Da Vinci Code to Pirates of the Caribbean, from Casino Royale to 300, everything at one place. What more do you want? Even if you want more you won't get it, so be satisfied with what you have. The film is the story of four orphans who meet their adventures in unlikely places. While Lucy falls into the world of The Da Vinci Code, Edward gets a chance to visit Willy Wanka while yet another, Susan is being adopted to the family of warring Mr and Mrs Smith and the last orphan Peter finds himself among the X-Men. What follows are a crazy plot twists that make you revisit all the major Hollywood blockbusters you have seen in recent times. And unfortunately you haven't seen them you may find it hard to appreciate the film. That happens with the parodies. If relies so heavily on the original that if you do not have any idea of it, then you may miss the whole point. So here's it is. You can go to Epic Movie just to check how much you know about the movies. It can be quite funny to just to spot the original film in the spoof. And just that!

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everybody says!
reviews.content: Most of the reviews you see up here are people who don't know how to just sit down and enjoy a film.....I for one walked into that theater with all my friends ready to laugh....And I did, I laughed and had a great time at this film...More than half the people on the boards talking trash about it are people who walk into that theater rooting for that movie to fail!! and they are saying to themselves "wow this movie is gonna suck" and that mindset sticks with them and they refuse to laugh... They forget not every movie is made to win an Oscar..This movie is supposed to be stupid in a way...If you go into that theater ready to laugh and have a good time and with a good mindset...You will most likely love this film....Take my advice and get out there and see this movie...Laugh and enjoy yourself, thats what this movie is for....GO SEE EPIC MOVIE!!!!

reviews.review_title: This was supposed to be BETTER than Date Movie!
reviews.content: I have just returned from EPIC MOVIE. Oh, boy was it epic. It was one small step for the producers of the Scary Movie series, one giant, huge, extra-large, epic leap for crappy parodies. Sure, it was amusing, albeit funny at times, but for the most part, it was horrible. It basically appeared that they took every reasonably good movie from the past year, added a stupid background plot and crammed in far too much bathroom humor and sexual jokes. Was the albino with the bondage fetish really necessary? Really? In my opinion, it was a sad excuse for a film and if I were you, I wouldn't waste $20 and 90 minutes of your life to watch this movie unless you are a 13-year-old boy with a sense of humor comparable to a 2nd grader, because thats basically all who enjoyed EPIC MOVIE. Unless you're into stupid flicks with pointless humor and pokes at homosexuality, African Americans and those with low IQs. And for your information, it wasn't better than Date Movie. Just a bad movie, possibly worse if it can get worse the Date Movie. Which, after viewing EPIC MOVIE, I know it can. If you ask me, you'd be better off renting all 4 Scary Movies and spending the night at home. I sure wish I had.

reviews.review_title: Goofs or Errors (since it's not addable under Fun Stuff)
reviews.content: At least twice I could see, at the top of the screen, a boom mike. Come on people, that's just bad production value...were they really that desperate to get this movie over and done with? I mean even SNL (live television) did not show the boom mike that often. I feel like this movie was a waste of time to be honest, there were a few funny moments but I think that this was an inadvisable movie to say the least. There were about three funny jokes in this movie but some jokes were overplayed (the repeating what the other person said gag), the scarface gag .....yes quite overplayed; while other jokes were simply inadvisable. Overall, this could have been a funny movie, this could have had potential but it was wasted on ineptly panning Narnia when many more ripe selections for dissection existed.

reviews.review_title: Sucks So Bad It's Beyond Words!
reviews.content: If I could rate a movie a negative number this would be the movie! This is without a doubt the stupidest piece of crap I've ever tried to sit through. Words cannot describe just how much this movie sucks. I have seen better story lines and funnier material come out of a junior high school production. This doesn't even qualify as a movie. It's a sting of skits thrown together one after the other in an attempt to make fun of different movies. That's not the problem though, I've seen those kind of movies before with Scary Movie(s) and others of that type. At least those movies were well written and the jokes were funny. This junk wouldn't even appeal to a 10 year old. I won't waste my time or yours by going on and on. This movie isn't worth the effort. It sure as Hell isn't worth the money to see it.

Epic Movie (2007) is total crap, no beating around the bush here, it was so bad it actually angered me that i paid to view this turkey and i wanted a refund, i felt cheated, the only reason i didn't cause a fuss at the cinema was the fact that something very funny happened...... a singing chant started in the audience (of about 12 people), and it went something like this, why are we watching, why are we watching, why are we watching this piece of CRAP!!!! I didn't have a clue what was going on, the 'script' was idiotic, the actors were totally lame and annoying and the jokes were pathetic and UNFUNNY, how this ever made it to the silver screen i'll never know.I advise anyone who's thinking of going to see this piece of JUNK, to stay well clear and save their money, thank you and GOODNIGHT! 0/10

This movie is awful, its a little less than two hours - that I will never have back in my life - a complete waste of time. Its not funny at all- the scripts tries too hard to get a laugh - any type of comedic moment feels forced. I didn't really want to see this movie but some friends did so i went along, I thought well at least it should make me laugh. I did not laugh once. I keep trying to find moments to laugh at, but everything was so over done and unbelievable that I could not find anything funny, I could only roll my eyes in disappointment. The entire theatre seemed to feel the same way, I only heard a couple of chuckles throughout the movie, and I am not even sure it was the movie they were laughing at. It seemed people were whispering about the movie - and then I heard a few chuckles. Don't waste your time by buying a ticket or by renting it when it comes out. An Epic failure. :/

reviews.review_title: Another reason I foresee the end of the world coming sooner than anyone thought!
reviews.content: Boredom is a tricky being. It is a tragic time and happens frequently among those who invite it in. I had the boredom bug tonight. It makes you do strange things that you would never do if you were thinking clearly. I called friends that did not pick up their phones. I eventually called one who suggested that me, him, and some friends all go see "Epic Movie" because they were going to see it anyways. Normally, I would not be phased by friends to see a movie I have sworn on two Holy Bibles not to see, but this feeling of boredom led me to go all the while knowing exactly what I am getting myself into.I tried on several occasions to get the fellows to see a different film, but I did not prevail. We sat in the theater, the lights went down and it actually started off really, really well. And by "it", I mean the previews. Gosh darn it, I wish they had gone on forever. Eventually the "film" started. I put quotes around film because I can not call this monstrosity a film. I can call it an embarrassment of technology. It's films like these that make me think that maybe humans don't deserve to live on this planet. Maybe just a big radioactive nuclear missile should just go off and take out the planet for millions of years. From where I'm sitting right now, it doesn't sound half bad.The movie begins and already we've got idiocy I've only heard about on the E! channel. As I sit through this movie, I start thinking of many ways to hurt myself to take away from the pain that I'm feeling. Randomly throughout the movie, I punch myself in the leg to deaden it... fun stuff. About thirty minutes in (what felt like three days in the Sahara desert with no water and a troll following you around telling you how gay you are) I haven't seen or heard a single solitary joke. I've heard scarce laughter, but I didn't know why! When something was said on screen when I thought "huh... wow, is this what eating too many aspirin's feels like right before you die?" others were laughing and going "My, what humorists these thespians be".By the end of the film, I had only laughed once. Yes, it is true, I laughed once and I think it was part because of something so unbelievable outrageous happened and part because I thought about if I worked at the movie theater and could run the reel to the film that I would do the decent thing and destroy all evidence that this actually hit theaters. It's been almost an hour since the movie ended and I haven't blinked yet. I think back to what the movie actually was: a film that basically had other actors portray characters from summer movies doing the EXACTLY THE SAME F***ING THING AS THE CHARACTERS IN THE ORIGINAL MOVIES!!! Oh, but they added a fart, pee, or poop element to them. I apologize for using such strong language, but I don't feel to well right now. It might be because the minute I got home I drank an entire bottle of drain cleaner to get out all the "bad" that Epic Movie instilled in me. The film also had the elements of randomly throwing in attractive blonde, scantily-clad women coming in to dry hump air to "awesome" (sarcastic quotations there) rap music. Shakespeare would be proud.This bulletin has been written for three reasons: a review, a warning, and a renouncing. That's right as of right now I am renouncing my faith as a Christian. There can't be a God if he allows movies like Epic Movie to be made and somehow led me astray to the theater and into that room, that dreaded room where I saw my life literally crumble into a thousand tiny pieces of badger excrement. I'm not mad, though. Oh no, I am merely embarrassed for us as a society that we can accept such trash into our theaters and pay more for it than a warm meal.Don't let the boredom get you, my friends. Here are some suggestions of what you can do instead of see this film: Buy a bunch of Sheryl Crow CD's and listen to them while cleaning your kitchen with a small toothbrush.Find a younger sibling and give them a screwdriver, then proceed to tell them to play dentist with you, you'll start by being the patient of course.Bake sugar cookies, but replace every element of sugar with chlorine. Bake for ten to fifteen minutes and enjoy.Go clubbing with Paris and Lindsay.Eat a live animal and don't cry. See if you've got what it takes to be "a man".Watch reruns of The Golden Girls while counting all the individual fibers of your carpet... naked.Urinate on some motorcycles outside a Biker Bar... see how fast you can really run.Shoot a cop... spend the rest of your life in prison.Just please... for the love of God... do NOT watch Epic Movie. There is only one thing this movie is good for and that it's one of the greatest sources for a reason to commit suicide and die young that I have ever seen. It will probably be named, in my book, not just the worst movie of the year... but probably of ALL time. Who knows... I haven't even seen Date Movie. Crap.

reviews.review_title: Please don't bother. There are less painful ways to die.
reviews.content: Scary Movie was funny. Scay Movie 2, less so. Scary Movie 3 just sort of amusing. This ....this is the dregs. Yes, we've all seen the 'lets make fun of other movies!' bit before. What the writers haven't realised is that you can't just say 'Here's a character from another movie with a slightly different name!'. You have to actually WRITE JOKES. And hey, a storyline not lifted straight out of the movies you're trying to mock would be good too.There's nothing funny here .. wait, I lie, there's one funny moment. Paris Hilton getting squashed. THAT I loved. The rest of it is as funny as a vasectomy - without anaesthetic.Please don't bother with this. If you want a laugh, watch America's Funniest Animals. Not only is it funnier, it's far more intelligent.Adam Campbell (Peter) and Jennifer Coolidge (White Bitch) showed some real acting talent here, in the 30 seconds of actual plot that were allowed to happen, and they deserve so, so much better then this. Everyone else deserves to sink into obscurity, not to mention a huge mound of dung.One thing about this movie - it really makes you want to go back and see the movies it's supposed to be making fun of. I'm going to watch Narnia again. And Harry Potter. And Pirates of the Caribbean...

reviews.review_title: Is this a movie for you and/or you're group?
reviews.content: In my opinion this movie is terrible when it comes to having an original story. But, that is to be expected especially seeing that the movie is a parody of some of the most resent movies. Although the story is unoriginal, the best part is truly the comedy. If you are looking to see this movie then I warn you that the humor is crude and inappropriate. If you don not enjoy content in movies like this, then I say that it's not likely that you'll enjoy you're 87 minutes that you could have dedicated to some other activity. If you don't enjoy this kind of comedy or if you are with young children. I say that you should see NIGHT AT THE MUSEUM which is just as awesome, but more appropriate.

reviews.review_title: Gonna Try and Say Something Positive About This...
reviews.content: I have a personal policy against condemning any film, or book, or TV show, or band, or comedian, utterly. There's enough negativity out there from the flamers, the trolls, people who like to spew venom and hide behind their cybernetic anonymity. Besides, why should we listen to the opinions of others, going into something lacking an open mind, just following sheepishly on advance word or The Buzz, or the words of some mealy-mouthed critic who was probably a failed filmmaker-novelist-musician taking it out on others who at least have made an attempt at something? Give everyone a fair chance, man! Does this mean that Epic Movie defied the critics and turned out to be a good movie? NOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!! Are you kidding? It was dross! But no, I am determined not to add to the general negative karma that's floating on the electronic ether. Stay positive, stay positive. Thankfully I didn't spend any money on this, just lost a bet and had it given to me to watch, before passing it onto my 12-year-old niece, whose friends had watched it and liked it. Upon viewing it herself, she liked it too, though she's astute enough to be equally embarrassed at liking it. And having seen it as well, it was initially successful at the box office, and was trimmed on general release to get a wider audience, as only 12 year olds would appreciate it. 12 year olds who undergo involuntary spasms of laughter when they hear swear words and sub-Carry On puns ("Harry Beaver", anyone?), and generally have sufficient attention deficit to half-watch it while ruminating over whether or not Johnny Depp is hotter than Orlando Bloom. (He is, by the way. I'm straight, and even I know he's hotter than most main sequence suns in our galaxy.) Epic Movie has been made by the same people who did Date Movie, and to judge from the titles, presumably also Not Another Teen Movie and the Scary Movie series. Or maybe they all attended the same grade-school classes where all their best jokes were written. I think I saw Scary Movie once, so I'm certain I've seen them all: some semi-talented and talented people embarrass themselves to varying degrees while spoofing other films in amazingly limp and uncreative fashions. No, spoofing's too strong a word; that implies even a measure of wit involved- No, wait! I'm starting to contradict my earlier Mission Statement on promoting positivity. take a deep breath, start again The plot is a Frankenstein monster of, you guessed it, epic movies like Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, The Chronicles of Narnia, The Da Vinci Code and The X-Men, with minor organs in the beast garnered from less epic fare such as Borat, Nacho Libre, and Snakes on a Plane. Again, I can't use the word "spoof" here, because there's almost no attempt at any wit or satire with these. And no, I don't count showing Magneto with a giant Warner Brothers cartoon-style magnet on his head, or calling the Narnia villainess the White B*tch instead of Witch, or having Willy Wonka as a cannibalistic maniac. Mel Brooks at his worst remains superior to what's offered here, because he at least can recreate the target scenes and provide jokes, however lame. Yes, I have just stated that there are worse films than Robin Hood: Men in Tights, and I'm sticking by that claim with Galilean tenacity. What makes it more tragic than deplorable is that there seems to be a genuine, professional attempt to make a decent film (some scenes demonstrate at least an aptitude at creativity) as well as rich, faithful recreations of many of the various elements of the original films. Of special note is Crispin Glover's uncanny impression of Depp's Wonka, and SNL's Darrell Hammond's equally laudable copy of Depp's Jack Sparrow. But giving nothing but accurate recreations is no more funny than that class clown who thought it was amusement in itself to mimic everyone's voices around him. It's as if the screenwriters abandoned the notion of providing humor in favor of letting the audience play Reference Bingo and go, "Oh yeah, they took that bit from The Fast and The Furious!" But not totally; there are brief moments that made me chuckle, maybe even laugh if I'd had another beer in me. But it becomes embarrassing, like watching a drunken friend humiliate himself by trying to walk a straight line in an effort to prove his sobriety when everyone knows he can barely manage a few steps. And when they weren't mostly failing to be funny, they had their characters break into hip-hop gyrations. The first time, seeing Oompa Loompas do it, is almost funny. Seeing pirates do it, then mythical warriors, then mutants following, and this tenuous bungee cord of a gag is ready to snap The four leads are forgettable, as they're meant to be, and I expect nothing less- no! Stop that, it's mean! It's not as if the better, more talented performers who appear could do much better with what they were given: Fred Willard, Jennifer Coolidge, Glover and Hammond have appeared in some of the funniest films around, and I'm confident enough in their abilities that they'll survive this. There you go: the scenery looked nice, I almost laughed out loud, and I liked some of the performers to wish them better roles than what they had here. See? That was positive enough, wasn't it? Take that, Samuel Johnson!

Epic movie: This movie is fantastic it is from 2 of the 6 creators of scary movie and I think that this movie is so funny you could die of laughter at parts.I saw this movie twice in the cinema and then bought it when it came out. It is about four orphans who win a chance of a epic adventure. It is a film you can watch time and time again and still not get sick of it and the funny bits are still funny. I t makes fun of a load of films. Some bits are really funny some bits are not so funny but still a little bit funny this is available to buy on DVD now and there is also the unrated version its a lot funnier but it has a lot more swearing in it and it is a 15 so you will have to ask your parents about that.by G.A.

Simply, A Million Monkeys, With a Million Typewriters In A Million Years Couldn't Produce A Worse Script Than This. It Just Wasn't Funny, Enjoyable, Interesting Or Anyway Worth The Asmission At All,,.! I Just Don't Know How People Are Getting The Green Light To Make These Movies, There's Just No Thinking Behing Them,,. We Can All See The Idea Behind Them And What They Are TRYING To Do But The Execution Is Nothing Short Of Horrific,,. So Called Spoof Films Have Just Gone So Bad That They're Actually Unwatchable, I Found This Film A Chore To Sit Through And The Best Part Of It Was Leaving The Theatre. Even With Films I Don't Like, Most Of The Time I'd Say That There Were A Few Moments That Weren't Too Bad but This Time,,..

reviews.review_title: How did this get a PG-13 rating?
reviews.content: This movie takes on epic movies like Harry Potter, X-Men, Chronicles of Narnia, Star Wars, and Pirates of the Caribbean with a hint of modern culture.This movie was horrible, disturbing, gross, and at times funny. There were some scenes that we did not need to see. I know it was meant to be funny, but the stunt doubles that were exposed in the fight scenes, should have been hidden. It wasn't really working there.How this movie got a rating of PG-13 is beyond me. For those parents that take their young children to see PG-13 movies, this is NOT the movie to take them to. Some scenes are too sexually explicit for them. Even though it had it's funny moments, some scene that were written in humor, weren't so humorous. There was a lot of "what the hell?" moments

Save yourself an hour and a quarter, this sucker hasn't even got a normal length for a movie while it is stuffed with the stupidest scenes ... When I saw they showed it in my cinema theater, I thought this movie passed some movie critics, but apparently they forgot to rate and in addition abolish this film.I'd be embarrassed if I were in this film its cast, except for captain J. Swallows. He's getting an eight for his good impression of America's hero J. Depp.A true waste of time, you read this a lot on IMDb, but here it really makes any sense. Go rent American History X, Pulp Fiction or Der Untergang ... A small tip that can save you some wasted quality time.Dave & Noenoe

reviews.review_title: Worst movie should have been the title
reviews.content: There's no way to soften the truth: Epic Movie is a waste of time. It's like a bad issue of Cracked Magazine come to life. It's not so much painful as it is sleep inducing. Bad imitations of beloved movie characters can be funny but not the way they are presented here. The movie is so poorly assembled that it feels like a direct-to-DVD product that ended up with a theatrical release because the January schedule is so threadbare. Even if you love every movie that Epic Movie references, this film will not please, divert, or amuse you. Bad taste and worse jokes abound. Epic Movie's humor isn't tired; it's comatose. After a while, the effect of so much failed humor is numbing.

My only excuse is that I saw this movie by accident.If I had known that Epic Movie was from the very same people who made Date Movie, I never would have watched it.As it is, I saw Epic Movie on satellite, for $4.99, and it was **still** a total waste of time and money.You know how some films are so bad, they're actually fun to watch? This isn't one of those films. Epic Movie is just truly, truly awful.The bloopers that ran during the end credits were funnier than the entire movie -- and the bloopers weren't all that funny either.I don't know what the filmmakers (if you can actually call them that) spent their money on here -- but I'm guessing that 75% of the people reading this now could make a comedy film which was in some way better than this one, given the same budget. Seriously, there's stuff on YouTube every week that's more worthwhile than this.I'm not trying to sound clever or cynical here -- I'm trying to save you money, and precious time out of your lifespan. Don't see Epic Movie! You've been warned!
Warning you will lose brain cells after watching epic movie

If only you could rate a 0 out of 10. Even though that still wouldn't cover this abomination to the spoof genres. Re-used material to make it even more loathsome and such a good idea wasted completely by things like White Bitch, Jack Swallows and the stupid cliché moments and characters. Expected, rubbish, utterly disappointing. If this is what spoofs have com down to, I wish to see no more in my life. Scary Movie was pushing it, The Date Movie was almost unbearable, but Epic Movie is pure junk, a mindless attempt to poke any original fun left in the movies and the characters.Avoid... at all costs. If you are forced to be manacled to this dribble, dispose of it immediately and pray to God no-one else finds it. And so in the grossly abusive and drab words of the White Witch: "Kill this f***ing movie."

Okay, i laugh at everything. I tried to come into this review with an unbiased account of what you should expect. But this was just plain awful. The film begins with a Da Vinci code spoof, involving Lucy, one of the main characters, discover a clue in the Louvre museum. She discovers that "lame" has seven letters in it, and hurriedly buys candy as she is chased by an annoying psychotic albino guy who has a whip. the candy gives her a golden ticket, which leads her to Willie wonkas factory. Meanwhile, one of the other orphans, Susan, is on a plane. This becomes a parody of one of the most easily laughable films of the year, snakes on a plane. They discover the snakes...on the plane, and she is thrown out of the plane to crush a decidedly self-absorbed Paris Hilton. She finds a golden ticket in her bag. the humor ends here. all of it. The other two discover tickets in similarly ridiculous situations. once in the factory, Willie wonka reveals to them that he has an interesting plan for them, and fergie music blares as he traps them and harvests their organs for candy. They discover the wardrobe to Gnarnia (Narnia) in Mr. wonka's factory. Lucy, the first one in, meets Mr tumnous in a stupid cribs parody, and meets his life partner, the beaver. The orphans are separated from Edward, who was deceived by the 'white bitch'(ha ha very funny) and is now captive in a jail cell. He meets up with captain jack swallow, a pirate on a fake ship. Cue the scantily clad women dancing. the pirates then dance to rap music and we are sickened by a fat man washing himself. The writers apparently found this so side-splitting that they used this rap video type thing one or two times more. The orphans meet up with harry potter who agrees to teach them to use spells, fight, and such. I'm going to skip right over the part with the pregnant Hermione, and continue on to aslow's camp. they are greeted by, among others, James bond from the recent casino Royal. This just shows us how quickly they threw this thing together.there, everybody gets drunk, bonks aslow, and we are subjected to the thousandth unnecessary pop culture reference when they make a fat Britney spears joke. OK, the battle. they get there, realize that they are outnumbered, and are about to fight when the white bitch turns into an..er..extremely effeminate Davy Jones. He mixes a few rap tracks, everybody dances, and in comes Jack swallow on his wheel. an octopus attacks his face, so he looses control of it and just crashes. the writers have now backed themselves into such a corner that the only way they can get out of it is with a major cheat. Peter discovers the remote from click and uses it to stop all the opposing forces. they then take great joy in stabbing, spelling, and breaking chairs over heads of their frozen enemies. at the end, they re-discover the wardrobe, tumble through, and are greeted by borat when they are all crushed by the giant wheel.the end. Okay, there are many things which would have been funnier than epic movie. among them... 1) a six year old making her dog dance to la cucharacha. 2) eating a chunk of asphalt. 3) shaving your hairy great aunt bertha. 4) OK, i've been to funerals with a better sense of humor. So,if you are looking for a laugh, save yourself the 86 minutes, see another movie, go bowling, attend a funeral, just please, don't see epic movie. This message brought to you by the committee of saving people from crappy movies.

I wouldn't exactly call myself a movie critic but I've never felt so ripped-off as I did walking out of the theater last night. My friend and I had been at the theater and didn't really like any of the options (The Queen and Babel were playing elsewhere, I found out later to my great dismay) and since the Scary Movies had been somewhat decent, we decided to give Epic Movie a go. It didn't take long before I wished I was sitting next door in Night at the Museum. Aside from the lack of inspiration/wit, I think this movie's biggest problem was its attempted scope. SO many movies get jabbed at by the film that at times it seems like they were trying a bit too hard. I think there were only two or three (very) short segments that I actually enjoyed. All in all, absolutely dreadful.

reviews.review_title: bury the movie,the actors and the writers
reviews.content: I'm lost for words really on what to put on this movie......Well for starters it's just plain awful the dialect, the script, the plot in fact the movie it self is bad. how awful it is can't be explained in words. but to give you some idea, its like getting getting your testicle's tied to two trains going opposite directions does that help??. the whole bad think in this move is that it does'nt even try any-think that would be remotely funny like having wolverine as a jock was just embarrassing if Hugh Jackman was dead (knock on wood) he would have been rolling in his grave. but on the good side at least Ed Wood can smile now that some one made a worse movie than he didto sum it up bury every copy of the movie all the actors that stared in it all the writers that writ in it and the persons that funded it 0/10

reviews.review_title: Simply the worst film I have ever seen.
reviews.content: Mind numbingly rubbish.I wish I had gone to watch some paint dry! Save yourselves some money and do not go to see this crap, I cannot stress how bad this is.I am struggling to fill my minimum 10 lines of text.... Oh, idea! Rubbish, poor, refund please! At least the popcorn was good. I may sue for my cash back....You all get the idea? This is even worse than a Ben Affleck movie.....I then get this upon submission from IMDb!! "Your comment does not contain enough lines - the minimum length for comments is 10 lines of text. Please see the guidelines. Attempts to pad the comment with junk words can result in your account being blocked from future submissions." IMDb, it isn't padding, this excuse for entertainment really is that bad.

reviews.review_title: i don't know what to say..... (spoilers ahead!!!)
reviews.content: okay, first of all, if any of you guys didn't watch this movie yet, then don't read it because there's a spoiler ahead. Okay, I watch this movie at the cinema and let me tell you, I really don't get the jokes!! One time when Peter draw cartoons from his own urine on the snow, I think it's dumb!! And when at the end of the movie, 4 of them get crushed by Jack Swallows. What was that?!! But there are some of the scene that makes me laugh a little bit. Like when Susan get kicked out from the plane and fall on top of Paris Hilton (the look-alike). And when Lucy freaking out and kicked the talking beaver (two times but different scene). I don't know what you guys think of this movie. But for me, I think it's a waste of time. Just like Date Movie. BORING!!! I think that the director who direct this movie haven't got any idea with the jokes. I cannot wait for the Scary Movie 5 (I don't know it's true or not. I saw it in this site). I hope it's the best one. (sorry if you don't understand what I'm saying.)

Since Scary Movie 2, these movies have gone down the toilet(even more than they already have.) THis movie in my area(S. TX), appears to be more successful than any other movie in the past few years. The theaters were full of people, it was amazing. The movie was very stupid and didn't go anywhere. The comedy was taken too far and made everything bad. The pieces did not fit together correctly. It was like a perverted Nickelodeon television show that nobody watches, DO NOT WATCH. Most of the film covered the Chronicles of Narnia, which still was a pathetic movie intended for children. It had a few funny moments but would have been better left inside of a fifth grade kid's head.

A friend talked me into seeing this movie, and it was probably the worst movie I've ever tried to watch. My six friends and I did not enjoy this movie at all. It seemed the barely half-full theater felt the same way. It was a total waste of my money, please don't waste your's. I enjoyed all the Scary Movies and even thought Date Movie had a few funny parts, but this movie was total garbage. There are some good comedy actors in this movie that go to total waste. We left this movie halfway through it was so bad, and I've only left a theater mid-movie one time before this. Bottom line: Don't waste your money. Don't see it in the theater, don't buy it on video, don't even rent it. Don't even pick it off of the shelf and look at the back of the box. You'll regret it.

I watched the trailers for this "epic" movie on TV and thought...hey! this looks funny! So on Friday night, I brought a couple friends to see it. When it was over I was like...WTF?! PG-13?! Are you kidding me? There were so many sexual jokes and exposure that it should have been rated R.Also, the movie was what, 1 hour and 15 minutes long? Crazy that they would make it that short. And I told my parents that it was PG-13 and appropriate for teens, but it was completely the opposite...One good thing though: There were some good jokes that were appropriate, but I don't want to give away any spoilers. But the ones that were funny were hilarious...but most were to sexual. Bottom line is: Do not see this movie in theaters. Wait for it to come out on DVD. Don't waste $6.50 like me!

reviews.review_title: I could have written this script in my lunch-hour
reviews.content: Not all films need to be intelligent and thought-provoking. A bit of simple fun is a great way to relax for 90 minutes, but this film was the worst I've ever seen. It was a like a sixth-form revue, except it had better sets. I hadn't expected great things, but it says something when the site gags get more laughs (few that they were from the audience in my cinema)than the script itself. There wasn't one original idea. After American Dreamz, I thought it couldn't get much lower, but this has ploughed depths not seen Captain Nemo visited the Centre of the Earth. When a film says that it is written by two of the six writers from Scary Movie, why does it have to be the two who wrote the lunch menus and not the ones who wrote the gags? I've wasted money on some things in my life, very rarely on a cinema ticket, but I did this time.

reviews.review_title: one of the funniest films of the year.
reviews.content: This is one of the funniest film of the year. This is truly funny and very nice. This movie spoofs a lot of amazing films ever!. This is way better than Date Movie and Scary Movie 1 and 4. The acting in this film is very great and the story is silly but still good film i give this film an 9/10 because i died with laughs. I want to see this film over and over again. I will surely add this to my collection and see this 10 times on DVD or more. See this and don't forget to add this to your collection. I love you writers of scary movie because you are making very funny films each year thanks and good bye to you all. Bye and thanks for reading the comment. if you have a comment email me on aaron93@maltanet.net Thanks again.

reviews.review_title: Not funny, not clever - 100% waste of time and money
reviews.content: It is rare that I walk out of a movie. I always feel that in order to have an opinion about anything one must experience it in full. But I just couldn't sit through this empty unfunny slice of sophomoric fluff. It was utterly lacking in any quality that can justify sitting through it. As a big fan of spoofs I am prepared to sit through some predictable satire to get to the really juicy stabs at movie pop culture. But "epic" just cannot deliver the goods. The actors were not very funny or engaging to begin with but the writing weaves a childish story with sorry gags and attempts to bring in hip-hop culture in places where it just doesn't make sense - and this is in a movie genre where anything goes. My ire at this film extends to saying that it is not really even worthy of renting.

I don't recommend waiting for this movie on DVD, since movie tickets are cheaper, and you will not want to see this garbage more than once. However, you only live once, and you shouldn't waste your precious time sitting through the most unbearable hour and a half ever.If you've never had the experience of wanting to leave a movie early, and want that particular pleasure, then by all means go spend your money on "Epic Movie." The only reason I gave this a 2 and not a 1 is that Kal Penn is almost worth buying the ticket for. In fact, you should buy the ticket for him, since I don't think even he would pay up to see it.

reviews.review_title: Its suppose to be poking fun at other movies(comedy) i.e. similar to Scary movies.
reviews.content: I think this is the worst movie I have ever seen. I know this because I slept through 20 % of the movie which never happened before. Comedy is so childishly simple and you can get a feeling of disgust at its worst. a disgrace to the makers of the scary movies if u ask me. pathetically trying to make people laugh. waste of time n money going to such a movie. too many have been made fun of, practically no average movie patron would have seen it all to have the real feel of what these people re talking about. unwanted sexual references and the sequences sicking in their own aspect. the makers could have done better if they come and pump some laughing gas in the cinema halls if they wanted to get people to laugh. references made towards'harry potter', 'x men', 'pirates of the Caribbean' are a shame.

reviews.review_title: Did anyone read the script before putting this into film?
reviews.content: I really think that the script went unread before production started working on this film. It is ridiculous how unfunny this movie is. It's as if the movie was directed towards 3 year olds with mental disabilities. I was impressed to see how low and senseless comedy could get. When I went into the movie theater to watch this movie, I was expecting a semi-original comedy in the likes of Scary movie....WRONG! I honestly can't describe how disappointed I was to see this piece of crap on the big screen.(and I think I'm speaking for the majority of people) Not to mention how sick Date Movie made most people feel also. It looks like crap comes in pairs, just like the two writers from the Scary Movie series that decided to write this load of trash.

After counting down the days until the opening I paid my overpriced $10 and sat with a bunch of 10 year old kids. The Scary Movies are great and Date Movie was nice but Epic Movie just sucked to the high heavens. The few funny parts no body understood and were soon forgotten. I had more fun watching previews for upcoming musicals. And nothing was relevant to Epic movies. I should have known, the Scary Movies are loosing their touch and Epic Movie was awful. The casting stunk. Willie Wonka was gross not funny. the man making out with the beaver was nasty and the ninja dude was creepy. Awful, awful, awful waste of participation. So, there see it if you want you'll be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: This thing could be used by the military to torture spies
reviews.content: Anyone here has already selected his or hers bad movie? Hold on to your butts this beats them all.I rented this movie on beautiful Saturday thinking to watch it with my family and some friends so we can have a little fun. I started playing this movie... well so much for my beautiful day. After the first 5 minutes of the movie not so much as a smile from nobody so i thought to skip this movie a little to get to the good part. After to much forwarding trying to find something good i realized that the only good thing in this movie is the end. You ask yourself how could a parody be so bad i mean it's supposed to be funny right? Well i think who ever made this movie mistaken the genre of the movie saying that it's comedy when in fact they should have said that it's a torture movie.There is no fun in this movie hell until i saw this movie with my one eyes i could't even believe that such stupid and idiotic movie could be made. Good thing i didn't see this crap in a cinema that would have been the biggest torture ever.It get's one point because i can't get this thing to score below 1.

Wow. This movie was absolutely terrible. It was not very well thought out and wasn't even the slightest bit funny. I walked into the theater expecting it to be amazing but I was definitely misled. Don't get me wrong, I like stupid movies. Ones like "Nacho Libre" and "Napoleon Dynamite". Everyone I talked to hated those movies but I think that they are the greatest movies ever! I wish that they would have thought the plot line through, because it could have been a great and funny movie. It just seemed as if they just threw everything together in 2 minutes. Therefore, the only thing that I could say when it ended was, "Wow. That was a complete waste of my life."

I went to this movie, fully expecting a bad movie, but the typical funny movie you go to with your buddies to make fun of and get a kick at. I went with my usual group of stupid movie buddies, and we realized that his movie pulled off the impossible. It failed at being a stupid humor movie.That's not possible you say? Then waste your money and see this movie. Other words use your 9.50 and see a good movie like Children of Men, or Pan's Labyrinth. Epic Movie was a disaster. I have a feeling this is the sort of humor you would get if you put Condoleeza Rise and Dick Chaney and told them they had one hour to come up with 100 jokes. Not a good thing.The movie made fun of various pop culture ideas, Paris Hilton, Borat, Snakes on a Plane, Sudoku, Dead Mans Chest, and many others. Tell me what part of Borat, and Snakes on a Plane warrants a satirical view? They are already satire! The humor was very stale too, they took the jokes already said in other stupid humor movies and said them again. It's like watching Airplane, then Airplane II the Sequel, all the same jokes repeated.This movies humor was so stale, that the few one-liners I thought were amusing, were only amusing because of how UN-amusing the rest of the jokes are. The simple placement of "Chuck Norris Rocks" now that I think of it is no longer funny. A year ago yes, but not anymore. I chuckled though because I was desperately searching for something to laugh at.The jokes in the movie were not at all creative, most stupid humor movies; their jokes are actually creative. Not epic movie however, for example, they switched up the most obvious things. Changing Willy Wonka's chocolate river with a sewage line, Changing The White Witch in Narnia to "The Wight Bitch." The jokes were just plane, and UN-inventive.I am a sucker for stupid humor films. I loved all the good ones, all the Mel Brooks flicks, Kung Fu Hustle, Shoulin Soccer, Monty Python, Black Adder, I love it. I never thought that it was actually possible not to be successful making a stupid humor film; however that's exactly what Epic Movie Did. I say save your money, all that the movie is worth you already saw in the commercial.

But only if you're a complete moron.A smack in the face, a guy falling over, a girl farting really loud, and a bunch of familiar faces from various other movies that came out in 06-07.There, now you know, don't waste your money even renting it. I did and now I regret it.Maybe I'm being too harsh on the writers... no, I'm really not. I went into the experience expecting to see a mediocre slap-stick comedy with maybe a little hit-and-miss humor to it, but ended up with hate in my veins! I actually had to watch it in two sittings, it's that bad. My friend liked some of it though, I'll say that to be fair, but he couldn't argue with ANY of my complaints either.

I only made it about 20 minutes before giving up. In the right mood, I enjoy the sort of gross, juvenile humor these low-budget parody movies provide. Well, not this time. I was in the mood, I had snacks, and I've seen the movies being parodied so I was all prepared for a good time...Never have I seen so many gags fall so flat so fast. Every single joke was a complete dud. Terrible directing. Terrible writing. Terrible acting and even terrible cinematography. I spent some of those 20 minutes amusing myself by counting all the times the camera cuts off the tops of the actors' heads.Maybe they were trying for "so bad it's funny", but if so, they missed.

Every one is saying that the "Epic Movie" Is horrendous, well it actually isn't that bad. IF you watch other movies then you will get the humor associated with this movie. If you haven't watched (or are updated) on movies you obviously will not understand or even comprehend the message in the humor it is suppose to pull across. It is a DVD Rentable, defiantly not worth spending a lot on to take the whole family to the movie theaters. But you will obviously get an average laugh, and take out the number of errors in the movie (Which I don't know were on purpose or poor camera crew.) you will laugh at some parts (or not.) I didn't think it was an awful movie, it could of plucked and twisted a few of the errors but I don't say it should be categorized under 'HORRIBLE MOVIE!

My biggest mistake in life was probably buying a ticket to the movies for this total rubbish. Can't believe they had the guts to sell something like this. Thank god this kind of movies are not in fashion anymore.

reviews.review_title: Like Monty Python, minus the jokes you still laugh at 30 years later.
reviews.content: Epic movie can be summarized as meaningless pop culture references tied together in the weakest plot in the history of motion pictures. Movies like this make me appreciate the golden age of spoofs where movies like "The naked gun", "airplane", and, yes, even "scary movie". but what these two wannabe filmmakers churn out on a yearly basis gives the word "spoof" a bad name. epic movie should be branded for what it is, a useless waste of ninety minutes of your life so that these two "directors" can cash-in on the " "-movie franchise while putting in a minimal effort. i hope that their latest attempt "disaster movie" bombs so bad that no studio will hire them and they will leave us all alone.

I thought I was gonna have a good laugh. But for the heaven's sake, the movie was so boring. This movie is not at all funny.Please do never watch this movie. It is a complete waste of time.This movie made me sick.

reviews.review_title: If you want the worst of perversion for a very few laughs, watch this...
reviews.content: I was repulsed by much of this movie. References to bestiality and other perversities abound. I realize it is a satire, but this goes beyond the pale. About 90% of this film should have been left on the cutting room floor. The satire of Chronicles of Narnia is a travesty. The superhero satires were mildly amusing, however. The references to White Castle, another waste of celluloid, were hit-and-miss. The satire of Willie Wonka made my flesh crawl. The references to Harry Potter were simply distasteful. Then there is the political commentary that is so far to the left that I was begging to see Fahrenheit 911 instead of having to endure any more of this farce.

reviews.review_title: Parody for (Really, Really, Reeaally Big) Dumbies
reviews.content: I avoided this movie heavily during it's run at the box office. I knew that it was going to be a terrible film. It looked highly unoriginal and the jokes were all lame and uninspired. I even boycotted it, and told my sister not to see it. I had been disappointed by Date Movie in a huge way and I couldn't bare the smell of defeat.--But, a few weeks ago, we found a box of DVDs and my sister wanted to watch it. Since there was no financial attachment, I agreed to watch it. Show of hands... how many people found it funny? Put it down... don't be modest. From the start I could tell that it was uninspired... but how so. They didn't change the Willy Wonka character (though the remake was a joke within itself) and the chocolate making thing was just unnecessary. It went on to reference Pirates, Narnia, and MTV Cribs without adding any original twists to it. It also made me feel really insulted for the one lady who kept acting dumb... who probably did just in hopes of getting fired.Avoid this... This is byfar one of the worst parodies of any time and ranks with Norbit and What Love Is as the worst movies of the year.

reviews.review_title: If someone ever tells you Epic Movie is funny, you'll know they're as inbred as the British monarchy...
reviews.content: I try my best not to pay attention to other people's opinions about a film before I watch so I am not prejudiced against it. So having ignored any reviews and having seen just the trailer, I happily sat down with a friend to watch EPIC MOVIE expecting a few chuckles. Well maybe I should start paying a bit more attention to reviews because if I ever needed proof that you can't polish a turd...And what a turd it is! Older actors who really should know better (Fred Willard, Crispin Glover & Jennifer Coolidge), younger actors with faces you really want to slap (ESPECIALLY Kal Penn & Adam Campbell), Tony Cox playing the same wise-ass midget black guy character he plays in everything else you've ever seen him in (guess what - it still isn't funny!) and of course those dreadful musical numbers...this thing stinks like a Florida election result! Out of the whole movie I remember laughing ONCE, and whatever it was that made me do so couldn't have been that great, because I can't remember for the life of me what it was! The only other mildly entertaining moment was the naked chick coming out of the wardrobe...I see some reviewers have said EPIC MOVIE isn't as bad as DATE MOVIE. I beg to differ. DATE MOVIE had a few reasonably funny moments and the always enjoyable Alyson Hannigan, but EPIC MOVIE is absolutely terrible! It really is! I just can't stress that enough! All those other reviews saying it sucks the proverbial balls are right on the mark! My friend was very, very annoyed with me for making him lose 60-odd minutes of his life (and rightly so) but I sat there the whole time thinking "It's gonna get funny any minute now, surely?" but then all of a sudden it's over! And although the short run-time is a bit of a rip-off, in retrospect, it's probably a good thing.A big thank-you to the reviewers of IMDb for confirming it's not just me - this movie both sucks AND blows. Stay away from it. It could be more detrimental to your health than the video from RING!

Utterly worthless. No redeeming qualities. Waste of the interminable period during which it seemed to linger on. If I had it to do over, I would spend that time doing something productive, like stapling my genitalia with a staple gun. That certainly would have been less painful than this movie. The people who made this atrocity should be shot. I've seen home movies more entertaining. I just finished watching, and I had to resist the very strong urge to gouge out my eyes, a la Oedipus. I had to do some heavy drinking just to make it through this crap-pile. I'm almost certainly dumber for having watched this movie... it seems to suck the intelligence out of the room. I've already wasted more time bashing this movie than I spent laughing during it (which, by the way, is not at all). Certainly this blight on cinematic history deserves no more of my time. Let me finish by saying:AVOID THIS MOVIE! IT'S THE WORST MOVIE EVER MADE! YOU WILL REGRET WATCHING THIS, AND IT MAY WELL CAUSE YOU TO GOUGE OUT YOUR EYES IN DISGUST!

reviews.review_title: I am annoyed at the writers, producers, financiers of this movie.
reviews.content: Dear film industry, Please blacklist Jason Friedberg, Aaron Seltzer, Rodney M. Liber, Paul Schiff, Dawn Carter, the entire cast and everyone attached to this film from doing any more work in film entertainment. These people make poor decisions, they are only motivated by greed, they have no original ideas, and they are irresponsible. I understand that targeting the lowest common denominator increases box office revenue but this film has absolutely no value and it is offensively bad. I don't understand why New Regency Pictures, Regency Enterprises, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation gave the green light on this crap. Scary Movie 5 is in production and I am afraid that Abrahams/Zucker won't be able to fan the stink off of this franchise.

This movie was hilarious and it was meant for people who actually have a sense of humor and go in to the movie lookin for laughs, anybody who thought the movie was horrible, then why did you see it if you hated date movie...... DURRRRRRR!!!! its going to be the same humor and don't tell me the movie was horrible because when i saw it the whole movie theatre was laughing nonstop, are you people paid to give these movies bad reviews because i know and you know the whole theatre laughs when they see these movies so stop giving them bad reviews and give them what they deserve! so stop giving this awesome movie bad revies you ignorant dolts!!!! with fascists and biast opinions!!!!!

You cant go into this movie thinking you will be seeing an Oscar winner. You should expect this to be a random and silly teen comedy. If you go into it just expecting this then you will enjoy it. The movie chronicles the journey of four orphans through Gnarnia and their quest to defeat the evil white bitch. It spoofs, Chronicles of Narnia, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, MTV Cribs, Snakes on a Plane, Pirates of the Caribbean, Harold and Kumar go to White Castle, American Pie, X-Men, Nacho Libre, The DiVinci Code, and several other films. Although there are some less than humorous parts of the film, for the most part it is a rather witty comedy/spoof.But it will only be funny to those who are familiar with the movies it spoofs.It very closely resembled the Scary/Date movies with their random and childish humor.I found it quite funny.

Caught the un-cut version DVD the other night, The audience it was shooting for is too young to view this, but any adult can't or won't be able to enjoy this mish-mash. Juvenile doesn't begin to cover how pathetic this film is. It's sort of like an old Mad magazine satire but without the humor. Most of the movies it tries to make fun of are themselves very fragile "today" films which have already started to "date" themselves. The actors! Jennifer Coolidge has a fun part as the "White Bitch", Fred Willard should be embarrassed to have his name in the credits. Nothing else is of any value as entertainment. Costuming and sets are lush, but don't help.Carmen Electra has a fun part which she has fun with. Our 4 adoptees? Jayma Mays, perky and maybe a comedy star ala Goldie Hawn some day, but not yet. Kal Penn was good with what he had to work with, which is what you find on the floor of a cow pen. Think name change my friend. Faune A. Chambers needs to go back to commercials and stay there. Adam Campbell comes off as totally gay whether the script calls for it or not.

reviews.review_title: Who the HELL gave the "okay" for this movie to be made?
reviews.content: They (movie makers of this) should be made to watch this movie with eye clips so they do not blink sitting right next to a bunch of serial killers who have various weapons at their disposal.Honestly this movie is truly awful - they spoof a few movies like Charlie & Chocolate Factory & Superman in the first 20 mins then decide to rip on Narnia or "Gnarnia" (ho ho ho) for the rest of it. Fine no problem apart from they decide to rip on it the way an 8 year old boy who finds the humour in teletubbies fascinating and first rate would.Ironically my 27 year old cousin found this movie hilarious but then again he thought Superman 4 was a classic.To the more adult erm...adults here I reckon they will find this movie insulting and well...basically crap but I've just a look at the rating which clearly shows what type of age group the movie makers are going for which makes perfect sense in the end.I take it all back, these movie producers are geniuses as they know the teenage market this movie is made for will go and watch it and laugh their ass off whilst no doubt get drunk and high on some sort of illegal substance with their "babies momma" and leave the cinema remembering nothing. Don't worry kids, you haven't missed anything to talk about.

reviews.review_title: if u are going to see this movie!
reviews.content: if u are going to see this movie u must walk into the theater with a certain attitude. i knew this movie was going to be like scary movie 4, just the same old disgusting jokes and a lot of hitting each other in the head. i hate that because it isn't clever and is just stupid. but when i went to see epic movie i decided before i went into the theater that i was going to shut off my brain and just enjoy the silliness of it. AND IT WORKED!!! if u just relax and laugh at the stupid jokes they actually begin to be funny!!! if u walk into the theater thinking this movie is going to be a piece of sh*t then it will be, but if u just think "this is going to be a stupid but funny movie" then it will be. after i saw scary movie 4 i left the theater demanding my money back, but after seeing this (with my good attitude) i was laughing still 20 minutes after the movie was over! i gave it a 7/10 because it didn't make itself its own but instead did many jokes from other movies but it was still enjoyable and funny. but i do suggest renting it when it comes out because even though i liked it, i still wish i didn't spend $10 on it.

reviews.review_title: Proves that quality is better than quantity
reviews.content: Usually, I love parody movies. I grew up with the works of Mel Brooks, such as Spaceballs and Blazing Saddles, but also ZAZ's Airplane! and The Naked Gun. In my opinion these are wonderful, hilarious films that despite being silly, are also quite enjoyable.Sadly, the parody genre has degraded a lot over the last few years. I thought Scary Movie 1 & 2 were okay as well as Not Another Teen Movie, but this is nothing but a low-water mark in comedy. It's like they went into this project, thinking: "Whatever, it's not like we're making a real movie, it's just a parody." Well, a funhouse needs a good structure as much as any other building, or else it will fall apart.First off, the story, if you can even call it that, makes no sense. Don't get me wrong, inconsistencies and such makes other parodies great, but they also have some kind of plot, whether it's taken directly from a different movie or something original. What we have here is just a bunch of scenes put together where the humor depends too much on the likeness of the films they spoof.Second, the tempo is awfully frustrating. A good joke needs timing, whether it's quick or slow. In Epic Movie, the jokes are stretched out like saltwater taffy, as if the directors are thinking: "Sooner or later they'll laugh at it".Third, there are too many different movies from too many different genres in the mix. A spoof on Narnia should mainly be crossed with LoTR and Harry Potter, Superman Returns with X-Men The Last Stand, et cetera, but to go this far is just annoying.Fourth, so many good talents are wasted here. Seeing Jayma Mays acting like an overgrown, lisping 8-year-old just breaks my heart. She seems very sweet and I think she can do better than this. Same goes for Jennifer Coolidge. She can be really funny, but the only thing she did that I laughed at was this line: "The kids have es-kay-puh-duh." The fact that she never screams bugged me too. She's the bad guy, for crying out loud! A good villain should be able to be somewhat loud and menacing, even if it's just a parody. Heck, even Dark Helmet did that better than her.Thank goodness for people like Edgar Wright and Simon Pegg, known for their work on Shaun of The Dead and Hot Fuzz. These guys know how to make good parodies/homages and they show us there's still hope. I know everybody has different tastes and opinions when it comes to movies, but people ought to be smart enough to figure out what they really want to get for their money. If Hollywood starts to notice garbage like this doesn't do well at the box office, there might be some improvement. Hopefully.

reviews.review_title: Excellent-Best Movie I have Seen in Years (except Borat)
reviews.content: I thought this movie was excellent, and I usually hate 95% of the movies we go to. I very much enjoyed the parodies of Nacho Libre, the Da Vinci Code, and Pirates of the Caribbean, and all of the other stuff. I especially liked the rap video when they were on the pirate ship. I found this movie to be a whole lot funnier than other so-called comedies like Sideways, which I found to be extremely depressing in many ways. There was nothing to get bummed out about in this movie. It was just funny, and my kids also liked it. I guess this is a movie where you either love it or really, really hate it, judging from the votes. By the way, I also found the Scary Movie franchise very, very funny, and they kept making these. I hope the producers make an Epic Movie II, III, and IV, since I will definitely go see them.

reviews.review_title: It was all I expected, and I had no expectations.
reviews.content: There is nothing new I can say that many other reviewers and IMDBers haven't already said.EPIC MOVIE is filled w/recycled jokes and simply tries too hard too often to succeed as what could've been a very well produced epic parody.The scenery and costumes were pretty exceptional, which helped ground the movie in reality. Even the acting was pretty darn nifty. Crispin Glover was an inspiring Willy Wonka. Carmen Electra, though recycled throughout the Scary Movies, still shows she can play the scene straight and let the jokes blossom... even if part of the joke is that she's a shape-shifting mutant who acts more like a pussycat doll in the hallway of a school. Faune Chambers played her role beautifully as well, and good luck w/those adoptive parents! Even Jennifer Coolidge stole my heart ("that's Stiffler's mom!").It was the script itself that doomed this film. I really did enjoy the concept where four orphans from different cultures (and films) would meet up and go on a quest together, but the idea isn't enough when it's laced with poor dialogue and over-used references. Even the Pirates of the Caribbean music video, which I had seen previously on YouTube, was just too obscure for this film.
