I want to believe Jayma Mays is talented (I loved her in RED EYE), but that she was directed to be an even more stupid Cindy Campbell from Scary Movie fame, which numbed me from giving a damn about her. Overall this movie had great moments which I had wish would've lasted longer (X-Men, especially), but once it was cut together, those few moments of enjoyment just weren't enough. This movie is best saved for DVD when you can watch it while heavily drunk with your friends, but rather then rent it, buy it! ...and make sure it's the (inevitable) Unrated version, as there may be jokes you'll miss from being so far drunk and laughing w/your friends.

reviews.review_title: I never thought the Devil existed, but God clearly wouldn't make something as painful as this
reviews.content: Comedy is a dying breed. With hacks such as Carlos Mencia and Dane Cook "gracing" the stage, and films such as Date Movie, Scary Movie (2 through to 4), and Epic Movie, its obvious its time is fading.It becomes apparent that the movie will be painful when their idea of a joke is renaming the White Witch to the White Bitch. The plot was thin. Even though it is a spoof, it'd still be good to at least have a structure that you could build on, with entertaining characters. Maybe then you wouldn't need so many useless Mtv references.The characters, as stated before, were weak in character and in action (save for the performance of Kal Penn, which could be the only saving grace of the film). It was tedious to view all characters acting to the same caliber, Lucy being my least favourite.There is also the question of title. Why is it called "Epic Movie", if a, all of the films spoofed were not epics, and b, where's the originality? However, in having said all of this, there was one good thing about the film: it shows that anyone can get a movie made, despite the lack of talent. There is also the question of title. Why is it called "Epic Movie", if a, all of the films spoofed were not epics, and b, where's the originality? However, in having said all of this, there was one good thing about the film: it shows that anyone can get a movie made, despite the lack of talent.
Bored me to tears! About 5 good jokes then the rest could have been written by a pre-schooler. I burnt the disc instead of giving it back to Blockbuster (this was a while ago).

I watched this film for the first time in September 2013, with my wife, broadcast on TV quite late at night. Not paying to see the film, not seeing it in 2007, and seeing it after some of the actors have become more familiar provides an altogether different perspective, and possibly this film's reputation deserves some rehabilitation.The fact that we only started to watch it during the 'Nacho Libre' scene and didn't change the channel immediately I think has to be a sort of recommendation. In fact after settling into it we managed to watch it through to the end. And it wasn't completely terrible!There's a mixed bag of humour, from very obvious visual gags, contemporary cultural references and parodies, and the whole storyline is creatively stitched together in a kind of absurdist humour, reminiscent of Monty Python.It was quite nice during the character introduction to recognise actors like Jayma Mays, Kal Penn, and later Jennifer Coolidge, from their later appearances in hit US comedy shows: Glee, How I Met Your Mother, and Two Broke Girls. But of course six years ago they were still relatively unknown, and so that dimension of familiar recognition would have been lost. Shame. But it speaks highly that the casting director picked out such talent back then, and they each play their roles quite well.As a TV movie it definitely works, and approached with low expectations can be pleasantly surprising. It doesn't look 'cheap': the indoor sets are very creative and well finished, the photography is pretty good, and as mentioned the talent also delivers. It doesn't take itself seriously, at any point, and frequently breaks the fourth-wall to remind you of the kind of movie that you're watching.Even the cultural references have a kind of a point now. This films dates itself very firmly by references to the source material of the time (all of which I saw back then) so it was nice to be reminded of those other great films that I did enjoy, six years ago. I doubt I'd watch it again though. I certainly would not have paid money to see it, but then professional film critics never pay either...

reviews.review_title: So crap I won't even put a smart ass title for my review.
reviews.content: If you are reading these comments because you are wondering whether or not to see the film, let me save you 86 minutes of your life.The creators of this film seem to think that by saying "From 2 of the 6 creators of scary movie" people will look at this film in a more comical way, after all these films "scary movie, date movie epic movie) aren't really to be taken seriously, however, they are to entertain us and make us laugh, this film didn't make me laugh, and I think toy story is funny, so i'm easily amused.I haven't seen date movie, nor am I going to now that i've discovered its made by the same two unfunny freaks that have made this abomination.Scary movie is hilarious, so the only mathematical explanation I can come up with is that the two "directors" (if I should dare call them that, my dog is more of a director) that made epic movie are the worst two out of the six.This film is rated 15 in my country (United Kingdom) but the humour is only suitable for 13-14 year olds. The kind of kids that think the word "boobs" is rude and then spend a hour giggling about it.The jokes in this film aren't funny, the puns are lame, the story doesn't exist, the cinematography is laughable (doesn't mean the film is funny) and the acting, well i'm gonna stop before I hurt someones feelings.I don't no one person that enjoys this film, nor do I expect to meet one. If you want to watch this film, I suggest you make a plan B film to watch on the same night, cause after 30 minutes of dibble you may feel like you're wasting your time.1(becuase I can't choose 0) out of 10.

reviews.review_title: This one made me vomit in my mouth...
reviews.content: This movie was so bad it made my skin crawl. I beg anyone with any intelligence, don't see it. Just look at all the other reviews! The only reviews that are good are ones made by 13 year old boys!!! This speaks volumes!!! This movie is stupid, gross, vulgar, tedious and possibley the worst movie I have ever scene! This is obviously the attempt of some sorry and in debt people trying to make money off of the recent success of Scary Movie and the more recent Date Movie. Date Movie sucked, but this movie is far worse. The jokes that where made where stupid, and offensive. The characters included Goat-Pimps and a handful of pedophiles. Still sound fun? Have at it you sorry fools!!!

The writers and directors of this film are geniuses! I can't imagine any other director living or dead having the talent to wring absolutely every iota of joy or humor from every frame of this film in such a spectacular fashion. It must have taken years of preparation. Even so, you'd think merely by accident there would be a smattering of humor hidden in this sad morass of mindless drivel; ahhhhh, but this was no accident; after all, they wrote the script!Knowing that Friedberg and Seltzer have catapulted this rousing success into a disturbing parade of future stinkers, well now, I can only congratulate them on a job well done. Not worth watching, mind you, but well done. I look forward to avoiding their films in the future.

Im a film buff and I see just about everything that hits theaters (and some that don't) and this is the single worst movie i have ever seen. I didn't even sit through it. I sat through Alexander and i couldn't last 20 minutes through this before my friend and I walked out.I've never before walked out of a movie theater and felt dirty, and ask myself..."how the f**k did they get movie rights??" This is proof that ANYONE can make it in Hollywood.Please don't even pay to see this movie... don't even wait for it to come out on DVD. In fact, don't even download it. Its a waste of your life and if you really wanted to see it, STEAL it. Why steal? Because the thrill of taking it out of a store and risk of getting caught is MORE exciting than the movie is. At least then you might get something out of it.

reviews.review_title: I can guess what's going to be sold at the next car boot sale... And it's NOT going to be Men in Black 2...
reviews.content: If you like screaming black guys plastered in bad white makeup and an alabaster wig and bad blue contacts trying to kick the hell out of a half-lion, half-pervert that constantly switches from a flabby, middle aged Caucasian man with stuck on fur, to an east-Asian man with muscles and stuck on fur... And long scenes with rap evil enough to make you puke playing and a man in a bad half-goat suit making out with an anamatronic beaver... Along with hundreds of bad jokes stolen from other movies and TV series... This is the movie for you.However, it might not anyway with all the other weird and stupid stuff going on.I was expecting this movie to be so bad it goes full circle and becomes so bad it's good. And my expectations seemed to be fulfilled in the introductions of the main four characters.But the minute they turned up at the chocolate factory, I discovered that this film went full circle twice, and become excruciatingly painful to watch.After watching it from start to finish, you may have a strange feeling that you might have felt somewhere before... The moment after you've just had an accident in your car or on your bike or board that you weren't expecting, and for a few moments you are left dazed and confused. You have no idea where you are, what you're doing, and what just happened. The it all comes rushing back.NEVER watch this movie. And if you already have, I feel sorry for you.And if you saw it and LIKED it, I feel even MORE sorry for you. because you have now proved yourself to be a member of the wandering teenage undead. (BTW, I'm 18 and two months! If you think I'm an 82 year old granny with a cob on, you be wrong!)

I think this movie was another comedy, and mostly, a comedy does not get very high grades on IMDb. If you look at Epic movie, the humor they use is typical to the scary movie thing, and that is very funny. So please, don't say Epic movie wasn't funny at all...I really liked the thing they did with the MTV Cribs thing in the house of the faun, very original. But the best is the way some thing in the story. Al the movies they ,,used'' to make some scenes in this one, where written together as one, on a very original and funny way.And above all, at least it isn't another parody on another series of horror movies, like the scary movie parts...I will recommend this movie to all the people who is having a party with some friends and some beers, and who wants a good laugh, because then you will like this movie

Okay, okay. We all love the Scary Movies. Some of us liked Not Another Teen Movie. There are few of us who even liked the dreadful Date Movie. But this film is just horrible. So many good ideas... wasted. All it aimed for were cheap laughs, mostly gross-out humor (and I mean gross). Not to mention that probably what kept most people in the theater was all the T&A. Anything in the trailer and in the commercials that seemingly passed off Epic Movie as something funny, I warn you - you are being deceived! Whatever moments in previews that were funny, I tell you, that is IT. There is nothing worth seeing in the actual movie. This is the first movie that I EVER walked out of and it was a waste of ten dollars. Don't see this movie.

What happened to the good old days of Airplane and Mel Brooks when satire was good? Epic Movie did not answer this question by putting its name up with Blazing Saddles or even Gremlins 2. The only reason this gets a 3 and not a one is because of the cast. Fred Willard was worth a point and a half with the other 1.5 belonging to Jayma Mays. I remember a small laugh here and there during the move, but I don't remember why or what I was laughing at 48 hours later. I do remember which parts were worse than others. The whole Willy Wonka satire, any line said by Captian Jack Swallows, any satire of Cribs, Punk'd, or any other MTV related show. However, I may be overlooking the true genius of this picture: It made big bucks. It took a genius to take this bag of moldy tangerines of a movie and make money with it. They got my $8.50. The only way I could see this movie growing on me over time is if Jayma Mays marries me. Then this would be a 10 out of 10 stars!

reviews.review_title: Could have been a lot better (especially if rated R)
reviews.content: This movie had potential to be funny, yet it just wasn't. The parodies were good, the jokes were sometimes funny, but the characters all sucked except for "Kumar" who was the only one that seemed to get what the hell was going on. They took the movie as far as they could, yet it needed to be even more insane to make it funny at all, so they should have just bitten the bullet and made a rated R movie out of it. Sadly they didn't. I don't really know if this pertains to the movie or not but it was really sad that my two friends and i were the only people in the theater that were laughing at the parodies, while everyone else was laughing at the idiotic side jokes, the draw obviously was too young and too ignorant. Don't waste your time going to this unless its your only option, but if your into poorly made movies and like to see films that you could have made better, this is the one for you.

Why do you people rated this movie so low? It's not bad at all, and it's really funny if you have seen the movies it makes fun of. This kind of movies are extremely relaxing, and i think movies that make fun of other movies are great, because it's always great to see strong resemblances with characters, locations, plot of non-comedy movies translated to comedy so to speak, and that could not be more hilarious. Scary Movie was better because always horrors turned to comedy is better because... it's like making fun of the thing that scares you the most.My guess (and i am right) is that epic movie fans (superman, Narnia, x-men, and PoTC ) got upset off and rated this movie 1-2 out of 10... that's why it's rated 2.0 . Buy a sense of humor.

reviews.review_title: Unfortunately, this one is really lame
reviews.content: I really like spoofs and such. As lame as they can be, most of them I thoroughly enjoy. For example, Date Movie is generally considered a bad movie but I had a lot of fun when I saw it.Epic Movie however is quite something else. It just ain't funny - never. Now that I've seen it, I wonder why I even bothered seeing the entire movie.There just were too many things in the movie which indicated no effort was made to produce a decent spoof. I can't go into any details here without giving away spoilers, but when you do muster the strength to see the movie you'll understand what's wrong with this movie.I want more spoofs like Date Movie or Scary Movie. Those I could enjoy. Movie like Epic Movie, however, should be banned forever. I honestly never thought I would say such a thing about any movie, but here it is. Sorry to the folks who made this movie, but better luck next time.

reviews.review_title: was this supposed to be funny?
reviews.content: This movie makes Date Movie look good. At least I had a couple laughs in Date Movie. I tried really hard to laugh at this but i just couldn't, it was so stupid and dumb. There was only one part that I found amusing, and that was when they make fun of pussycat dolls "beep" because every other word was a beep. Otherwise, it was stupid and the octopus on the white bitches face looked really fake as well as some of the snakes on the black girl. The parts about Harry Potter were unfunny and well as the Willy Wonka scene. Also, one of the most annoying things ever, which made me want to kill myself, was when the redhead kept repeating everything the black girl said...?? WHY? it was not funny the first time, it was not funny the 20th time. This movie is horrible. Don't SEE!

reviews.review_title: This movie isn't even close to the worst movie ever
reviews.content: Some parts of the movie were funny, some parts weren't! Darrell Hammond from SNL did the best job playing Captain Swallows! I thought it could of been Johnny Depp. The guy who played Nacho Libre (Jareb Duplaise) Kessler from Entourage, played it to perfection. I had to look it up to see it wasn't Jack Black. Even Crispin Glover from Back to the Future played a good Willy Wonka. I'll give you this, parts dragged and even went very lame a lot, but if you laughed at all and I'm pretty sure you did, it can't be the worst movie ever. If you thought Denzel Washington was going to show up and cry and win an Oscar, I can see why you were disappointed. It's a spoof movie from the creators of Date Movie. You know what you're getting.

I write this as I watch the movie! Yes ladies and gentlemen, it is awful! I admire good parodies, but making fun of a list of movies that are great, and in a very bad way, is very sad. this movie is seriously a waste of money for all its investors, and bad reputation for those who acted in it. One would think that the whole crew that has been creating this string of movies for a period of ten years got the message that they have been exponentially making it worst, and yet they still present us with this horror. I have never not finished a movie I started watching hence why i watched the movie, and ironically enough, the cut scenes of the actors errors shown during the credits are funnier than what I just finished watching.

This movie was just disgusting and definitely not worth seeing. I mean, yeah, there were some very rare-repulsion-free-funny moments, but altogether,these would make 5 minutes out of an hour and a half which is the duration of the movie. And I am sure out of this you will only tolerate 10 minutes as maximum except if you are a fan of gross! So, first, if you you're ever ganna watch it you better be forced, and not just forced, it better be a life or death situation. Second, you better keep a bucket beside you if you don't want to stain the floor. Third, don't bring anyone with you so they won't hate you. Now, if you have taken all the precautions listed and maybe more, you may sit in front of yo VCR and enjoy... not!

There is a difference between a parody and an imitation. Parodies are to imitate (a composition, author, etc.) for purposes of ridicule or satire (dictionary.com). Imitations are to make a copy of; reproduce closely (dictionary.com).All-be-it mostly unfunny, Saturday Night Live is still best at doing satirical parodies. They know how to take the situational or character flaws of a celebrity or news figure and exploit them to the point of enjoyment. (There are many gems coming out of the SNL camp, like new heroes characters and Andy Samburg's digital shorts).An imitation will use an original as a template, or if extremely lazy completely just rip off the source material. Since we're contrasting imitations with parodies, imitations in this case usually put a twist to the source. For example, Mr. Tumnus in Epic Movie is played by the actor who brought life to Nacho Libre's tag partner/ Napoleon Dynamyte's friend Pedro. In order to make the character funny, they just made him look really weird, essentially he played the exact same character of Mr. Tumnus in Narnia- the first time.Epic movie also put a FULL 5 minute imitation of MTV cribs. Yes their observations on rappers and scarface were true, but it was funny the first 4 years of my life I saw it on SNL, Mad TV, any other show that actually takes itself seriously in the form of Cribs.Epic movie also put a FULL 4 minute imitation of the Chronicles of Narnia song that came out --( notice my imitation of paragraphs)------ oh I don't know, over 1 year ago? The Chronic-What-cles of Narnia is technically a comedic parody in itself: it parodies hard rap and nerds that really want to see an epic movie like Narnia. RULE: Never Ever Make A Parody of a Parody. It was virtually the same beat, with a new movie title put in.Oh and if you make an Epic Movie --- make sure all the movies IMITATED are Epic. I don't think Talledega Nights is considered epic, nor was it a blockbuster. Neighter was Borat, or Nacho Libre. --- And Paris Hilton isn't epic.

I'll be honest, I did not see the entire movie; I walked out after twenty minutes. At that point, I was about ready to try to choke myself to death on popcorn. It was awful. Every second that I saw was positively awful. There were absolutely no redeemable qualities whatsoever. I don't know how the writer and directors managed to produce this; you'd think that halfway through they'd realize they had garbage and try to do the world a favor by scrapping it. I don't know who read the script and said: "wow, this could be really good. Having the faun from Narnia do a spoof on MTV's cribs? That's a terrific idea!" If you haven't seen this, you are lucky. Don't. Try hard not to. I can't stress to you how awful this is. To think that someone allowed the same crew to create another abomination is borderline unthinkable. This is quite possibly the worst piece of film I have ever seen.

The movie starts with four orphans named Lucy, Edward, Susan, and Peter finding gold tickets to Willy wonka's chocolate factory. During these intros of the characters they parody The Da Vinci Code, Nacho Libre, Snakes on a Plane and Xmen. When Willy Wonka turns child molester like, they go into the wardrobe. SPOILER SPOILER Mr. Tumnus sends the kids off to Hogwarts and they train with Harry Potter, killing Ron Weasley, Albus Dumbledore, Minerva McGonagall, and Rubeus Hagrid in the process. I would have personally liked to see a parody of Draco Malfoy. That would have been hilarious. SPOILER The kids realize the White B*tch got killed by Jack Swallows and they find the wardrobe and return. They meet SPOILERBorat, and ended up dying. Pretty good film, except for the end.

What is there to say about Epic Movie? The jokes were lame, the plot predictable, and the acting sub-par. Though, when you go to a movie created by 2 of the writers from Scary Movie, I don't know why you would be expecting to see a coherent, intelligent movie. The only amusing satire was from the "Punk'd", Cribs, and the Jack Sparrow parody's. The rest was just a string of jokes that are far too overused (terrible Magneto satire, and lame sexual humor). Though, expecting to see an intelligent movie is being a bit unrealistic, expecting good (or at least so immature it is amusing) satire is not asking too much. This movie failed to deliver in most categories, and unless you are wanting a movie that is overall just overused humor, I would not recommend seeing this movie unless you don't have to pay and are willing to sit through about 45 minutes of lame humor.

reviews.review_title: The 3rd Worst Movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: Now this is my second review of this film because the first review just didn't right and professional so here is the 2nd review.This film is really bad lets get that straight but it is not the WORST movie I have seen because Zombie Nation fills that spot and by the way never watch Zombie Nation EVER.Okay so Epic Movie ONE of the worst films I have seen its got the worst plot that is so boring and makes you cry as to why you are watching this. The acting is poor to say the least but not the worst I have seen. Now for the main bit which is how funny is it and the answer is not very funny, now I will admit there is 1 or 2 bits in the film that made me chuckle and thats it other than that its not funny really.Avoid at all costs.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I have seen
reviews.content: Lets start out by saying I've watched over 500 movies and I rarely give 1 star to movies. This has to be the 2nd worst movie I've watched.Now don't get me wrong; I enjoyed watching the "Movies" such as the Scary Movie series and some other ones. But this has two funny parts in the movie (mild funny), that's less time then a commercial. The two funny parts were about The Da Vinci Code and about 50 cent. This movie also contains a bunch of vulgar humor which isn't funny but plain dum.Final words: This move is cheap & stupid.Rating: -Overall: 1/10 -Soundtrack: 0/10 -Special Effects (2007): 1/10-Plot: 1/10 -Dialogue: 1/10 -Acting: 1/10 -Humor/Comedy: 2/10 --For the 2 1-minute parts.-Memorable: 7/10 --I remember it as one of the worst movies I ever watched.-Ending: 2/10 -Anything Special/Unique? Well its one the worst movies ever made.-Worth Watching? Unless you want to see a really good example of an Epic Failure then you will just waste your time watching it.

reviews.review_title: The 'epic' thing was to have made such a mess.
reviews.content: Sometimes one wonders how is it possible that this has been done, is it that perhaps the world of entertainment (in this case, the cinema) does not have "someone" who is able to assess the "product" before releasing it, it is also valid to ask, can anyone like this, the fact that someone does not like something does not necessarily mean that no one will like it, but it is that.... I refuse to believe that anyone would consider "Epic Movie" as a good movie, not even acceptable !!!!I don't know if it has happened but it would be good to ask the writers, producers, screenwriters and actors if they consider "Epic Movie" as a good movie or if they all consider it as a "blip" (a very ugly one, by the way) in their career. I have always considered that things should be valued for what they offer and not for what we would like them to offer, "Epic Movie" is supposed to be a comedy, could someone tell me in which scene they laughed, what are the funny and comical scenes of "Epic Movie"?Or is it that I am losing my sense of humor?
This is , one of the funniest movies of all time . Can't stop laughing.The actors are so brilliant. The score also is at a high level.

reviews.review_title: A slight step up from Date Movie
reviews.content: I didn't know whether to hate this movie right off the bat or give it a small chance. From the looks of the trailer, it looked pretty stupid. I'm a big fan of spoof and I enjoyed all of the Scary Movies. Date Movie was an all out disaster, so I pretended like I didn't even watch that. So could these two make a comeback?Kind of and no. I felt that a lot of this movie again involves too much pee and fart jokes and slapstick every second. Some of the spoofs were actually done alright, some didn't at all. I felt that this was a lot better than Date Movie,but that's not saying too much. Does it deserve a 2.3? No, not that low, maybe a 4.0 at best. If they do decide to do another spoof, which I guarantee they will do, lets hope its not revolved around someone peeing or throwing up for an attempt at a joke.4.5/10

reviews.review_title: Worst Movie I Have Ever seen
reviews.content: This is quite possibly the worst movie I have ever seen. The jokes were not only non-original and non-creative but they were not even the slight bit humorous. It did make fun of some classic movies, such as "A Christmas Story", but even that scene was not funny. The plot was entirely based on "The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe" and a lot of the jokes were just disgusting. The movie tried to become the "epic" movie by including references to not only other movies but also to many television shows, and as a result the jokes became old very fast. The jokes and references to X-Men were very numerous and lacked any humor whatsoever. The ending of this movie was probably the worst joke of them all. I do not recommend this movie to anyone.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant Movie with the most incredible storyline
reviews.content: You should seriously spend your money on this one. I suggest you should get 2 copies in case of one gets destroyed anyhow. I personally put it in my safe because this movie is the most precious thing in my whole life. About the story: the storyline is very thick and definitely not cheesy. Do NOT, I repeat do NOT listen to all the haters around here. This movie WILL cheer up your decade. Because I need ten lines i'm still typing this review. So anyhow Chuck Norris Will Roundhousekick Your Puny ass if you do not buy this movie. I will personally call him on his cellphone to roundhouse kick you in the face and he will do it. I will give this flick 10 out of 10 stars for the brilliant effort of the actors and the excellent casting.

reviews.review_title: It was dumb, but it was supposed to be...
reviews.content: Well I've read most of the reviews of this movie, which wasn't that bad, and felt it was very undeserving of such reviews. Epic Movie was exactly what I expected it to be, a stupid spoof that makes you laugh. I cannot believe that someone cannot laugh once during this movie. It was made by the some of the people who made Scary Movie and Date Movie, so I expected some of the same actors to play in it from Date Movie as Scary Movie does. Some people says they were offended by some parts of it, bottom line, if you are easily offended by what you are, DON'T WATCH THIS MOVIE! Also, if this movie was that bad, why did some filmmakers rush to make a spoof of sports movies if spoofs are such failures. Epic Movie was meant to be a stupid, pointless, movie that would make at least half of the general public laugh and they succeeded.

This movie was made with the intent to humour the audience, not to be anything absolutely stunning or mindblowing. And the makers of this film succeeded. While it may not be a masterpiece of any sort, this will be worth your ticket money if you can take a joke. If you go into this movie expecting to be entertained, you will be. But if you go in here expecting nothing, then you'll probably dislike it, as you'll convince yourself before the movie starts that you won't enjoy it. As long as you want to be amused and not an old snob who is too good for these sorts of movies, I guarantee you you will be entertained from start to finish, and be roaring with laughter. Bring popcorn. Popcorn will help.

I don't see why people have such a bee under their bonnet about this film. Is it because it has the guts to make fun of the over-budget tosh that is constantly realised these days? Is it because it makes Willy Wonker out to be a kiddie fiddler? Is it because it really shows what a prat Captain Jack Sparrow really was? Or was it because it makes a point? For me that film was a breath a fresh air, for somebody who likes good old fashioned random humour, and not High profile mumbo that has about as much creativity as a water shortage. Now I'll watch any film once but not oneNOT ONE! "High-Profile" move bought out in the last few years has even begun to impress me.The only real recommendation I have for those of you that haven't seen it yet is this. Give it a go before you slag it off, and for goodness sake don't spend the whole time being shocked about the fact this film makes fun of other films. Just watch it for the humour. Yes its exposing how stupid Jack sparrow is and how there were snakes on a plane but take a joke. Epic movie is just a spoof. A dam good spoof!

I don't think i have ever seen a worse movie. It was written by idiots, probably the two worst writers of scary movie. It was an insult to my intelligence watching this, because i am supposed to be dumb enough to appreciate this. The spoofs sucked. It could have been done so much better. I also Hated the musical interludes, which i thought were so stupid. This movie was so bad, it made the movies it spoofed seem even worse. The borat look-alike was terrible, it didn't even look like him. The acting was terrible, i totally hated the whole thing. I wish i could give this thing a zero. I laughed twice during the movie. This was done so poorly! the stunt double for the lion... you could see his face, and you can also see the dummy that jack sparrow whacks. I hated it! Don't spend money on this. At least wait till it comes out on TV.

reviews.review_title: 4 orphans; Edward, Peter, Lucy & Susan set off on a magical epic adventure.
reviews.content: This movie was actually rather enjoyable. Although, I think it's because I love Family Guy because of it's oddness, and randomness, I think that's why I found it so enjoyable.This film first starts out, with a narrator (much like Charlie and the chocolate factory's style) introducing each character. While introducing each character, the characters each find a Golden ticket in a Willy Bar. *Spoilers* From there, they go to the Willy Candy factory (they don't use Wonka for legal reasons) and Willy shows them the candy room, complete with open sewer line. Then, Willy tells the orphans, that there will be a piece of them each in his candy. It's what makes it so delectable. He locks them in the candy room, and takes a body part from them each. Then after wards, they are in another room waiting... and they hear Willy coming, so they all hide. Lucy finds the room where the wardrobe is kept, and opens it. A ton of junk crushes her. She goes in, and is taken to Gnarnia. The other orphans follow shortly after. They must stop the "WHITE BITCH"This is actually a really good movie. If you love random things happening, like "FAMILY GUY" style, then this is for you.

No it wasn't the best spoof movie,but there have been worse. The best spoof in recent times was Scary Movie and the sequel and Epic Movie is not up to par and I admit that. But it did better than I expected.It made more sense than Date Movie ever did. Epic Movie at least had a tighter script,stuck more to the type of films it spoofed and I know that isn't saying much. Date Movie went all over the place,it hard to spoof already funny movies. So I gave Epic Movie a 7 out of 10 for the effort.Kal Penn was great in this and I hope to see more of him in leading roles.The Things I liked The Harry Potter part was funny I loved the Jack Sparrow parody The Use of the Witch,The Lion and the Wardrobe as the glue for the movie.I wont mention the bad, I think everyone has covered it.

reviews.review_title: Epically Bad, but not the worst movie ever
reviews.content: Come on people, this is not the worst movie ever. Sure, the majority of the jokes were stupid, but it was at least some parts were good for some light chuckles. what bother me is the potential this movie had. It could have been a hilarious movie if the 2 out of six Scary Movie writers involved hadn't been the Scary Movie credit writers. In fact, the funniest parts of this movie were the quick little references it made to movies such as Star Wars and James Bond. Seeing the Stormtroopers as part of the White Bitch's army was among the funnier parts of the movie. Considering the amount of hype this movie got, and the movie it could have been, it was epically awful. Please, God, make the next spoof movie clever.

I seen this movie is not as funny as you see it in the commercials. The movie is about four orphans who win tickets to go to Willy Wonkas chocolate factory only to discover than Wonka uses people in his candy. Then later he tries to get them but they find the world Gnarnia in a closet. There they meet the faun and what not takes on of the main characters around while making fun of movies. Then Edward goes in meets The White B**** only to say wow its Stifler's mom. Later they meet Also and they beat the Witch. The jokes are over ratted and awful. There's a few times the movie is funny but not a lot. I recommend any Scary Movie makes fun of less movies which makes the movie better to watch and there funnier.

I saw Epic Movie on opening day with all of my friends. In general I thought that this movie was hilarious and all out fun to watch. Though there are some parts that aren't funny but I would recommend people to see it! The plot was well thought out and the spoofs are genius. Some people say that this movie "sucked" or this movie "rocked!" In my view, I say that this movie "rocked" and I do plan on buying this one on DVD. No Epic Movie is not a blockbuster but it is something you should pay about $6 to enjoy. You will be surprised on how well the impersonations are, the spoofs are, and the stunts are. GO SEE THIS MOVIE!!! You will leave the theatre laughing.

reviews.review_title: Do not believe the bad reviews
reviews.content: If you happen to come across one of the (many) bad reviews of this movie, don't trust them. This movie is simply the most hilarious movie I have seen all year. The way the actors portray characters such as Willy Wonka and Jack Sparrow is simply amazing and the difference between the person Epic Movie character and real thing is very small. This movie is a definite for anyone with a funny bone and likes any films like Pirates Of The Caribbean, X Men, Charlie And The Chocolate Factory (2006), Snakes On A Plane, Narnia, Nacho Libre, Da Vinci Code or any of the other big blockbusters next year.If your willing to risk it, see this movie.If you don't find people taking the p*** out of blockbusters and involve urine, vomit, turd, farts and stuff like that, STAY AWAY.10/10 from me.

reviews.review_title: I object to the comment made from bigmacsflyingcircus from New Zealand
reviews.content: I must admit that this movie was not as Epic as i had first thought it would be. Although it did not for a moment disappoint me.There are many different types of humor and bigmacsflyingcircus from New Zealand must not have the same sense of humor that the creators of Epic Movie have or the majority of people that fully enjoyed it. If you did not like Scary Movie then it is obvious Epic Movie will not be your cup of tea. I think that the people reviewing this movie should have that particular sense of humor associated with parody movies. I am one of those people and i loved the Scary Movies, my favorite songs are my Weird Al Yankvich and i was in hysterics for a lot of Epic Movie.So a word of advise for people who review movies... Of course there are going to be bad comments if the person doesn't enjoy the genre they are critquing, so give every movie a fair go and let it be judged by the true fans of that genre. We are the only people who could really judge the quality of one parody movie to the next.Thankyou and goodnight.

I liked the movie it was pretty good, but had no references to LOTR, which i was amazed by. Anyway it had pretty good parts i feel i would have enjoyed it a lot more if i was like 13 again. The movie travels along 4 orphans who meet by finding the 4 golden tickets to Willy's chocolate factory and stumble into a wardrobe to find gnarnia(G is silent). it was worth the 7.50 i paid to see it. The ending though will leave you feeling either disgusted or laughing hysterically. If you were a fan of Scary Movie 1,2 and 3 and said 4 was okay, or if you really did like 4 too then you'll like this movie a lot. I saw it opening day, the theater was surprisingly only half filled.

beginning of the story was interesting and entertaining, sometimes got a little out of hand. however, later on in the movie there were just too many unnecessary scenes and ideas. i give this movie credit for having bunch of good partstoo bad the bad parts overlap good ones giving it a negative score.2 stars for creativity of a plotand 2 stars for bunch of good jokeslets not go over the negative and keep it there.conclusion: wait until it comes out on DVD. once your friend gets it.. watch it there. for those who have a precious life, don't bother!

reviews.review_title: Not sure what definition of "Epic" they were going by
reviews.content: I read the reviews and thought they were way too harsh for any movie, so I watched 15 or so minutes of the movie and found several things. First, I never knew a movie could have such poor scripting, plot, or humor. Second, that I would never get these wasted 15 minutes of my life back. Finally, that a movie can really be 2 out of 10 or less. I feel as if I could make a funnier spoof with no funding or professional filming/ acting. To give an idea of the lack of humor, imagine a man with severe AD/HD with a camera and script in his hands. Not only was this film hard to follow, it wasn't worth following. I enjoy the Scary Movies very much, and find them hilarious. I had to struggle to even put forth a slight grin at one of the attempts at comedy. Please do not watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Don't Waste Your Time or Money
reviews.content: Got some money burning a hole in your pocket? Feel like taking a nap? Then Epic Movie is the movie for you. Yes, I wasted money contrary to the advice I had read. It was the only movie showing at the time I showed up at the theater. I could have done better making faces in a mirror. As to taking the nap, the movie wasn't long enough to actually fall asleep but the theater was silent enough that I got some rest.Seriously, only an adolescent could possibly grasp the storyline with its abundance of bathroom "jokes". Maybe the producers thought they could get some kind of boost off the Scary Movie franchise. Instead, they may have further devalued the Scary Movie franchise.

Well how do you say his nicely. This is a movie you watch when you have no intent to actually watch the movie. It was Disasterific. There was nothing really there at all.I'll admit there was a couple "funny" parts. If you asked me though I couldn't tell you. They where not memorable like some jokes on something like scary movie. Yes scary movie is a academy award production compared to this.If the movie was that bad you may be wondering, Why did i give it a three? because cpt. jack and some of the others look alike's where pretty dang good look a likes. That and very pathetic humour is all it's got going for it.If you want to see it i suggest you and a group of friends rent it from blockbuster and save you all some cash and at least with your friends it will be funny when you make fun of the crappieness together!

I knew when I saw a parody of the Saturday Night Live bit "Lazy Sunday," I was in trouble. What is Epic Movie 2 going to have a take off of the "D*ck In A Box" segment? In all actuality though, the movie wasn't THAT bad. It was far superior to Date Movie, which I walked out of last year. But the movie itself is so short (iMDB says 86 minutes, but it didn't feel like it even cracked the eighty minute mark) that it didn't seem worth the price of admission. It actually didn't give you time to walk out even if you wanted too.The two (out of six) Scary Movie writers, Friedberg and Seltzer, were hit or miss with their bits. But luckily there were more hits than misses. I've got to tell you though; these dudes are OBSESSED with the black rapper and MTV culture. Every other joke is someone having a grill or break dancing or getting "crunk" or being a DJ on a turntable. And in Date Movie they did the "Pimp My Ride" joke, so of course here they've got to do the "Cribs" knock off. If you find that kind of thing funny, this ones a can't miss.But...I will admit I laughed at quite a few of the bits, and the performers did pretty well. Jayma Mays was spot on with her Anna Faris impersonation, and Kal Penn (who seems like he should have grown past these type of movies by now) was able to hold it all together real nicely...as was the rest of the cast. I wouldn't recommend seeing this movie in theaters unless you're extremely bored and need to waste eighty minutes, but I would recommend seeing it when it comes to HBO or Showtime. It's decent for what it's suppose to be, but it's not really worth the price to get in.

If you've seen the trailer to scary movie, you've probably have gotten all the laughs you are going to get, because the trailer is pretty much it. One sees the trailer, and is mislead, thinking that they are going to spoof of those movies, how wrong they are. The "segments" in the trailer is pretty much all that particular spoof is, they last no longer and have no more jokes. The only movie they seemed to make fun of was Narnia, and even that was done somewhat poorly. Not to mention the string between all the movies was weak and made hardly any sense. The budget was also pretty cheap, and was silty reflected in the film. Not to mention the movie seemed to be strung together pretty quickly. And finally, it has too much humorless physical violence, lets face it, no amount of hits in the cock is going to make the movie any better. So if you are planning to see this film, do yourself a favor, save some money, and just see the trailer on the website.My Rating: 4.5/10

I just saw "The Epic Movie", and I thought it was hilarious. It made me laugh the whole time, but I suggest not researching it before you see it, because it ruins the movie. Anyways, yeah to me there was never a dull moment. The movie was very creative and funny. I think they did a good job on the trailers by not giving away all the funny parts. The characters were brilliant and comical. I would have to say I would like to go see it again. It was actually more funny than I thought it would be, because date movie wasn't as funny as I thought it would be. The movie ended up being a movie where you are like, "I want to see that again", but that probably wouldn't be a good idea since movies are only good when you see them once. So go see "The Epic Movie" I'm sure you'll like it.

reviews.review_title: An hour and a half of my life disappears...
reviews.content: This movie was atrocious. After seeing the horrid film that was "Date Movie", I figured it can't get much worse.Epic Movie looked pretty promising, so I had 2 free movie passes and went to see this with a family member, and immediately, I thought "When is this going to end?" There was no continuity, the "jokes" were unfunny, and the acting was horrible.All this movie does is take characters you might know from your average movie, and either make them act completely stupid (in an unfunny way), or places them into a cheesy hip-hop scene.Skip on this movie, its like a black hole that sucks in both your life, and your money.

I went to see this movie for Crispen Glover, Kal Penn, and Kevin Mcdonald. Besides a few minor chuckles from each of these characters the movie was just plain awful. I had seen the previews before and could tell that many of the jokes were stale or just plain stupid. Also a lot of the movies that were being parodied just didn't seem to deserve it. However I did hold my hopes high as I went in to purchase a ticket, I am glad I have seen it now so that the feeling of kind of wanting to see it does not bother me but I do wish I had my 7 dollars back.On a scale from Holocaust to 1, I would definitely give this a 1/2.
I saw this in theatres and a kid in the row in front of me got and started air thrusting to the beat of the pirate rap.

I am a huge fan of Jason because of the great spoofs he makes. But this movies was just not him....to be honest this movie never even made me smile. In Fact it was hard watching the movie. One of the reasons could be watching a lot of his movies and now all of this seems predictable and the comedy in his movies is not new to us anymore. I guess he should try his hands in something else rather then making spoofs.He can surely surely do better then this and come up with movies which can really make us smile and not movies like this which are easily forgettable. These last two movies i.e the Date movie and the Epic movie don't show what kind of capability he has as a director. Any ways I will be awaiting scary movies 5 and although I know it will be another spoof of some big blockbusters I will try and forget the Epic movie and watch scary movies expecting a good comeback by Jason.

You know what? people deserve a good laugh. Like this movie. This movie had the same GREAT actors as date Movie, Adam Campbell, of course. And the same Hilarious big breast jokes. Some people have different senses of humor alright? And i know if YOu don't like it then god forbid any one else enjoy the movie.This movie was just great. A nice break from all these serious crap-fest movies we have now. Some people love to see these big hits go down in flames. I for one loved having Capt. Jack as a stupid drunkard, like in POTC.This movie made me laugh till I cried, and By God if they make a sequel i'll go and see it.

Just as Date Movie, Scary Movie, these shows are good usually one time only. They're good for a few laughs, especially if you are wanting to see other movies made fun of. But overall save your money and rent it later, or get it from someone who was foolish enough to buy it. A lot more could have been done to make this a solid movie, but as in all parody type movies, what do you expect? There are basically 4 kids, well, college age anyway, who have crappy lives and all their misfortunes lead them finding the tickets to Willy Wonka's factory where they stumble into even more mischief. Eventually they find the wardrobe in the room and enter the wild world of Gnarnia (the g is silent, spelled so for legal reasons) where most of the movie takes place. Movies parodied include Nacho Libre, Xmen, Superman, Chronicles of Narnia, Pirates of the Caribbean, DaVinci Code, and a few more.. you lose track after a while.. The credits at the end are long because a couple times they break into song and dance yet again.. so beware if you are one of those people who flee out the door as soon as the credits roll, you might miss a chance to see more goofy stuff.I'd give it a lower rating for the cheesy acting and storyline, but I digress a little because I appreciate a good sarcastic apathetic make fun of comedy. If you are someone who hates series like Naked Gun, Scary Movie, Hot Shots, etc.. Then you are probably more inclined to hate this movie.

It's a shame that critics today find it beneath them to laugh at anything considered anything less than "sophisticated humor". Epic Movie is yet another victim of this trend.Granted, there's very little sophistication here. Some of the jokes are predictable, and continuity is (intentionally) the worst you'll see. That doesn't change the fact that Epic movie is an extremely funny film. It IS funny when medieval knights, Umpa Lumpas, pirates, and dwarfs dance.The laughs are cheap, but they're plentiful, and the pop culture references will one day date this movie, but really demonstrate a well-written script. See this with a group of friends, and I guarantee that you'll hear them quote lines from this movie for at least a week. If that's not proof that this is a successful parody, I don't know what is.

An Epic Movie. Sounds like it has potential of making your Friday night off a successful one.I went to go watch this movie with the guys and at first I knew that this movie would come up with lame jokes but I was mistaken. At the beginning of the movie you are introduced to the characters which their fortune of being unfortunate accidents led them to one another. The gags they pulled are all 'Oh, yeah I get it' response. One of my friends laughed out of the rest of 4. This movie later gets funnier with the fighting of stunt doubles.I give this movie a 4/10 because it really lacks that HAHA comedy. If you enjoy parodies this movie only revolves around 1 parody. Naria. So, if you are into the Nacho Libre jokes, than this should be a blast!

I did not have high expectations when looking at this movie, but I was in a mood for a under-the-belt comedy this evening and even though some parts was uncalled for (too much puking, and snot and bodily liquids) I found this movie kinda funny, me and my friend laughed out loud a couple of times. This is a movie primarily for guys, maybe to look at if you are having an all guys evening with lots of beer and stuff like that. I think that this movie had a script that "almost" held together, much better than the Scary movie series which I did not like at all.You must compare this movie with other "under-the-belt" movies, and I thought it was well at the average point, so... 6/10

reviews.review_title: This movie did have it's moments, but not enough to change my mind about it.
reviews.content: Yesterday, me and some of my friends went to the theater to see Epic Movie, of course I knew the movie was going to suck, but you know if It did suck then at least I could proudly say that I saw it before stating my opinion.Here's my review:The beginning of the movie started out great, David Carridine dancing was hilarious and I laughed a bunch when that albino black guy dived into the vending machine, and you got to admit "So lame the hair of Tom" was great!But then it started going downhill from there, the movie's main spoof centered on "The Chronicles of Narnia", even though it was funny, it was a little bit overused and I was extremely disappointed in the lack of everything else.There was only 1 Borat spoof and that was at the ending credits.The Pirates of the Caribbean spoof was not even close to being funny even though that the actor did a great job of looking like Jack Sparrow.I wished that the Harry Potter spoof lasted longer then it did because it had serious potential.The Willy Wonka spoof was not even close to being funny, but just plain DISTURBING, How in the name of God did they convince Crispin Glover to star in this movie?The Nacho Libre spoof was short, but once again I was impressed by the Jack Black look-alike.The X-men spoof only lasted for 3-4 minutes of the movie, but it was one of my least favorite spoofs, which was also a good thing, and the only thing I liked was seeing Carmen Electra was Mystique (WARNING: Later in the movie she starts to look disturbing in one scene).I was disappointed by the Snakes on a Plane spoof, I really wanted it to be the best spoof, but it was extremely disappointing, because all the Samuel L. Jackson look-alike said was "I'm sick of these god-damn snakes on this god-damn plane" and he said that about 4 times before the spoof thankfully ended.There was also small spoofs of Superman Returns, Tallageda Knights, James Bond, Star Wars, Click etc. But those lasted either a minute of a few seconds. Also they do make fun of Kanye West, Ashton Kutcher, P. Diddy and Mission Impossible.They made of Harold and Kumar: Go to White Castle a lot in this movie, which was really funny because of Kal Penn even allowing them to do so.The movie does have a lot of swear words, a couple s***'s and one f-bomb and a bunch more but that was about it.This movie did have some moments, but unfortunately, not enough to prove me wrong.I give this movie 4 stars/10 stars.

reviews.review_title: did not know there could be a worse movie
reviews.content: This movie was the worst thing i ever have seen with my two eyes i could not believe. we were renting a movie between head of state which is a great movie or epic. my brother said he really wanted to see it so we rented it 20 minutes through the movie i was outside jumping on my trampoline i couldn't sit through it anymore i never new a piece of cinema would ever be so bad. this movie was horrible the jokes aren't funny if you could have given me props and a set i could have easily made a more interesting and better movie than this it was horrendous it sucked i never want to hear about this movie it is embarrassing directer Aaron seltzer should be embarrised for epic movie and date movie

This movie was the biggest piece of crap I have ever seen. First off every joke in the movie was absolutely terrible and whenever the writers couldn't think of a joke they had some random person getting hurt put in. (the ditty scene). I make videos on you tube (greatestband) and I can think of better jokes for this then they could. Plus one of the worst things about it was people getting hurt over and over again. It is only funny in a movie if a person falls on a bike jump (for real) or a skateboard movie. But getting a fake beer bottle thrown at your head and falling over doesn't make people laugh. It makes people cringe and want to barf all over this piece of crap. If there was a rating lower than 1 that is what i would rate Epic Movie.

I Must Say...This is THE WORST FUNNY MOVIE EVER! I cant believe some people who actually liked this movie. I've just seen someone say "Its the best thing in my life"...seriously WHAT THE HELL?! Its the most unhumoured, ridiculous and frustrating movie ever. I must admit though, if you are with some friends and watch this movie...you do laugh at its stupidity. It makes me wonder what the hell was going through the producers' head.Everyone told me not to see this film, but obviously the anticipation was killing me so i HAD to see it. What..a..waste..of..my..time! no storyline, rubbish actors, no laughs and definitely not worth it! The End

This was an awful movie the writers tried way to hard to make this and need to go back to the days of their first scary movies. I usually like comedies even the scary movie comedies but this was too much if I could do something else other than bitch about how awful it is, that would be to not see it, do not waste your money on this movie. Even though the move contained great casts whom I have enjoyed in movies from American Pie, Harold and Kumar, Date movie, etc. There was really no plot to this trash but just an ongoing plot to make fun of other movies in a way that was just not to taste even for a comedy buff like me. Not once did I laugh throughout this whole movie. Either the movies that they tried to burn were too hard to burn or they just did not put enough effort into it either way this movie was just not up to par. Just trust me wait until it comes out on youtube and see some clips or get it at the corner for 5 bucks but please just do not waste your money on this sad mistake of a movie.

I think this is the worst movie I have seen in my life, and probably the worst I will ever see. I just wanted it to end since the very moment it had begun. The plot itself is more that just ridiculous, it makes Scary Movie look like an Oscar-nomination-worth movie. There goes an hour and a half of my life I will never get back. If you were thinking about watching this movie, be smart, and stay away from it. The script, plot, acting and everything is very very wrong with this movie. It's a disaster of Epic proportions, that shows how low the new cinema quality can be and how every piece of junk is getting a chance on the big screen.

"Epic Movie" is epicly bad! It may have been number one at the box office, but it's clearly due to the amount of hopefuls, much like myself, who were praying for a wonderful comedy. The film was written by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer who were responsible for the "Scary Movie" motion pictures. That should have been my first clue. The film, in my opinion was a pathetic attempt to recreate a series of films, which are already terrible enough. The ironic part about the entire thing is that spoofing, in the heart of "Saturday Night Live," is one of my favorite mediums. Friedberg and Seltzer have no idea how to do this properly. They took what was advertised as a hilarious spoof on a large collection of movies and wasted that potential within the first half hour or less of the film. The remainder of the movie was only a spoof on the film "The Chronicles of Narnia," which lacked imagination and talent. One of the lead characters, "Lucy" played by Jayma Mays, was a clear rip off of on the Cindy Campbell character in the "Scary Movie" series, which was played by actress Anna Faris. I can only guess that Faris turned down the role in "Epic." The only redeeming quality in this movie, for me, was the ever hilarious Darrell Hammond as "Captain Jack Swallows" and Fred Willard as "Aslo the Lion" from the land of Narnia. Both of which were severely and unfortunately minimal roles. The film over all is absolutely terrible, with an equally terrible script, horrendous acting, and is an epicly huge waste of time and money.

This movie is VERY, VERY, VERY horrible. I went to the movie after I watched the trailer. The TRAILER is funnier than the MOVIE because the trailer has almost every funny scene in it. From watching the trailer, you can predict what scenes are coming up in the movie. The movie was too cliché, and what you thought would be funny (e.g. Gnarnia) was NOT funny. I can't believe I had the will power to sit through two hours and watch the most horrible comedy in the world. This movie is a disgrace to all spoofs! People were leaving at the middle of the movie, and they weren't even paying attention to it. The theatre was FULL of people, who, by the end of the movie were gabbing on their cellphones and chatting with their friends. The beginning had a few laughs, and there were minor laughs through out the movie but I forgot to laugh. It was that funny.

reviews.review_title: Don't even take the time to consider watching this...
reviews.content: By far the worst movie I've ever seen. I get it... its not meant to be an Oscar winner, but this goes beyond terrible. We get it, you can make fun of a lot of different movies in an hour and a half, but enough is enough. The first two scary movies weren't terrible(not my favorites) yet they still spoofed plenty of movies, the difference is they had a plot, and many of the spoofs were more subtle. I don't normally criticize movies because everyone has different taste, but I feel like it is my duty to society to warn you about this one. If I can convince just one person to not see this movie then it will have been worth it. I now have to live with the shame of watching this movie, something that nobody can take away.Here is a quote from IMDb's FAQs list "There are many(spoofs), but the main plot revolves around "The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe", "X-Men", "The Da Vinci Code", "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory", "Snakes on a Plane", "Nacho Libre" and "Pirates of the Caribbean"." THE MAIN PLOT REVOLVES AROUND 7 COMPLETELY DIFFERENT MOVIES!!! In other words, there is no plot. That mixed with no humor makes a terrible combination. They jumped so quickly from idea to idea that i had no idea how the purple pirate midgets got onto the Death Star made out of swiss cheese(never actually happen, but you get the point.)It wasn't even silly to the point of being good, I spent the entire movie wondering how many movies they could possibly fit into a scene. Most porn has a better plot than this piece of garbage.You might as well watch Mad TV....if the writers were replaced by ADD five year old children picking plots out of a hat....and any possibly talented actor was replaced by a brain-dead chimp. There was too much time spent trying to tie everything together and throw in more references to make an actual joke. It was a terrible film.Its a shame this movie set out to be a spoof. I think that if Friedberg and Seltzer were trying to produce a real movie we could all laugh at how bad it was instead of having the movie shove itself in your face like a obnoxious drunk.

I mean... ITS NOT FUN AT ALL. The cast its kinda good (Crispin Glover from Back to the Future, Kal Penn from House M.D.) but this movie cannot be called EPIC MOVIE, it must be called EPIC FAILURE.The script is awful, no good jokes, and if you laughed on the trailer, you wont in the movie, in fact you will be thinking "Hey, how the heck did i laughed from that in the trailer?".All is so repetitive and NOTHING and i mean NOTHING make sense.Its a movie that doesn't deserves for being watched, you wont see any funny at all, its a waste of time.If you want to see something funny maybe you can see The Naked Gun or Airplane!, those are classics. If you like cult movies maybe you can try watching The Big Lebowski, thats a really great choice, but NEVER and i mean NEVER try to see this piece of junk.

reviews.review_title: Not as good as Scary Movie but worth seeing
reviews.content: After seeing the trailer for epic movie i really looked forward to seeing it. I have just returned from the cinema & was very disappointed. The humour is hit & miss. with a 50/50 ratio. Some of the jokes just try to hard & fail miserably. On the other hand some bits made me laugh out loud. Yet their are far to many hip hop references. So funny Parody's Borat, some Narnia, Davin chi code, Superman, Willy Wonker (kinda) Yet the others (such as Pirates of the carabbean & MTV cribs) are really kinda lame. This is a awful shame as it had so much & so many opportunities to be hilarious. It is a funny film & is worth seeing but it just had so much potential Worth seeing but cant Compare to its scary movie cousins. 6/10

Cannot express how much I wish I had back the hour in which I sat in the theater watching this, not to mention the cost of the ticket. The most poorly created movie I have ever seen, and only movie I've ever walked out of without finishing.

reviews.review_title: Not Exaggerating - One of the worst movie's I've ever seen.
reviews.content: I have never posted comments on websites about movies. I just saw the movie, came back, and registered on IMDb to post about it. That's how bad this movie was. I'm a fair person and gave the movie a fair chance instead of walking out like I should have. The movie spoofs were drawn out way too far, most of the jokes weren't funny and half of them were irrelevant. Also, I saw the boom mic a total of 5 times throughout the movie; you'd think if it was meant to be seen, they would've drawn attention to it. Don't get me wrong, I chuckled maybe a grand total of 3 times, but that was being generous. Plenty of the people in the theater were laughing, but they were all children. If you're wondering whether or not to see this movie, wait a few months and pick it up out of the $1.99 DVD bin at Walmart. Overall, it was an 86 minute lesson on how not to make a funny movie.

I took my girlfriend to the movie theater thinking this was going to definitely be one of the funniest movies i've ever seen... pure garbage. There was nothing funny about it. And all the jokes were kinda old. Like the whole captain swallow thing... straight off of Carlos Mancia! loll This movie is lame yo! Don't waste your money -- I took my girlfriend to the movie theater thinking this was going to definitely be one of the funniest movies i've ever seen... pure garbage. There was nothing funny about it. And all the jokes were kinda old. Like the whole captain swallow thing... straight off of Carlos Mancia! loll This movie is lame yo! Don't waste your money

"What a lovely piece of crap." First time ever that I saw a comedy at the theatre and no one laughed, although I liked some of the sketches that criticise the American culture this movie is not funny, don't waste your money. It's time do change the "scary movie" formula, it's getting annoying and repetitive, using always the same jokes and when these don't work,try farting or disgusting the audience for a few laughs. I only saw 40 minutes of the movie so if it get's funny at end i don't know but i doubt it, saved the other 46 minutes of my life=) I only have the trouble of posting a comment when I either really love or hate a movie, and this one I hate.

I really love comedies. LOVE them. Especially parodies. The first three Scary Movies were great, Not Another Teen Movie cracked me up, I even liked Date Movie except for a couple parts. But THIS movie was just sophomoric and juvenile...even for the writers of the previously mentioned movies. The script is comparable to someone taking a crap on a piece of paper, and saying, "Oh, LOOK, it's a movie!" The acting was mediocre, the story line made NO sense whatsoever. There were only two good things about the movie: The scenes with the Borat look-alike, and the guy who played Captain Jack Swallows. He was at least funny enough to get a laugh out of me...something the rest of the movie failed to do. Thus the two star rating rather than one.The part in which Harry Potter was parodied was especially terrible. Definitely NOT funny, it was simply disrespectful, pathetic, and stupid. If they're going to parody a movie in which the actors play characters who are much younger than them, Harry Potter is NOT it.I'm just glad we only borrowed this movie from a friend, and it only cost us a little bit of time to watch. If I had spent actual money on this, I would have been absolutely LIVID. This movie was an absolute waste of time. If this is the best that "two of the six" writers of Scary Movie can come up with, maybe they should take a VERY long break or just give up altogether.

Epic Movie is hardly that, save perhaps proof that there is no truth in advertising.Istead of being a true parody of Hollywood blockbusters, this movie simply uses parody as a pretext for the same, tired sequence of fart, sex and gender jokes that were barely funny when they were original while the soundtrack of third-rate hip-hop music is completely out of place. Perhaps the only bright spot would be Jayma Mays as the dim-witted, but cute Susan. While only a pale imitation of Anna Faris, she does make the best of a badly-written cliché of a role, (in stark contrast to her appallingly brief appearance in "Heroes" as the charming, but doomed waitress Charlie.) Hopefully, her nascent career will survive this dud and will become the one embarrassing role that haunts nearly every successful career. For the present, save your money and wait for this flick to appear on Netflicks. Even then it will probably not be worth the price.

I have just come out of Epic Movie. Simply put, its the worst movie I have ever seen. I have heard of people walking out of this movie, and saw it myself tonight. 12 people started in a Cinemaxx theatre, only 6 remained at the end. It was the worst, unfunniest, lamest and rehashed jokes of the last 6 months basically. This script was obviously written in an afternoon and the director should publicly be flogged and be forced to watch this crapola over and over again until his head explodes.108 mins. Seriously, we are seriously being rorted as the public. From now on, I wont be seeing any films made by these clowns, any of the clowns in it, and anything at all to do with the production company.P.S I feel lousy using the word clowns, at least they're freakin funny.Worst Epic Ever
Watch literally anything else don't waste your life on this bag of absolute steaming pile of crap

reviews.review_title: Spoofing Movies is not longer funny
reviews.content: i went to watch this movie with my 10 year old brother as a birthday present and i was shocked.. not only was it bad, stupid, gross, but I was amazed how bad spoofing movies has turned, take for example the scary movies series, those were funny, stupid but in a funny way, also date movie, spoofing romantic-comedy movies, i gave that one a 4 out of 10 but this?! This sucked, not even my little brother laughed, in fact at most part he groaned just like I did, we didn't finished watching it because we left before it finished. In conclusion a plain BAD movie with no funny spoofs and bad acting, what's next? I know! HORRIBLE MOVIE a spoof of date movie and epic movie.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely awful...truly the worst movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: In a previous review, I wrote that SuperBabies: Baby Geniuses 2 was the worst movie I had ever seen. Ah, but that was before I saw Epic Movie.For the most part, I like parody films...I love films like Spaceballs, Blazing Saddles, Spy Hard, and Robin Hood: Men in Tights, just to name a few. Yet, those are parodies with some taste and are they are actually funny. On the other hand, Epic Movie is a train wreck.Ah, where to begin...first of all, I thought much of the "humor" was vile and vulgar (or, what was at least supposed to be funny). There are several jokes about going to the bathroom, flatulence, impotence, vomiting, so forth and so on. Good parodies such as Spaceballs and Spy Hard can spoof without resorting to toilet humor...toilet humor is used in Epic Movie, and it is childish, gross, and not funny. In addition, many of the scenes parodied were just jumbled in the middle of the film and made no sense to the plot, such as a parody of Superman, a James Bond spoof, and the parody of Scarface. Many nonsensical jokes fill the plot of the movie. The numerous jokes about rap music are not funny, not even unintentionally.Avoid this film. It is absolutely awful. The only reason I didn't give it zero stars is because one is the minimum.

Epic Movie was not thought out that well, they really could have done better than that. They really did drag on too long with jokes and things, that ruined it. I liked the Scary Movie movies, those were funny, the jokes did not drag on, and there were ALL 6 writers making it. I feel kind of ripped off by seeing this movie, it was just terrible. A word to the directors, please get together with the rest of the guys from Scary Movie and make something that is worth being called EPIC. It might be more worth it to spend your money on Norbit. Hopefully people will read this and the last comment, take our advice, don't waste $10 to go see this movie

reviews.review_title: Epic Movie sucks to some people rocks to others
reviews.content: there are a lot of people who hate this movie and a lot of people who love it. The low rating is from a lot of movie goers that like serious movie but they're are a lot of people who gave it tens. This movie is not an epic movie this is a spoof of epic movies. Its pretty much made in the same style of date movie and scary movie. Im giving epic movie a 5 for the mixed reviews. This movie is worth renting. But warning you may not like it but then again you may really like it. The movie is about 4 orphans who go into a crazy adventure including things like crazy singing pirates, superheros, mutants and much more! P.s i myself find it very entertaining

This movie was absolutely hilarious. The night before seeing it, I read some comments on it and most had said it was the stupidest movie. I told my mum this, and she said "I bet you all are going to laugh the entire time." (I was going with a group of friends.) I believe were the only ones laughing in the movie theater. We were laughing so hard, especially during the Willy Wonka part. There were some disturbing parts, *cough-Borat-cough* but most of it was drop dead rolling on the floor hilarious.And, when I just checked, it's #1 on the IMDb home page. And if deserves to be there, too.

reviews.review_title: not what i expected, but it wasn't that bad.
reviews.content: epic movie was not what i expected. seeing the trailers and everything, and even David lehre was in it.. i expected it to be really good. then i went to read the reviews on it on yahoo, and it had some pretty bad rating.. yet, i still thought, it's okay, i think they're judging a lot. so i watched the movie anyway.. now, i'm not saying it was a terribly bad movie.. it was pretty funny. but it needed more work into it. like the stunts for "aslo." you could pretty much be able to see that he turns to an Asian guy from time to time when he's fighting. it wasn't that bad though. i had some laughs. so yeah, it needed more work into it.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie of the year - possibly ever
reviews.content: All I can say after watching this movie is "How did this script EVER get green-lighted?" It goes without saying that the latest "Movie" movie is by far the worst to date. Not only that, I believe this movie is certainly in the running for worst comedy of the year. The "Movie" movie franchise should have died with the original "Scary Movie", though I did get a small amount of enjoyment from it's subsequent sequels."Epic Movie" is a spoof comedy that revolves around several popular movie franchises that I suppose could be called epic - though the term is sometimes a stretch. Films such as "Nacho Libre", "Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory", "The Chronicles of Narnia", "The Lord of the Rings", and YES, even "Snakes on a Plane" make an appearance here. The movie is fueled by terrible writing, and is riddled with awful comedy. On top of everything else, the film is only 75-ish minutes long, which typically wouldn't be bad except for the 20 minute breakout in the middle of the movie where the faun of "Gnarnia" (Narnia) shows us his house a la MTV's "Cribs".The crude fart humor that this movie consistently pumps out at you is enough to make you want to choke. Essentially, that is all this movie is, as there is no solid plot line to speak of other than 15 minute forays the characters in the movie have with one epic movie to the next. Think of it as the story of four orphans who are kidnapped by Willy Wonka and escape his "evil clutches" by going through a magical wardrobe. I am totally serious.This movie should rightfully be getting a rating of 0/10, but for the sake of making SOMETHING about this movie funny, I have decided that it deserves 0.002/10. IMDb is requiring I give it at least a "1", which in my opinion is too high. Honestly it's that terrible. For those of you who are 12 or younger, or just in general enjoy fart jokes and bad movie references, there might be something here to see. Otherwise, steer clear!

reviews.review_title: Shame I cannot vote it as MINUS 10. Waste of time !!!
reviews.content: I went to see something funny, but during whole movie (half movie, cause I left after some time) I don't even laughed once. Same as other people in cinema. Complete waste of time.I went to see something funny, but during whole movie (half movie, cause I left after some time) I don't even laughed once. Same as other people in cinema. Complete waste of time.I went to see something funny, but during whole movie (half movie, cause I left after some time) I don't even laughed once. Same as other people in cinema. Complete waste of time.I went to see something funny, but during whole movie (half movie, cause I left after some time) I don't even laughed once. Same as other people in cinema. Complete waste of time.

An opinion piece on a movie is just that, an opinion of one person. But I would implore all of you to take this opinion to heart.Do not go see Epic Movie. I just wasted like 9 bucks on a ticket to see a really lame movie. I am serious, Epic Movie is a really bad movie.The cinematography is fine. The acting is fine. The editing is fine. The costumes are good. The scenery and props are great. For all intents and purposes, Epic Movie is made perfectly. HOWEVER, it is the jokes or rather the lack of them that makes Epic Movie really bad.The film is a spoof of other films, which in and of itself is not a bad thing. But what makes it a bad thing is the fact that of the jokes, I'd say about 85%-90% of the jokes (jokes being the things that are supposed to make you laugh) are just slapstick. I'm not exaggerating here. There is no "intellectual" humor at all, in other words, there are no jokes that require any amount of thought. Just slapstick and spoof is all you'll see.Please do not go see Epic Movie. It really is that bad. If you do go and see it, consider yourself warned.

reviews.review_title: There should be a law against bad parodies like this one.
reviews.content: Airplane was great. Scary Movie was good. This movie is bad, bad, bad. This movie had to be, hands down, the worst movie I have seen in the last 10 years. This is not a movie to be seeing. This is not a movie to be renting. This is a movie to be avoiding.Parody films work best when they actually poke fun at their targets.
