reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone says...
reviews.content: I saw this movie this past weekend and it is not as bad as everyone says. The thing is, you can't go into this movie and expect some great Epic movie (pun intended :D). But go in wanting a laugh with some friends, and you will have a good time and watch a descent movie. Yes, this movie is short. It is around 1 hour and 10 minutes, but that is OK with me.Part of the reason I like this movie along with my friends is finding all the little things that they make fun of. Like their little hint toward White Castle and the guy who plays Edward being in it. It is funny.So if you like to have fun and don't care if you see a movie that will never be up for a reward, go see this with some friends.

reviews.review_title: An epileptic baboon on downers could have written a better script . . .
reviews.content: . . . and when I said this to the manager at Showcase last night, he gave my friend and I free passes to come back and see something - ANYTHING - else.We've got the guy above beat -- it only took us 30 minutes, and it was the first time either of us had, in our lives, walked out of a theater. Yeah. And I sat through "Phenomenon" AND "Face/Off" during Hollywood's mid-90s Travolta delusion.How far has Crispin Glover fallen? First "Willard," now this. We're a far cry from "Hay you, get your damn hands off her, aren't we? Hollywood wonders why no one is going to the show anymore -- I spent $9 on my ticket and 20 bucks on 2 large popcorn tubs and 2 large sodas, which, of course, neither of us finished. So guess what I won't be buying, Showcase, when I use my free ticket to come see Spiderman 3? I can't imagine how this movie was green-lighted -- somebody must have compromising pictures of Kumar at White Castle.I give this a one only because I can't score it in lowercase, negative Roman numerals.

reviews.review_title: Oh dear - such a let down!
reviews.content: When my girlfriend suggested the idea of going to see Music And Lyrics for valentines day, i immediately discarded the thought and suggested the "bound to be hilarious" Epic Movie. Big mistake. The only way i found to sum it up was "it was like a really bad kid's film that contained places that made me smile"...a very pained smile.WARNING TO ALL THOSE WITH A SENSE OF HUMOUR - Apparently randomly kicking a beaver is funny! This "spoof" was nothing like the legendary Naked Gun and Airplane that contained some style and thought behind the jokes, it was just quite literally a nonsense film involving a lot of strange physical humour. Two from Scary Movie? Clearly the Tea-boy and The Tea-boy's Assistant.I do not recommend this film! PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY, SPARE YOUR BLUSHES AND FOLLOW YOUR PARTNER'S WISHES!

reviews.review_title: WOrst Movie I've ever seen, and thats no exaggeration
reviews.content: There have been many movies like Epic Movie. Some have been just funny enough to actually say it was worth watching. Some were so bad they were good. This movie is neither of those. I can bluntly say its not at all funny, has virtually no plot, and is extremely disturbing. It is awful. and i say that with all sincerity. I really have nothing against the actors, I can't say it was their fault. I amazed at the person who came up with this. IN any case, don't make the same mistake i did by watching this movie. I say in shame that i ever spent $8.00 on it. As far as I'm concerned i never saw it.Epic Movie, what are you talking about? I've never even heard of that.

Forget what everyone else says, this movie was great. I laughed every 10 seconds and it was like watching Scary Movie 5, except without scary movie parodies. The parodies are creative and hilarious, and this movie deserves a 10, if you haven't seen it, see it. Give it a chance, I thought it was a great movie and you should defiantly see it!!!! Excellent use of "Fergielicious" in the movie as well. Great jokes along the way, and I can't watch Chronicles of Narnia without cracking up. I went into this movie as a last second thing to do on a Friday night, and I thought it would suck. But I was pleasantly surprised. I'll be using Epic Movie terms for a long time now. Long live Jack Swallows!!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.content: I loved this movie!!!!!!!!!!!! Sure everyone says "Holy cow it sucked, never see this " but I loved it. All of the crude jokes were hilarious and every part of it was funny. I rented it for my birthday party and all of my friends LOVED IT as well so I'm not alone. One of my favorite parts is the harry potter scene because it's so funny when Peter kills McGonagal, Dumbledore and Hagrid! Also when Mystique is changing herself for Peter and he says "Mono-brow, Mono-brow kingy wants a mono-brow" It's so funny!!! Sure you might say "this person is completely insane and wacked to think it was funny. But I did so ha! Also all of the people I've asked said they loved it too. So ha again!

I want my 90 minutes of life back, seriously, this has to be the WORST movie I have ever seen in my entire life. I want to know who actually enjoyed this movie?I can't think of a single memorable line from the movie, or at any point when the audience was laughing. The 12 year old kids sitting behind me even commented how stupid and lame the movie/jokes were...if you don't appeal to a 12-year old kid, your movie will suffer.This movie was worse than "Dungeons and Dragons" "Master of Disguise" and "Manos: The Hands of Fate" combined.Save your money, go read a book, or better read, read this comment and don't spend the money.

When I saw the trailer for this movie, I knew it was going to be worth watching, and it was! There was a point in the movie where everyone in the cinema was laughing so hard that you couldn't hear what actors in the movie were saying. Everyone I talked to who has seen it, loved it.However, it surprised me that apparently pretty much everyone from America and other various parts of the third world seems to hate this movie. Maybe it's dependent on which particular culture you live in; here in Europe this sort of all-out, infantile, retarded humor (and I say that as someone who enjoyed the movie) is not very common place in the media, so we are not very used to it, which is probably what made the movie more successful here.

I really don't know why this film has received such a low rating seeing as how it's Oscar worthy. The story starts out like this. Blondie (The Good) is a professional gunslinger who is out trying to earn a few dollars. Angel Eyes (The Bad) is a hit man who always commits to a task and sees it through, as long as he is payed to do so. And Tuco (The Ugly) is a wanted outlaw trying to take care of his own hide. Tuco and Blondie share a partnership together making money off Tuco's bounty, but when Blondie unties the partnership, Tuco tries to hunt down Blondie. When Blondie and Tuco comes across a horse carriage loaded with dead bodies, they soon learn from the only survivor (Bill Carson) that he and a few other men have buried a stash of gold in a cemetery. Unfortunately Carson dies and Tuco only finds out the name of the cemetery, while Blondie finds out the name on the grave. Now the two must keep each other alive in order to find the gold. Angel Eyes (who had been looking for Bill Carson) discovers that Tuco and Blondie meet with Carson and knows they know the location of the gold. All he needs is for the two to lead him to it. Now The Good, The Bad and The Ugly must all battle it out to get their hands on $200,000 worth of gold. So if this whole plot and story is not good enough for you IMDb critics out there, I don't think anything is.Great movie in every aspect.1/10

reviews.review_title: In theory, it could have been brilliant
reviews.content: The trailer for this movie deceived me; I actually thought it was going to be really very funny. In theory, the idea of mashing up all these movies in one 'Epic Movie' was rather fabulous. I know that's pretty much what spoofs are all about, but some of the movies that they chose to put in 'Epic Movie' could have made something really very special and absolutely brilliant. But, sadly, that's really not the case; it's just not funny. I laughed out loud in the cinema once and then immediately felt bad because I was the only person doing it. With the exception of two 12 year old boys in the row in front; I envy them the fact that they found it hilarious.All this said, I got home and when I thought about all the separate little jokes and spoofs, I really did have a good laugh. I think that the 'setpieces', I suppose you could call them, were actually really funny out on their own - I laughed for about half an hour about Sudoku in the snow when I got home - but putting them together weakened them. It just didn't work.Although, I have to give kudos to Darrell Hammond for his 'Captain Jack Swallows' (how obvious was that joke going to be?). He provided my one laugh in the cinema and also did a pretty good impersonation of Jack Sparrow.Is this movie a sign that the spoof genre needs a rest? I certainly think so.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst films of our time.
reviews.content: I don't even know where to begin on how putridly unfunny, terribly written, and how shoddily made this film is. First of all, as you probably guessed, the plot makes no sense at all. Fine. I can live with that. But when the jokes are not funny at all, you have nothing to fall back on. Here are some examples of the "humor" in this movie: During the Nacho Libre spoof, Kal Penn doesn't want to eat his food, so Nacho yells NACHOOOOOOOOOOOOOO cheese Doritos are delicious! WTF? Was this movie written by an eight year old? Here's another: During the Narnia spoof, the goat man accidentally hurts someone, and says "My baa-a-a-a-d." Hmmmmm. Another thing, when you make spoof movies, it is okay to have characters get injured and then magically recover. BUT.... not when their HEAD IS KICKED OFF AND SHIPPED TO A CANDY COMPANY! I mean really, her head reappeared two seconds later! AND ANOTHER THING! WHY THE F#$@# WOULD YOU SPOOF CRIBS AND PUNK'D???? Those shows are so old, and have been spoofed countless times over the past few years. You know, there are people out there spending $10-15 to see this disgraceful tripe, and the very fact infuriates me. I have totally lost respect for everyone involved in this film. Why Fred Willard? WHY? I mean, I could honestly say that Date Movie was funnier than this. DATE MOVIE. I could sit here and keep typing about how upset I am about this cinematic abomination, but if I continue I will type until my fingers fall off. Going cold turkey........now.

The movie in a whole was awful but what made me give it a three was the harry potter part that made the movie. Wait till it is on TV then watch the potter part other than that do not wast your money. I like the make fun of movies movie but this was bad not even funny! Sadly because they appear funny i and other people go see them so they get money so there will be another.Do not go.Not funny. Hardley a chuckle throughout the rest of the movie.Dum.Stupid.Horrible.Just some words to describe this movie.All in all i am surprised this movie even made it to theaters.My advice go sleep through the movie until the harry potter clip wake up watch it chuckle and go back to sleep.

The trailers of this movie were the only funny parts of this movie. i was very disappointed sitting through this movie. About a third through this movie i wanted to get up, walk out the theater and smoke a cigarette. i understand that spoofs are child-like versions of some of the top movies in the past year or two. epic movie went beyond that and included some parodies that normal teens,who would go see this, would not understand. i experienced this first hand when i was the only person laughing at numerous parts of this movie. i do not suggest seeing this movie if you are of sound mind. there are quite a few dead parts in the movie, i thought at least, where i was just sitting in my seat wondering where is this going and why is it not funny. epic movie will not go in my collection of movies. way to start off 2007 with a bomb.

reviews.review_title: Not half as bad as people make it
reviews.content: First and foremost this movie is a spoof not meant to be taken seriously because the movies on which it is based does that already.The reason I loved this movie is because of its pure stupidity I lost count of the amount of times I laughed at that Such as the fight between the lion and the albino from Da Vinci code The Training sequence at Hogwarts(Ill never look at Hermione the same way again)This movie has revived the spoof movie franchises because I felt they lost something especially with Date MovieBut of course you have to come into the movie expecting stupidity otherwise the jokes will just pass over your head.

I cant believe people are going into this movie with hopes of a seeing something like Saving Private Ryan. The movie industry has been bland lately so why not make a movie that gets some laughs. This movie isn't meant to be serious so why get so bent out of shape with the votes? I am anxious to see this movie regardless how many bad reviews it gets. Ya cant really base a movie on bad reviews anymore since most of the voters haven't even seen the movie. I enjoy the Scary Movie films and Epic Movie type films. I also have a college degree OMG Im so dumb now!!! Sometimes we need to just see something pointless and funny at the same time. Do you have to have a certain grade point average to enjoy these type of movies?

My friend and I scheduled to watch a movie, but since we came into the movie theater late, we decided to go along and watch Epic Movie, just because it was to a closer time in our schedule. I thought it would be funny, since I saw the preview before and it looked good. HOWEVER, I was very much disappointed, because this movie was not funny-- AT ALL. It was so horrible, that me and my friend just got up and left the theater in the middle of it. We couldn't stand another minute of it and it was such a waste of our money.No originality on the humor whatsoever. All they did was take beautiful classical works, humiliate it and make fun of it, and I didn't even laugh at all (except maybe at the scene with the Paris Hilton thing-- I guess that was sort of funny.) But be warned everyone-- DO NOT waste your time, energy and money on this movie. It was a complete disaster.

This movie is a strong contender for the worst movie I have ever seen- and I've seen a lot of bad ones. I actually enjoy bad movies as much as good ones because they are always good for a laugh; this one was sad, for the fact that it actually TRIED to be funny, whereas others are just bad on accident.To the creators of this film and all the other spoof movies that have come before it, STOP. Spare us please. Come up with something original. The only people who ever made good spoof movies are Mel Brooks and the guys behind the Naked Gun flicks. To the people who are reading this- save your money. It's painfully bad. It's squirm-in-your-chair bad. I rarely want to leave a theater in the middle of the movie, but the thought crossed my mind about every 2 minutes with this one. Oh, and I'm not exaggerating.

Ynko! Attention this is dung! I have looked thousand cinema! But however this is awful and absolutely worthless. Why for good films give the award and for bad do not deprive with the license... Worthless game of actors. The worthless and disgusting script. All a mistake of the nature. Allow to ask - you that have spent on drink the budget? In total last films of the American film studio's smell awfully. In the majority the comedy cinema became trite and insipid. You come round what for feed the audience with dung? Most of all amazes an abundance of cinema with nasty duologue's. Yes duologue's it is the greatest problem of the American films!

reviews.review_title: Warning, Don't See This Horrible Movie
reviews.content: I have not walked out on a movie in over 30 years, today within 30 minutes I walked out of this trash. The only way anyone should see this movie is if they "pay you" and then it will not be worth your time.The movie was nothing but some extremely poor written lines, very bad acting and yes, I know it is supposed to be a comedy and I enjoyed the other movies that joked about horror flicks. But this was just so unbelievably bad I could not take any longer.This movie has been rated PG, but with all the poorly hidden sex ploys and irrelevant topics, it should only be played at the Cannes Festivals as a joke.

This movie should have really went for the "R" rating status just for at least the gross or outrageous factor it could provide. I hate when movies have so much potential but are dumbed down for the rating and core audience they seek. In general this movie follows the settings of Chronicles of Narnia with other scenes from The DaVinci Code, to Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Nacho Libre, X-Men, and with character appearances like Jack Sparrow (Jack Swallows), a team of Storm Troopers, Stiffler's mom (she is called that once) as the "White Bitch, and so on..... You'd think with all of those ideas and areas to make fun of those movies, they would. But, they basically make the characters act stupid and put them in dumb situations, then out of nowhere throw in dance routines to recent rap music. It's just not worth the money you spend for a movie nowadays. Clocking in at only an hour and ten minutes, i'd suggest you to rent a movie, even if you've seen it and spend your time and money that way.

This movie is terrible! My 10 year old son wanted to go see this movie. Why? you may ask? Because this movie is making "fun" of children's movies. He is allowed to watch PG13 movies but not rated R movies. This movie has been inappropriately rated. It should have been RATED R! I was totally shocked at the very, very vulgar language and adult content. If this movie had been rated R, like it should have been, I would not have taken him to see it! I am shocked that these people have targeted the young market and included the garbage that is in this movie! Very poor all around. Not appropriate for PG13 audience. Do not go see this movie!

reviews.review_title: Nacho Libre was the best part of the film!
reviews.content: So, I saw Epic Movie last weekend and while it was no Oscar winner, you have to look at it for what it is. Everyone who is bashing it needs to take a step back and do just that, watch it because it is a no brainer, going for the EASY joke (I use the term "easy" lightly), stupid movie. When a movie doesn't care about continuity...I mean come on, thats funny! Speaking of Funny, the guy who plays Nacho was spot on and in my opinion one of the best things in that movie! You know what they say about opinions...they're like (fill in blank), everyone has one! So, IMDb says I have to fill out 10 lines of text...I don't have that much else to write, but I will do my best. I think the guy who plays Nacho is an actor by the name of Jareb. I've seen him on commercials and Entourage...what a great show! Anyway Epic Movie goers, if your not open minded do not see this movie. But, if you like silly slap stick / dumb acting and comedy then go see it.

reviews.review_title: Someone... somewhere... should go to jail for this.
reviews.content: I got conned into seeing this movie with my friends cause "I never go with them to the movies anymore" and now i remember why.Thank god it was only just over an hour long. Anything more then that and i would've taken a combat knife to the screen. The jokes weren't funny at all, not even in the context of making a stupid spoof of something. It'd be like me taking a glass of milk, dropping a stick of butter in the milk, and holding it up in front of a camera saying "Look buttermilk!" Then charging people to watch me say that. That's about the extent of the jokes in the movie.My friends and I had more fun making our own jokes in the theater about how bad it was... effectively making a better spoof of a movie, then Epic Movie actually did of any movie it tried to spoof. (for any of you readers that are World of Warcraft players, there is plenty of fun to be had in good company) To make a long story short... I'm confident that the only way someone could enjoy this movie is to either be high on drugs, drunk, or just that plain stupid all the time.Awful. Simply Awful.

I went thinking it was going to be funny, but it was not. It was very crude and not at all funny. Please don't waste your money on this one. I gave it a 1 out of 10 and as someone else said, that is only because I couldn't give it a 0. It was awful, very awful. If you must go, don't take your kids. The Willie Wonka about putting human parts in the candy was in very bad taste. They used a sledge hammer on one of their victims to remove his balls and put them in his candy for the added nuts. This is not funny. From beginning to end, the movie never got anywhere. Don't go see it, so they won't make this type of movie anymore. I enjoyed Scary Movie and I thought that this was going to be that type of movie.

This movie is completely terrible. I went to see it thinking about the Scary Movie series and about how funny those where. While I did laugh a few times at this movie I was laughing at how completely horrible it was. If you found Scary Movie and Date Movie to be bad you will probably despise this movie more than the rest of us do. Also a word of advice if you have younger children don't take them to see it because when I went to see it there was a family with younger kids and they ended up leaving in the middle of the movie it was a good thing they did to because it got worse. Don't go to see this movie, because if you do I can almost guarantee that you'll want that 1hr. 30min. of your life back.

reviews.review_title: I want my $6.50 and 45 minutes of my life back!!
reviews.content: Yes, I went to this movie during the discounted afternoon matinée and walked out 45 minutes in. I loved the Scary Movie series and thought I was getting the same when I walked into this movie. Words cannot describe the disaster this movie is. It's just plain boring. As one of the previous commenters summed up, it will leave you wondering "What did I find so funny in the trailer?" There were a couple places where a joke here and there was somewhat funny, but the writers relentlessly turned what would have been a funny 5 second joke into a 10 minute running gag. Half way in, it just became so boring and repetitive I couldn't take it any longer.Kal Penn gave the least crappy performance, or maybe had the least horrible lines, but doesn't appear to play that big a part in the movie. Everyone else involved in this movie should be deeply ashamed.

I was looking forward to viewing this film because of its popularity, and other's recommendation. So, i decided to watch it the next weekend. First off, it started with a good hook, and got me slightly involved. Later on in the movie the humor was so lame and the screen play was horrible that i almost stuck my head in my popcorn bucket and went to sleep. The "humor" is Willy wonkas chocolate factory river is made of poo. how funny! Also Willy wonka dancing to "Fergalicious" with his oompa loom-pas is supposed to make my lips turn into a smile. They should have thrown in a "your mom" joke with that. I almost stood up and demanded my money back. The movie is lame and predictable. I had a total of about 2 laughs. If you want to see a funny movie, watch "Borat", or "Wedding Crashers", these movies are actually funny, and good.Epic movie is a movie to avoid spending $8, and approximately 2 hours of your life on.

After seeing this movie I thought to myself, "Wow I'm really upset, good thing everyone that will ever see this movie is equally upset as I am." Then I go onto IMDb and find out that several "humans?" actually think this is a funny movie. I'm into cheap laughs every once in a while, and that's what I expected when I rented this movie. But there were absolutely no laughs. Not one. Not when laugh in the entiritey of this film. If you are reading this and have not seen this movie, make sure never to see it. I know the only way I'd ever see this movie again involves the chair from Clockwork Orange. Oh, and if you do by the off chance rent it, just fast forward the entire thing and make up your own jokes. That's what I did about half way through, and it was a lot more fun.

Reason for this to maybe contain spoilers: I will list a few of the movies spoofed.First off, DO NOT try watching this movie without at least seeing 3 of these films: Narnia, Borat, The Da Vinci Code, Harry Potter, Nacho Libre, Charlie and the chocolate factory.Also if you are one of the losers who walk out of cinemas, then 'come no further for death awaits you all'.Parts of this movie is hilarious, they really did a good job with The Da Vinci Code and the ending was perfect! Some things however confused me rather than make me laugh, the harry potter scene and the snakes on a plane scene where not funny.I read that some people expected an Oscar winner after reading the title 'Epic Movie'. For heavens sake, it's in the name! It's not trying to show off, it's being SELF-IRONIC!Epic, read: Legendary. Legendary, read: SUPER DUPER GREAT!!!!11.That bit may have been to complex for some brains, but I at least expected a turkey feast when clicking on play. Never let the marketing hype affect you as it can ruin even the greatest of movies.To all the 'experts' out there crying for they're money back after watching this movie: Ask for some sense of humor instead! And also, walk out of the cinema => you are a crybaby. Cry, cry, cry, is that all you ever do?7 of 10, Good laugh, but not an Oscar.If you vote 0 or 1, then what the heck did you vote for "Plan 9 from outer space"? 6? SAVE 0 and 1 for REALLY BAD MOVIES!

reviews.review_title: Hey, if this is your kind of movie...
reviews.content: When I first saw the movie, I'll admit I had a few laughs. Even so, It was nowhere near as good as Scary Movie, and is even below Date Movie. I rented the DVD, and even the special features fail to redeem this title. Such as the option where the entire movie is replayed with farting and belching sounds dubbed over it.While I'm generally into random comedy, I can easily say this is pretty dull, with the exception of a few jokes. Every joke seemed forced, out of place, or completely unnecessary. And rather than making fun of the movies they parody, they simply rewrite bits of them with dumbed down characters.I could have seen this being a very funny movie, had the directors known what they were doing...I've heard that there is a sequel in the works... if this is true, I hope that it is better than this. Probably not, as Hollywood thinks we're stupid, and will throw money at anything with "(GENRE) Movie" in the title... (which is partially true...)

reviews.review_title: Warning: watching this movie may result in permanent brain damage.
reviews.content: Sparkster (Yea the Rocket Knight) here with a few words on this... ANNOYING.. Random collaboration of mass horrors. - For a long time I've been getting random questions, one day one of the questions was "Hey Sparky I wanna make a random movie, but I want it to be best but I don't know where to start how I can make it not be like a steamy pile of poop??" - And my answer is... As much as it PAINS me to say it.. Watch this. - WHY you ask? - Because... It gives you a good clue in on WHAT NOT TO DO when trying to make a random collaboration of events. - OK sure, some of the plot holes where hilarious, I love plot holes, BUT the problem lies in the repetition of them, plot holes are really hard to get right, the timing has to be at least decently good and the plot-hole absolutely ridiculous but different from the previous ones. It looked like they got desperate or something and decided to throw a bunch of random crap in for the sake of throwing it in. - Another problem is the MUSIC!!! Oh gods!!! Downright annoying, way to much rap!! It's not even funny rap it's downright plain old drum-mashing' person-blabbing' on top kind of rap. Of all the annoying music I've heard the ones in this movie takes the cake. If you love rap it's great but if you don't it'll be a torturous crawl. - What REALLY lets this one down is the enormous amount of pop-culture references.. Waaaaay to much!! I betcha if they left out the pop-culture references and filled them in with something else the overall greatness of this movie would skyrocket. - Also, this movie isn't MY idea of a good quality PG-13 movie, AT ALL, there is A lot of suggestive and inappropriate stuff. It should have been rated higher. - The best jokes where the simple slap-stick humor ones, which there wasn't very many of, most of them are pop-culture reference jokes (It's so bad it needs a second complaint round) that you pretty much have to know exactly what their referencing for them to be funny, of course here's another problem, a lot of people, myself included, don't pay attention to pop-culture at all, so are left thinking "Well that was dumb". - It seems to me that this was a decent attempt at random craziness, but it wasn't ironed out NEAR LONG ENOUGH and top of that the base was unstable anyway. - Making random crap like this is like tailoring a rug together from scratch, every thread and string must be picked carefully and strung well, if this movie was a rug it'd look like a totally rushed piece of cloth with strings of all different sizes sticking out everywhere that are in every color and pattern imaginable. - Oh yea, and it'll have a cardboard cut-out of a smiley face glued on to it. - What I'm trying to say is it was rushed, not well thought out and way to stupid!! I usually like stupid movies, but all the stupid ones I like would, on rating of 1 to 10, rate at about 9 or 10, this one breaks the scale by rating at the amazing number of infinite. (So in other words it's *epically* stupid) - Is that 'infinite' even a number? Don't think so but whatever, close enough. - So this WAS inspiring to me, no, not in the way you might be thinking!! - It inspires me to avoid the mistakes made here and this is among ultimate examples of 'lame', so, if you ever wanted to make the world's most awesome random movie, study this sucker (And others like it) to the letter and avoid those 'letters' and chances are, your movie will be great. - Anyhow, after barely managing to survive this torture all I can say is my IQ must have dropped by 99% for at least a couple of days, with at least 5% of the damage being permanent. - It's *that* bad.

reviews.review_title: This film is probably offensive to most film-makers purely because of the sheer lack of effort.
reviews.content: This movie was so bad that I don't know where to start... This is definitely the worst film I've seen at the cinema (because no matter how bad a film is, it won't touch Boa vs. Python). People have defended this film by saying people don't like it because it's too "brave" and that it has the guts to parody popular films. For one, it doesn't take "guts" to do what Epic Movie does; equally shoddy films have been doing it for ages. Also, the word parody should be used very loosely when describing Epic Movie. What the film does is not so much parody as poorly recreating scenes from existing movies, adding either a sexual or unusual edge and then making people dance to Hip Hop if all else fails. It's hard to sum up this film without swearing.It's a load of shite.

I usually finish watching movies no matter how awful they are, but this one was the exception to confirm the rule. I have never seen a movie worse than this one!! I have to say I feel very sorry for those who paid to see this, I was "lucky" to catch it on a movie channel. I thought this movie would be like the Scary Movies, which I thought were hilarious compared to this one. I honestly do not know what the writers were trying to do but I did not laugh not once, and I usually laugh at anything. I'm trying to make the 10 line limit but there is nothing else to say about this movie. Just that I recommend you spend 1 and a half hours of your life doing something more useful.

reviews.review_title: the only thing epic about this movie is how much it SUCKED
reviews.content: In my entire life, of all the movies I've seen, I've never actually said I didn't like any of them, until I saw this pathetic excuse for a movie. I mean, what the hell is it??? Luckily, I didn't buy it, my boyfriend lent it to me for me and my mum & brother to watch, and after being brought up on films like Airplane!, The Monty Python films and Blazing Saddles, this made me lose all faith in comedy...what's happened? Why was this even allowed to be made? We were just sat there watching it expecting much more, and I was very disappointed with the utter rubbish I witnessed. My brother said, after 20 minutes 'I'm gonna go now, I don't like this much' and my mum and I said 'nor me ..it's just not funny at all'. I really just didn't understand what was supposed to be so 'epic' about it...unnecessary rapping and meaningless, unfunny scenes...I just didn't see the point. Repetition IS NOT FUNNY...maybe for anyone under the age of 9, but no. This is a Cert15. There is no structure to it at all, and it's painfully predictable. Spoofs are supposed to be FUNNY, comical parodies of films, for the retarded people who wrote this. And I can't believe it had a budget of $20 millionMonty Python's 'And Now For Something Completely Different' had a budget of £80,000 (about $100,000) and that's one of the funniest films I've ever seen, ad quite frankly, that sickens and infuriates me. Why the hell were they allowed that much to produce what is easily the lowest of all lows where movies are concerned? It's an insult to comedy. I wouldn't recommend this film to ANYONE. Do yourself a favour- for the love of God don't watch this film. You'll be saving yourself from a complete waste of time. So very disappointing... For god's sake...most films that are utter crap tend to be funny because they are crap, but this just takes the biscuit...pity you can't vote minus stars on here, but for the record i give this pathetic excuse for a film minus infinity out of ten. Utter RUBBISH.

Too bad there is no way to rate this zero stars. I rented this hoping for a mindless comedy that I could just watch, laugh at, and not have to think about. I got the last one of those. Really, this was a really bad re-make (not spoof....a re-make) of Narnia. Filled with excessive belches and farts that seemed to be added in post-production, because the studio was desperately trying to make the movie funny. That was my impression. In any case, those sound effects (the first time it got a chuckle, after that they were just annoying) ruined any potential- if there was any- of the script. I kept waiting for the whole movie to just end. It is really so sad that this sort of film can be produced today, and I can't imagine people even saw it in the theaters. I was also really embarrassed for all of the actors in here; seems they were given the script the morning they came onto the set and told to do their part and get out. Just an awful and depressing movie. Very sad.

I saw this movie at a friend's house when his DVD player broke (we rented this "on demand"), and we almost we almost turned this movie off during the Willy Wonka scene. Now I'm regretting that we didn't turn it off. Sure, there are a couple funny parts but I was not old enough to see this! There are so many disgusting sexual scenes I can't even count them! Please, if you do not wish to wash your eyes, do not watch this movie!!!!! The scene with the disturbing Michael Jackson Willy Wonka and the "obese Britanny Spears" almost made me throw up. So again, don't see this movie if you don't want to wash your eyes, don't see this frankly disturbing movie!!!

This film brings nothing new to spoof films all that it shows is that there are no young actors out there who can do comedy. This film shows that veteran comedy actors Jennifer Coolidge and Fred Willard are the only people who bring anything to this film. The films lack of a spoofing genre is ridiculous. The directors have decided they can spoof anything around but all spoof films need a genre other than spoof. The spoof of Punk'd and Cribs is pointless and bring nothing to the film as well as spoofing Lord of the Rings and other films for no reason other than to show characters is just plain lazy film-making. Despite the film's gross-out and stupid humour there are a small amount of bright sparks. The actor playing Jack Swallows plays the spoof so well however he is given no real significant involvement and features on screen for no more than 5 minutes.
After I saw this "movie" I actually died... inside. I want to die. Please.

I enjoyed this movie, although I also liked date movie. You can't take it seriously, but it was good. The jokes were not extremely original, but the whole theater was laughing and it was fun. Every movie does not need to be original. That being said, I have seen better movies, including the pinnacle of this series, Scray Movie 3. It was on about the same level as Scray Movie 4. One thing I loved about this movie is that I had seen many of the movies that they spoofed, which always makes it more fun.My other main complaint is that it ended rather quickly, at not even an hour and a half.

I had already seen the rating that this film has, which I was surprised by, until I watched the film for myself. In my opinion 'Epic movie' isn't funny at all, it's very mildly entertaining, which is a generous statement. The film has no good qualities at all, badly written, stupid plot; no offence to the actors, but the acting was terrible, in their defence this is most likely how the film makers intended them to act, which clearly is an even bigger insult to the film. After I had seen the film I honestly thought 'what a waste of a couple of hours!' For a person who is passionate about films it made me angry, that this film was put on television. Or even that it was made in the first place. Why did they spend so much money on all the costumes, when they didn't bother to put the effort into the script? The film is entirely pointless and annoying. Overall I thought the film was pathetic and unoriginal.

First thing, my review has no rating. This is because I will not stand to see this abomination with even one star. I don't know why humanity has degraded ourselves to the level of these two, nor do I understand why so many people see these movies so they get p!@%!! off and these two morons make tons of cash. Epic Movie is about as funny, as shoving your head into a dustbin and vomiting or just watching the Irate Gamer. Epic Movie constantly just recreates scenes from other movies with things that ruin any magic the old scenes have, and just end up being an insult to both the film and the audience's intelligence. Don't rent this movie, if someone comes up to you in the street and begs you to take it for free, kill him.

This "thing" that came after its nothing but shining a terrible light on something that started out so pure. I pity anyone who had to work on this movie and wonder about all the careers it must have ruined in the process. This movie is cancer to the movie industry and cancer to its genre, its getting harder and harder for me to see a future where this kind of movie is beloved again. It lived and shall die with a couple of the scary movie's and thats a sad truth. Please don't watch it, i can guarantee you'll come out dumber for the experience.

Better Than Disaster Movie but that is not saying Much. The acting is horrible, no real chemistry, no effort put into line delivery just over the top delivery with stupid dialogue. The cinematography is bad with shots being centered on the actor and nothing going on around them, and everything else being out of frame and cheaply designed sets and costumes. It looks Bad to begin with despite the tons of different exotic locations. The editing is bad also with every new location feeling like there is no flow or consistency to them outside of terrible jokes. The pacing in this awful also because  there really isn't a consistent plot throughout this. Rather things just happen until we get to the second half when it becomes a Nardia parody. The jokes are incredibly bad full of pop culture reference humor popular in the mid 2000's, cheap over the top slapstick, gross out humor, and offensive shock humor at times that feels more offensive than funny. The Plot also is worth mentioning again is nonexistent until like the second half but you could take the first half out of this movie and nothing would be lost. One of the worst comedies ever made easily. Stay Far Away.

There's no way to soften the truth: Epic Movie is a waste of time. It's like a bad issue of Cracked Magazine come to life. It's not so much painful as it is sleep inducing. Bad imitations of beloved movie characters can be funny but not the way they are presented here. The movie is so poorly assembled that it feels like a direct-to-DVD product that ended up with a theatrical release because the January schedule is so threadbare. Even if you love every movie that Epic Movie references, this film will not please, divert, or amuse you. Bad taste and worse jokes abound. Epic Movie's humor isn't tired; it's comatose. After a while, the effect of so much failed humor is numbing.

This is one of the worst comedies I have ever seen and rather than being so bad it's good, it's just plain bad. None of the jokes work, the movies that are being spoofed aren't even actual epic films and it doesn't have any plot. While the Scary Movie...movies had parody stories, they still benefited from its charming cast and still had a tinge of originality to them. In Epic Movie, however, the infamous Friedberg-Seltzer duo I've been hearing so much about seem less interested in making a consistent movie and instead inserting as many pop culture references as possible. The editing is terrible with characters that come out of nowhere and various nonsensical things, an obvious stunt double in one scene and cliched and predictable jokes (example: NACHOOOOOOOO...cheese-flavoured Doritos are delicious. Hardy-har, how much did they pay the Jack Black lookalike for that product placement?). The actors are incredibly cringy especially Jayma Mays as the stupid one out of the four. In fact, I think Friedberg and Seltzer just cast Kal Penn and Jennifer Coolidge for a White Castle joke and a reference to American Pie. If you saw X-Men and Click, you'd know that two "jokes" involving these movies, were already done in the actual movies. And, it gets worse, even when the credits start rolling, they keep you trapped with a mid-credits scene that has V from V for Vendetta for some reason, then there's a parody of the Willy Wonka song from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, then there's a joke involving Mel Gibson in prison. Epic Movie is an epic fail and I strongly advise you stay away from it at all costs. Even Dumb and Dumberer had better jokes than this pile of crap. Didn't get a single laugh out of me.

Epic Movie is yet another shot at the "parody" genre, this time taking a hit at some of the biggest movies ever made in film history. This film could have been great. This film could have been  enjoyable and clever and pretty good. But Jesus CHRIST this film went way too far. Right when the opening sequence for this film was over I absolutely knew what this was going to be: A uncomfortable experience filled with awkward long lasting sequences ruined by completely unfunny pop culture references. And that's really what this entire film was. They went really far with the pop culture references this time and I mean almost every miniute a unfunny pop culture reference was just thrown out to take up running time. Slightly better than "Date Movie", this film was dissapointing because it could have been really smart and well made, but it turned out to be a horrible experience, especially since some well respected actors were in this film and these people have shown before that they can be funny and talented. But no, this film is a low budget unfunny piece of crap, don't waste your time.

Unintentionally scarring a child is about the worst thing a movie could do, in addition to being a bad movie, which it always does.

It's sad that the best this poorly conceived, one trick "satire" can do to mock other BETTER movies is to conjure up unoriginal bawdy humor. The reason that movies like "Naked Gun" and "Airplane" were hilarious and still hold up to this day is, because Leslie Nielson was a total comedic genius, and he could sell all of the wackiness. Seltzer and Friedberg are really bad about latching onto premises that have promise, and then picking the most one-dimensional, unfunny cast possible. This breed of satire isn't funny anymore, because we've seen it a million times before. Look at movies like "Kingsman" or "Cabin In The Woods" or "You're Next," for instance. Those are great movies that entertain on the same level as the movies they're poking fun at, and they don't sacrifice the satire and comedic possibilities. This breed of sophomoric poop and fart humor just is NOT funny.

Sorry in advance about this but to be honest, watching "Epic Movie" is the equivalent of being set on fire in a room full of buckets of diarrhea. Out of the sheer power of the human instinct of survival you'll make it out alive, but afterwards you'll feel dirty, disgusting, smoldering and partially wishing you had simply dropped dead instead. Here is the closest this movie comes to a plot: Lucy (Jayma Mays) finds her adopted father semi-naked on the floor in a way similar to "The Da Vinci Code". He is dying after being attacked by Silas (Kevin Hart) an albino white man that whips himself. After doing a break dance in which he spells out a clue for her, she finds a Golden Ticket (similar to the one from "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory"). The movie switches to Edward (Kal Penn) an orphan living in a Mexican monastery. A parody of "Nacho Libre" gets upset when he doesn't appreciate the food and throws his out of a window. On his way out, he finds a Golden Ticket (but not before Nacho shows off some tasty Doritos, available now at the concession stand!) Next we have Susan (Faune Chambers) who is on a plane when all of a sudden snakes pop out! Cue the Samuel L. Jackson impersonator. Susan is thrown out of the plane, lands on Paris Hilton and finds a Golden Ticket inside the dead celebrity's purse. Finally we have Peter. He's a highschooler and a mutant who is bullied because his mutant power sucks (as the movie spells it out for its audience, he has chicken wings instead of angel wings). He finds a Golden Ticket too and joins the other orphans at Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory. Willy (Crispin Glover) reveals to them that the special ingredients in the chocolate are human body parts. Cue the nut jokes. The children run away inside a magical wardrobe, which brings them to Gnarnia in a spoof of "The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe". Lucy befriends Mr. Tumnus (Hector Jimenez) while Edward is seduced by the White Bitch (Jennifer Coolidge). The children discover that they are actually all brothers and sisters (whatever) and ally themselves against the White Bitch. Edward is captured while the rest of the group enter a training montage at Hogwarts. Peter, Lucy and Susan meet a parody of Aslan named Aslo (played by Fred Willard) in the hopes that together they can formulate a plan to save their brother, and the kingdom of Gnarnia.

There's no reason for anyone, ever to watch this colossal piece of crap. For my own personal reasons I had to, just so I could vow never to watch it again and to write this review but really, why would you even be tempted by this? I watched the unrated version, which at least had the "Snakes on a Plane" spoof done correctly, with the actual wording accurate but how bad does it show that in the theatrical version of the movie, Samuel L. Jackson says "goddamn" instead of "motherfucking"? I counted 9 testicles jokes, 5 piss jokes and 9 other jokes that related to body hair, farts, poop or similar material. When it comes to the spoof segment of the film, several of the jokes don't even make any sense. There's an extended joke where the film makes fun of the actors in the Harry Potter franchise. The joke is that in this film's version of Hogwarts the actors are much older than they should be. Maybe the directors didn't realize that not only are the actors playing Susan, Lucy, Peter and Edward adults themselves (So way off the characters they are spoofing) but the actors in the Harry Potter films were always the same age as their characters (plus maybe a year or two?) so it's just an excuse to have a bunch of ugly people dress up in funny costumes. To the film's credit, that could have actually been a joke. Sometimes it misfires so bad that some of the "funny" moments aren't even jokes or references. When you insert a character named Borat into your movie, you make him look like Sasha Baron Cohen and you give him lines like "This is my sister, she is number one prostitute in Gnargnia" that isn't a reference, that's just plagiarism. While we're at it, how do you make fun of a movie like "Snakes on a Plane" which not only ran its own joke into the ground before the movie was released in theatres but was a parody in itself? I get a head ache just reading my notes about the movie.

Everything could be forgiven if this film was actually humorous but it isn't. There are two jokes in the whole hour and thirty-two minute running time that might actually make you smile. One is a reference to White Castle. Kal Penn was in "Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle", so that's an actual joke. I didn't laugh, but I recognize the effort. They later run that one into the ground, but I'll give them that. The other running joke, which is the poor production and special effects, does work. They make absolutely no attempt to make the stunt doubles look like the actual actors, the special effects are terrible and even the sets look cheap. It's probably a way to mask the fact that making an actual spoof of an epic would cost hundreds of thousands of dollars but I did laugh at the cheap, fake-looking dead cat and the obvious beaver puppet. Were my standards just falling so low that out of desperation my mind latched onto these moments? Who knows.

The movie was pretty much doomed from the start because the two directors/writers Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer are two mentally deranged idiots that can't make a good comedy to save their own lives. The blame does not rest solely on their shoulders though. Who green-lit a project named "Epic Movie" that contains spoofs of Shrek, Mel Gibson, Ghost Busters, Click, Tivo, Bobby Beats Whitey, Punk'd, Brittney Spears, Star Wars, 50 Cent, "Get Crunk", Rick James, Rocky, Batman, MTV Cribs, Laguna Beach, Dr. Phil, Casino Royale, Talladega Nights, Brad & Angelina, Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift, Siegfried & Roy and insurance commercials? There's maybe one or two of those that could be considered grand, action packed films that could be considered epic in the sense that they blow you away and have to be seen on the big screen to be appreciated but for the most part, what do any of those have to do with Epic Movies? While we're at it, who actually remembers half of those references now that it's been 6 years since the movie has been released?

You've heard enough. Just from the Dvd cover or any trailer you can tell this limp comedy is about as unfunny as finding your pet stuffed inside a blender. Even the ending of the film is incredibly lazily put together thanks a Deus ex Machina that's allows our "heroes" to win. As far as I'm concerned, if you like this or even think it "isn't that bad", if you complain that I "spoiled too much" or you are willing to give this movie a chance despite all of the negative press it's been given you need to really re-evaluate your taste in everything and I really hope you grow out of it because otherwise we can't be friends anymore. Any movie that references "Scar Face" by playing "Say Hello to my Little Friend" over and over almost automatically gets the lowest score imaginable and boy, this one deserves every insult it's got coming. (Unrated version on Dvd, September 14, 2013)

I liked the Scary Movies (even the 4th one gave me a few laughs), Date Movie was a real let down but this is just horrible. Only two mildly funny bits- the Cribs ripoff (complete with flatscreens in the toilet bowl) and the bit where Kanye West popped up and said the White Bitch didn't care about black people. After that, nothing. Just a whole bunch of unfunny jokes and cringe worthy musical numbers. Were these guys trying to make a comedy or a musical? It's like they saw Idlewild and thought the idea of a 'hip-hop musical' was good, so all of a sudden everyone in the film starts breakdancing for no reason, scratch decks materialise out of thin air and everyone starts rapping. And this happens every five minutes. It's pathetic and definitely not funny. Some advice for Mr '2 of the 6 writer of Scary Movie'- cut out all the dumbass 'whiteys trying to be black' musical numbers. Instead, focus on writing some decent jokes, link them together with a serviceable story and your next film may be almost watchable.

rt_summary: Four adult orphans (Kal Penn, Adam Campbell, Faune Chambers, Jayma Mays) have an incredible adventure in a spoof of blockbuster and fantasy films. They visit a bizarre confectioner's chocolate factory and enter a mythic realm in which they must help a wise but lusty lion rid the land of a witchy woman.
meta_summary: The twisted minds of two of the six writers of "Scary Movie" tackle the biggest mega-blockbusters of all time in Epic Movie.
